text: We read the reviews and thought we would try it.  The wait staff was super friendly and efficient.  They have a Sunday night special, Tbone for 9.99.  They rolls and cornbread is awesome.  We will definitely go back.  The casino was not that smoky.  That is an added bonus.

A great place for early morning steak and eggs. $4.99 from 1am to 5am, $8.99 till 11am. Servers were fast and efficient, but very busy most of the time so you'd need to catch their attention. Cafe's furnishings are dated but in the middle of the night, you'd wouldn't really care. Menu is huge, i've yet to try anything else. Came here twice in a week to have their steak and eggs. Well cooked steak (medium), sunny side up eggs with potato hash. Will be trying the all-you-can-eat crab legs for $19 tonight. (only on Fridays for dinner).

Don't bother! My husband and I went late on a Friday evening, well late for dinner that is, we were seated at 905 I order wasn't taken until after 925 and by 945 our table was still empty no bread no one checked on us, what made it worse was two women that walked in after us we served immediately and we're eating when we finally decided to leave with out our food coming our. Worst part is we informed management and all they said was that terrible so sorry as we were walking out, needless never again.
If you stay at Tuscany Suites in Vegas, you can get 50% off coupon. Not fancy but good enough. The taste of grilled tilapia and prime rib were OK.

My husband and I love love marilyn's cafe!  He get's the steak and I get the prime rib, we also love the garden salad and shrimp cocktail. This may will be our 3rd year in a row staying at Tuscany (because we love it) and our 3rd year in a row eating at Marilyn's Cafe. Honestly as we plan our trip in Vegas this is always our first anniversary dinner choice. You gotta try it! Delicious!
All our food was good. Esther was pleasant and paid attention to the kids and made sure our orders were delivered promptly. Good experience and would come back again.
Had the eggs benedict eggs cooked to perfection hash browns on the side I highly recommend this place very good food the coffee is very good too

Omg! So glad I found this place on yelp!! Delicious!!! Visited for breakfast on Sunday November 9, 2014. Best scrambled eggs with cheese!! Perfectly cooked, nice and moist. Pancakes were perfect, hash browns and sausage perfectly cooked! Server was a sweetheart too. Entire bill came out to 12 bucks!! Cheap and good!! Highly recommend!!! I'll be back!!
T bone steak is fantastic with a good price. BBQ ribs and chicken are awesome. Great place to dine. Good customer service. Very friendly and accommodating.

We had 2 breakfasts here during our stay at the hotel.  Very good both times.  I especially enjoyed the eggs benedict with perfectly cooked hash browns.  Thumbs up for the hollandaise sauce they serve.. good prices too.

I say this every time I'm in vegas.. "I come to Vegas mainly for the $5 steak and eggs." This is the place to be. Granted, I haven't tried enough steak n egg places to know this is the best, but this is my go-to spot on most of my drunken nights. They have the $5 deal from 10pm-5am I think, usually seating is always available too! Service is fast and friendly. If you come here and don't get the steak and eggs, you should just stop coming to vegas. I always get the medium rare steaks with over-easy eggs, and sometimes one plate isn't even enough... #drool lol

The few times I've driven here, parking has always been available, but if you come here in a Taxi, getting one to go back to your hotel is harder. Just go to the front desk and have the worker call you a taxi, cause they rarely wait at Tuscany lol 

Enjoy!

Ok I don't want to get into too much detail, but look up the symptoms for Salmonella poisoning, both my friend and I had all of the symptoms within 36 hours of eating chicken at this place.  More egregious, was the service.

First, we decided to try to expand out lunch options.  There was a $10 off coupon in the local paper and the place is located near UNLV where we both work.  When we got there and were seated, we were optimistic when we saw the variety of options on the menu, we were confident that we had found a new lunch spot.

Sooooo at 12:05 we still hadn't receive my chicken Caesar wrap with sweet potatoes waffle fries or my friend's grilled chicken salad.  Nor had we seen the waitress or bus boy to refresh our drinks, that was until they walked into the room from some obscure place together after a half hour. . .We flagged them both down asked for drink refills twice and to please check on our meals as we were on our lunch hour.

Out came my meal with waffle fries that were not even warm to the touch. I sent them back and ate half of my wrap.  It had kind of an odd taste but I attribute it to strong feta cheese.

My friend asked for no dressing with her salad but asked for vinegar . . . The waitress brought her a bottle with about a quarter inch of brown liquid in it and said this is vinegar.  It wasn't.  It was soy sauce, so that went back. . .

We asked to talk to the manager; we had to ask four people to speak to the manager until he finally begrudgingly came over.  He began with "You are already unhappy so there is nothing I can say to make it better"  That is it. . .He would not even take care of the worse meal I have ever eaten in my life. . .which lead to 3 days of major illness.

STAY AWAY.

Food is edible but nothing like the other reviews stated about the good prices and good food. The meal we came for per review was $5 more. The food sounds amazing on the menu. It is just poor quality so it doesn't turn out very well. Also the turkey pot pie I ordered was more like a thick, grey looking mash with a piece of bread on top. I love any kind of pot pie and but this shouldn't even be considered a pot pie. My husbands meal was equally poor. Also poor service; drinks remained empty through entire meal. But if you're looking for something edible, this is your place.
Great food.  The best waiter ever is James. Very nice courteous funny and sweet. Great food drunk or sober!
We were a group of 12 and sat us right away ... Awesome service , great food ..great prices...deff would come back ...

Well, it is convenient if you gamble at the Casino, but then you also get the ciggy smoke as the restaurant shares the same space.

Staff was friendly.  

Food was :meh; - some items definitely tasted of the can or mix - disappointed in the crab cakes, but the sides were all good and the veggies were fresh.  Agree with some other reviewers here, the cole slaw is the best of the sides.  Breakfast another day was the French Toast plate, OK but I asked for all bacon and got bacon and sausages... and the coffee was nothing special.  Portion size was ample but not overwhelming, best value when using 1/2 off coupons.
Service was fantastic.  We had the all you can eat crab legs and they kept them coming.  Hard to beat the price.

We recently stayed at the Tuscany and this restaurant was inside the casino attached to the hotel, and  this place was recommended to us by a friend.

The fact they have breakfast 24 hrs/day earns them 3 stars right off the bat.  The fact that the breakfast was tasty and excellent gives them another star.

I tried their sausage Benedict with grits, it came with a biscuit and gravy and some hash browns.  Firstly, very large portion, you can't leave hungry.  I wasn't too big on the grits but the rest was so tasty I wish I had room for more.

And the coffee?  Well this is the USA....so it was excellent.  Rich, strong and tasty, what a treat from the Canadian brown water we are subjected to.  Maybe this is why I travel the US so frequently, I love the quality of food.

And the prices...unbelievable.  Starting at $3.99 for endless pancakes.

My meal with coffee came to $10.00.

Other bonuses...free wi-fi, nearby casino, nearby patio = heaven!

Will come back for sure!

The lady at my hotel gave Marilyn's a good recommendation for dinner. So I checked the reviews at yelp which were also good. Unfortunately it was not good at all.

The restaurant is in the back of the Tuscany Casino. It looks nice, sort of like an upscale coffee shop. The server was a little slow to take my order, which was surprising since there were only two people in his section at the time. I ordered the chicken parmesan, which came with garlic toast and spaghetti; no other sides. The wait for the food seemed a little long; again surprising since the crowd wasn't very big. 

The meal was a huge disappointment. I never thought there could be too much cheese on Chicken Parmesan but boy was I wrong. It was completely smothered in goopy greasy mozz. The chicken was obviously a frozen reheat. The pasta was overcooked and soggy (honestly I'm usually okay with overcooked pasta, but not soggy). The sauce was the worst; it definitely tasted canned, almost Chef Boyardee-ish. Yuck!! The only positive was the dinner rolls that were brought to me half way through the meal. The service throughout the meal remained mediocre.

I was tempted to give them a one star... but to be honest, most of the people around me were ordering the prime rib (which was on special) or breakfast items. The prime rib with the salad and baked potato looked delicious and everyone seemed to be enjoying their breakfasts. And as you can see there is a multitude of positive reviews here at Yelp.  So I gave them the benefit of the doubt and TWO STARS.

Update: Not sure why, but I went back for breakfast a few days later.  The breakfast wasn't bad.  Again, the place was busy and everybody seemed to be very happy with their meals.  So, maybe I was just unlucky with the Chicken Parm.  However, the two stars still stands.

Awesome! Servers were friendly and helpful. Great size portions, my 3 sons didn't leave hungry. Great price near the strip. Food has good flavor, I thought the 3.99 all you could eat pancakes were a pleasant surprise.

The atmosphere here was really dreary and depressing. Most of the staff looked absolutely miserable. Our waitress was inattentive and had to be reminded to bring us part of our meal. Seemed like she was drunk, too, but who knows. The drinks that we ordered were on the weak side. Everything took a long time. The food came out hot and was good, and the prices are fair. I want to give them 3 stars because the food was good, but I feel that 3 stars implies that I might return here. Wouldn't go back.
Good food fast and great service. No kids menu but one order was great to split between the two kids. No wait to sit down.  Leaving happy.
Great food, drinks and service. Best place we've had breakfast while staying in Vegas. We will definitely be back again.
I miss Tuscany ever since I moved. This place was a late night favorite for me after all the geeky magic get together a. Everything is fairly priced and delicious. The steak and eggs are a must!

Decided to eat here before heading back to Long Beach based on the 4 star review on Yelp. 

I honestly can not figure out how this got an overall rating of 4 stars. My wife ordered a T-Bone breakfast and I ordered a New York Strip breakfast. 

We both ordered the steaks medium-well but my wife's steak came out rare and my was overcooked and tough as leather. 

The eggs, hash browns, and toast were average noting spectacular on par with a Denny's or Norms. 

The service was ok, it took awhile for us to receive our check. 

I really hate that my first review was a negative one, but I really don't want anyone to see the 4 star rating and think it's a great place because unfortunately it is just below average.
Ok food. Breakfast is ok. Very slow Service.... Nice place if you don't want to leave the hotel or casino.

I'm here.. After a night of partying ... How many times have I been to this cafe ? I lost count! Seriously ! Amazing wait staff and food is to the point!
  If its an early morning: get the Steak and eggs! Never fails!  If its dinner time: I like the half BBQ chicken and ribs; get the green beans ! Has bacon in it! Didn't think they would add that flavor element did you!?   
  So if you are on the strip. Want some affordable food and great service!? Marilyn's Cafe it is!
Went here twice, once for lunch and then for breakfast the next morning. Everything I was soaked with grease and had little to no flavor..-all in all it was Mediocre service and bad food.

Keeping a quiet night here in Vegas so I decided to order room service for a quick dinner. Pleasantly surprised, Grilled Pork Chops ($10.99) - both 8 oz chops are well cooked and well seasoned. All entrees are served with two side items of your choice. I ordered steamed broccoli and apple sauce along with a side garden salad ($2.99) and a last minute impulse order of cornbread ($2.69) - which is hot, buttery, and sweet served with whipped salty butter.  Ps. All of their portions are huuuuuge.  If you are looking to grab a quick filling bite with immediate service, Marilyn's Cafe gets a thumb up in my book. 

* Room service hours run from 6am-10pm
* $10 minimum service fee
* 18% gratuity

Great breakfast. We had "the big winner" (2 eggs (ours nicely poached), two sausages, bacon, big hunk of grilled ham, hash browns/grits, 2 slices toast, two pancakes and great service (thanks Elvis) all for $8.99. Coffee$2.29, Lg Juice $3.50. Excellent and not at all greasy.

Okay, this is definitely a hard place to avoid. I went back after 2 weeks since the 'no service' experience and sad face review. This time I made sure to request to be seated in my top choices of servers' area (I know them by name since I go there a lot). What I conclude is that  one time was a fluke but if it was my first experience I would've never gone back.  Anyway, all is good after I make the precaution of where to sit. 

Food: as great as usual so here's a general list of things that I have ordered before.

Coffee: The most important thing during breakfast - awesome. I'm not sure where they get the beans but IMO, it's better than Einstein's Bagels selection and it's better then Egg Works. Not that the other 2 is bad, I just like this coffee more.

Steak and Egg breakfast special: One of the best choice you can ask for if you are a steak fan. Every time I have ordered it it's made to perfection of the medium rare. The steak is lightly seasons so some people may want to add more. I've never been a fan of hash brown but this place makes it good. You get a choice of pancakes or toast.

Marilyn Starter: No way a person can get it wrong. Generic breakfast of eggs, sausage, bacon and pancakes. Ordered it a few times but only once that they over did the salt.

Grits - just right consistency. Great with butter and adding a bit of salt. 

Country Fried Steak: First time having CFS. Steak was moist and the batter was good. Would recommend.

Quiche: I had one with ham, pepper and onions and it came with a fruit cup. Probably the only thing I have ever gotten that I didn't really like. I was not a fan of the crust.

Sweet Potato Waffle Fries: A-mazing! Partial bias because by default I love anything with sweet potato. Still awesome to try.

Biscuits and gravy: Was a bit cold when I got the plate. Gravy is not bad but I think it would be better if it had some bits of sausages in there or just something else to add on the mushy texture.

Country Sausage Lovers Bowl: Aside from food coma in the middle of eating i. it's really good. Heaviest meal I've ever gotten from here. For $9 it fed me for 2 meals. 

Grilled Chicken & Eggs: Usually a gamble when it comes to chicken but the chef had chicken breast moist and tender and lightly seasoned.

Overall: Just give this place a try, you can't go wrong.

Been here twice and have only ordered one thing: $3.99 steak and eggs. Will you believe me if I say the steak is pretty tasy, even when I'm sober?  Ok, I've never tried it sober but I imagine it would be just as good. Get the sourdough toast and slab the orange maramalade and butter ontop. 

Greasy, drunk food on the cheap. Gotta love it.
Great place for breakfast. Good portion sizes and great prices for Vegas. Our waiter,  Arnold, was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Highly recommend.

Great place to come after a night of clubbing. Cheap food, the quality is just OK. Last time I went, service took forever. I mean ridiculously forever. Our waitress kept on apologizing for the wait. i think shes new or just overwhelmed. They usually have their steak and eggs special, which is by far a popular dish amongst my friends. Biscuits and gravy is pretty good too.

We stayed at the Platinum hotel so we just walked over to the Tuscany. We were seated immediately and our waiter Arnold was very attentive. He definitely gave us great customer service.

I ordered 2 pancakes (which btw was a very good price) with blueberries and strawberries on top! They were surprisingly better than IHOP! I was very pleased.

My boyfriend had also ordered the steak and egg. For $13 you get huge portions of steak, egg, hashbrowns, and toast. You get a good amount of food and quality for the price you pay.

The setting is very welcoming and home-y! Overall very happy we chose marilyns!

Loud loud disco Muzak. Dirty table camouflage pattern. Artificial creamer. Terrible and luke warm coffee. Sent back to microwave. Seriously?  One pleasant waitress. Water was good and cold in a sparkling glass. Coffee mug was cracked and chipped through. Strange square shaped cup and saucer. Eggs cooked well. Steak watery as they tend to be after being thawed by it worked. Plenty of Heinz catsup on table.  Grits were watery and tasteless but at least not over cooked and lumpy. They also did the job. English muffin was toasted to perfection and buttered.  All in all an ok breakfast but wouldn't bother with a return engagement. Not sure why first review listed was 4 years old and sold me on "cheap eats". "Steak and eggs" for $3.99. Ooooh, those were the days!  At least after being microwaved the coffee retained its heat for about 20 minutes.   I've had worse but next time I'll spend the $10 of breakfast tab on the tables. LOL!!   Hello Las Vegas!
Super rapport qualité prix, idéal pour un petit déjeuner,  l'endroit n'est pas des plus agréable car dans un coin du casino,  mais bonne adresse à Las Vegas.
Easy Mac from Kraft...the kind in a pack with the powder. Seriously, that is what they gave me for my macaroni side. Someone tell me WHY this place has more than 1 star. YUCK!

4 stars for the menu variety, food quality and value
2 stars for the service
Don't eat here unless you have lots of time to kill
Server just disappeared on us....like 20 minutes
Other than that, she was nice, just ghostly
Once she came back, I had my credit card in hand, and have it to her.....she came back with the bill?  C'mon....I've got things to do!
Reasonably priced breakfast in Vegas. No wait and the food was all tasty. Might be a bit difficult to find if you're looking for a standalone building because it is actually inside the Tuscany.
Service is excellent. Bread was over buttered. Nice little cafe with good prices. Food was overall good.
Good food for a casino breakfast. Good service and fairly cheap. Easy seating quick service, in and out

Went to Marilyn's Café on Friday for their all you can eat crab legs. Have been there before, and the food was good, but the servers were so busy they couldn't spend much time. Sort of threw food at you. This time though, John, our server, was outstanding. He was right there when we sat down, asked for our drink order and didn't wait for the busser to bring them. Asked if we were still having crab legs, as we go there EVERY FRIDAY for them. We said yes, and he brought the bucket, my extra lemon and extra napkins before we even ordered it. Dinner was served promptly and he kept the crab legs coming, even asking if I wanted more just before I was finished with first order so second order would be there right as I was done. (So we wouldn't have to wait, since they were so busy). John is one of the best servers in the bunch. We have been there numerous times at different days and times since we are locals, and John ALWAYS knows what we are drinking and usually has some idea of what we are going to want to eat. He makes sure our drinks are always full, and if the bussers are busy he even clears the table so we don't have a bunch of plates piling up. If you want excellent food and extraordinary and attentive service, GO TO MARILYN'S CAFE AND ASK FOR JOHN.(he only works nights)
We come here every year after the EDC - usually around 5:00 or 6:00am. The food is always great and the service even better.

It seems a hidden place in Las Vegas. I wish more people would know about this place. We always came here for Steak. I love T-bone here, but New York steak is amazing too. 
Price: Denny's 
Quality: Outback Steakhouse 
Nice service 
What else could you ask for!!?!!

I'm from the south. The country fried steak was on point! The grits were watery, but good. Eggs, phenomenal! Service, spot on. Hashbrowns, tasty. Coffee was mediocre but drinkable. It's more pricy than its listed, more like $$ but no big deal. Decor is relaxing and comfortable.

There is absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Grease? Yes, lots of it, oozing out of every porous surface and slathered thick and frothy. I must have had four grilled cheese sandwiches over the course of the weekend, each time with mashed potatoes and gravy so I could dip each bite of that buttery-ass sandwich into the gravy. I also had the fish and chips, though ALSO with mashed potatoes and gravy, as well as green beans, which, God bless Marilyn's Cafe, had bits of bacon in it. And grease.

Service was snappy and friendly, even when the place was packed to the gills with geriatrics and hungry drunks. They made a minor error with a to go order but quickly resolved it.

Even if I don't stay at Tuscany again, I think I'd still consider eating every meal here.

Decent food and big portions. Slow but friendly service. Have to walk through the smoky casino to get to the cafe. They have a service charge of 18% if you have 6 or more people (which I think is ridiculous!).

I was very impressed with this cafe. I expected food portions to be a small since it is Vegas. That is the opposite. The value here is great and the food quality is even better! I will no doubt be back again on my next visit.

Stayed at Tuscany on a business training event this week and decided to give Marilyn's a try.
The service was excellent and my waitress was very friendly and caring.
The Fitness Scramble was cooked to perfection and I could not ask for anything more for the price.
The coffee was ehh, but I am a coffee snob!
Most people around me ordered the Steak and Eggs and it seemed to be a hit!
I would definitely recommend giving Marilyn's a try!

If you look past the messy tables that were left behind by big parties, this place is a gem! The plates are a generous size. You also pay a lot less when compared to a regular diner. My boyfriend and I eat out A LOT. Yet, we only tackled half of our entrees.  This cafe is open 24 hours, which is extremely convenient. The servers are attentive and have such a welcoming personality. 

Keep in mind that checks cannot be split after 10 PM.

Disappointed! Pot roast dry, mac&cheese is out of a Kraft box, clam chowder tasteless. Service awful, server not rude, she took our order, brought our food, gave us our chk, & nothing more! & even though we sat near a main aisle, where she passed ever few mins, she never asked how things were & how we were doing, she didn't even refill our drinks. There's a flip menu on the table, saying u get a free dessert if a dessert tray isn't brought to u, I have never turned down a free offer, this time I did, I couldn't wait to leave. First & last visit ever.
Huge menu had breakfast, standard fare cooked well not a long wait with great service.    Wonderful place for simplicity, service and value.  I will go back.

The service is great, the restaurant is clean, and the food is awesome.  I am not a pancake person, but I always get the blueberry pancakes and they are perfect.  I also like the biscuits and gravy and les be honest - after a night of partying they hit the spot.  

I also like the fact I can walk up and get an OJ to go.

This place was great for being open at 1 o'clock in the morning and for the value of the food. We had the eggs and steak and hashbrowns for five dollars which is a fantastic deal. We did have a trouble ordering a beer for some reason it confused the staff. We waited quite a while for the food but we had no complaints given it was so late and we were so hungry. The value and the atmosphere were good. One thing I would not recommend if you are sensitive to smoke - there was a lot of cigarette smokers inside the casino. 

Food quality was really only 3.5 stars.
Great service and delicious food. I had the French toast with banana strawberry and blueberries. 5,50$. Great value.

We stayed at Tuscany Suites and ate twice at Marilyns. Customer service was phenomenal. Price was great. Dinner for two, steak and 2 sides, 2 pork chops with 2 sides and 2 soft drinks = $45 plus tip. Breakfast under $20. They have dinner specials that are ridiculously cheap but we ate too late for those and they have ayce pancakes for $3.99. Wait staff was attentive, friendly....restaurant clean and nice Tuscan theme. Also get 2 for 1 meal on Thursdays with reasonable casino play.

Ask for James! For sure he works Friday and Saturday late nights. He makes four AM seems like any time of the day and has GREAT local suggestions!

$5.99 for Steak & Eggs (Wheat bread, medium rare steak, over medium eggs for me please!) A perfect place to venture out to after the club at 4AM to help ease the hangover you may have the next day. My favorite part are the crispy hash browns that come with your meal! 

Only one time has our service not been great & it was probably because James was not our waiter. A friend was baffled because he had some blue pieces of fat and let the waitress know. She kind of apologized, but also didn't care. "It's just the blue stamp they put on meat sometimes" & he asked, "Shouldn't they cut it off though?" & she kind of just blew him off. We get it, it's late and tips aren't great on cheap meals.

They do not do split checks between the hours of 4PM & 5AM! So bring cash or bring a friend that has a high credit card balance and Venmo.

A rare find in LV: good food, inexpensive.  Wives had the lobster and steak spedial $13.  I had the prime rib $14.  Friend had the strip steak $14.

All was served hot.  The food was delicious and the two sides were selected from a list of 18 items.  I chose the mac and cheese and this was the best I ever had at a restaurant.  May be the best band for the buck in LV

Found this little gem on Yelp while looking for a breakfast spot.  My first surprise was the coffee.  It was not burnt, it did not taste old or bitter.  It was fresh and good tasting.  The menu prices are not bad at all!  The amount of food for the price you pay is great! Been here for 4 days and this is my second morning in a row coming here!  I totally recommend this place.  There is a slight wait to get your food once you have ordered but other than that, it's a great place! Enjoy!

I can only imagine that most of the 4-5 star reviews here were written by drunken-late-night vacationers staying at the Tuscany.  We had a poorly prepared breakfast with weak coffee and limited service - cannot recommend.
Fantastic! It's located in the Tuscany Suite & Casino. Incredible quality food for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Excellent service. Ate nine meals here! Great prices.

My boyfriend and I dined here twice during our visit to Las Vegas, once for dinner and once for breakfast. When we dined for dinner we both chose pizza and I got a personal sized veggie pizza. The size was perfect and the pizza was very good. Our server even made us some drinks to take with us which we both really appreciated. The second time we came for breakfast and that was good as well. I got chocolate chip pancakes, and they were delicious but rich. Overall the menu had a great variety and prices were reasonable. Dine here, and you'll be sure to find something for everyone!

I give it a three-star because that says "A-OK."  My wife and I enjoyed breakfast here (once we found it in the rear of the Casino).  I had the Complete French Toast and she had the Meat Lover's Bowl.  Standard breakfast fare, nicely prepared and tasted like it was supposed to - eggs, sausage, bacon and French toast.  My wife's order came with a side of two (2) nice fluffy pancakes.  She said the breakfasts were "Yummy!"  There was enough food that we both ended up taking a sizable portion as carry out.  

I had a cup of coffee (I won't get that again - it didn't taste very good and they give you the creamer that comes in those little pull-tab plastic dealies).

Looks like they also take call-in orders as there is a "pick-up take-out" window.

Both meals including the coffee came to just under $22.00.  We would come back again.

$5.99 for a (approximately) 12 oz. steak, 2 eggs, hash browns, and 4 pieces of toast. Whether you win or lose on the strip, it's a great place to celebrate or eat your sorrows away, respectively.

I don't know if there are better locales and how Marilyn's compares, but if I'm ever back in Vegas, you'll find me here after midnight.

There's only reason I come here. STEGGS! I love my steak well done with over medium eggs and extra crispy hash browns with a side of wheat toast. Can't imagine a better end to a long night. Their midnight steak and egg special is just SIX DOLLARS. Like really where else can you get steak and eggs for $6? 

Of all the Steggs places in Vegas, this is the only one that you don't have to be 21 to eat at yay! They don't do spilt checks though so bring cash or hope that someone you're eating with got money in the bank that you can pay back later for picking up the tab.

Went here to eat based on the reviews and I will not go back food was very bad service was terrible.when the food came it was cold asked the server for coffee she never came back for about 20 minutes asked her for cream for the coffee and napkins she never came back had to go to the hostess and ask again after 20 minutes the hostess then came with sour cream instead of creamer.would not recommend this place to anyone

When you can finally get up from the blackjack table and slot machines....... Give this cafe a try. 

The staff is the most kind and helpful group you will ever meet. The manager that runs the place is the most fun loving and cheek kisser to boot.. I love how clean an organized the place is.   

OK on to the food I love snow crab legs, but since I move here I have only seen cold snow crab legs that got to be a sin (checking my bible lol) This place right here let me repeat this place right here.  Awwwwwwsome snow crab legs!!!! The legs are fresh, large and precracked.......... ALL YOU CAN EAT!  So give a try if you are a seafood lover like myself.

$5 Steak and eggs?! I'm in! This little gem is located in the read of the Tuscany Suites Hotel & Casino. There is free parking in the front lot as well. At midnight, this cafe has a special for $5: New York Steak, two eggs, 4 pieces of toast, and hash browns. If I lived in Vegas, I would definitely be coming back here more often because it's a quality meal for cheap!

Had a late night meal after the Jennifer Lopez concert. Our server James was the BEST! He was very professional, very personable & very attentive. The portions are HUGE & the prices are more than resonable. The restaurants at the Tuscany Garden Hotel and Suites does not believe in small portions. The food was very good. Thank you James for making us feel at home. I highly recommend Marilyns Cafe to everyone.

Decent Steak and Eggs.
Great Atmosphere.

Would definitely eat again!

Thanks for the good time!

Steak & Eggs. Best thing to get after midnight and it's only $5.00! Steak was juicy, hash browns were good, toast was how it should be, and eggs were cooked exactly how I asked them to be. Service was alright and food took a while to get.

I went to Tuscany on Flamingo Rd the restaurant there Marilyn's served us cold food. Under my steak was a short black hair. Right away less than 10 mins after getting our food I told the front cashier since our server was no where in sight after waiting 10 mins more she came to our table. I showed her the hair and she did not apologize but asked if I wanted something else (obviously I said no) and she walked away. Me and my friend sat there for 15 mins and decided to just leave. We walked outside and security came after us. I explained what happen and they said I had to speak with the manager. When we asked if the manager could come outside so it wouldn't cause us an embarrassing scene they threaten to call the police repeatedly. We went back inside. The manager was not waiting for us. It was the waitress with our check telling me that we walked out on our bill and I put my own hair into my food.  I told her my plate was barely touched. My hair is very long and black and my friends hair is very curly long and brown. The hair is pretty short, it was found under my steak and it had the root on it. This is why I was sure it was not my own hair. After accusing me the waitress walked away and I had to ASK a manager be called. I ASKED the cashier to call the police since my food was tampered with but he stated they could not call the police we would have to (after we were threaten several times that they would call on us). The manager arrived and wasn't told that a hair was in my food or that I notified two people before we left. He had to go find the waitress and confirm that information. He returned and told me no one in the back has long hair. At that point I asked him to look at the plate with the hair on it. He immediately looked at the hair and the food that was completely untouched and apologized and told us the bill is covered. We demanded security stop following us. It was a horrible experience. The customer service was terrible. If they sent security after us then a manager should have been notified, if a guest complains a hair is in the food a manager should be notified. I should not have been left at a table for 15 mins with no indication that the waitress would return nor resolution. It is poor customer service. Disrespectful to patrons. I will NEVER go to this place again. I will let everyone I know travelling to Vegas this year not to go here.
I went on Friday & had the all you can eat crab legs & they were amazing. Speedy  & excellent customer service.

When I went, I caught them at a pretty bad time. The host said that they're kitchen staff was running unusually slow, so many others and I had to wait inordinately long. When we finally got sat down, the waiter was very nice and easy going! He helped us get the best deals for what we wanted. Unfortunately, when I got my $6 steak and eggs, it was totally under seasoned. Luckily, there was table salt and pepper, so I was able to get it to taste right.
Our server was Tara. Amazing service! So friendly and helpful to our party of ten. We all had steak and eggs, and so bomb dot com for the price of 5.99! Hosts were also friendly!
A great place to go eat slightly off the strip on flamingo Road & their open 24hrs aday

You have to go on Friday's for their all you can eat crab legs! Best kept secret in town (sorry I'm ruining it.) such quick service, the hosts are awesome at getting you seated quickly, and you get so much food for a good price. I love it here.

You get what you pay for, so when you get the munchies after a long night this is the place to be. Not too fancy but the service is great once you get seated and the food didn't take too long to come out either. 

The restaurant is known for their steak and eggs special which at least one party of our group got. I like to explore the menu and last time I got a club sandwich and frie, tasted average and nothing special. This time I decided to be a little "healthy" and get the spinach, mushroom omelette with feta cheese. It was cooked perfectly and I love the taste the feta brings because it elevates the dish. But the all time winner is the sourdough toast.. its the perfect toast... It's warm, crunchy, and you can always always taste the butter..mmm mmm mmm, slap on strawberry jam and you won't be able to stop eating... I had no guilt what so ever eating those carbs, well worth it.

Over an hour wait for breakfast from the time we ordered. The waitress acknowledged our wait time 45 minutes since the waitress waited to put our food order in our food ticket only showed we were waiting 25 minutes. I spoke with the manager and she said with our food ticket in hand we had only been waiting 25 minutes so I told her the waitress did not put I order in when we ordered. The only thing offered was would you like me to box up your food? Unacceptable !

I chose this place to go to for breakfast because we had a large family and I was looking for great breakfast deals plus good pancakes. It was to my surprise that none of that really applied to this place. 
The customer service was ok and our server was funny to say the most but the food was just OK. Nothing really to call home and tell Mama about . I ordered pancakes for my son and they were just mediocre. I really wish that I had just gone to IHOP but the ones out there received such bad ratings that I was willing to try something new as I usually am. 
The bathroom was clean and the restaurant didn't smell completely like the casino so that was a plus in my book seeing as though I'm from LA and can not stand the smoking laws out there. 
I'm a foodie but I don't mess around when it comes to my food  I most likely will never go here again.

I feel like their midnight and after steak and eggs deal price went up, but whatevers since it's still around $5 haha!  Every time in Vegas I NEED to eat here or somewhere that has steak and eggs because it almost feels like tradition.  If I didn't it'd be taboo or something and my weekend wouldn't receive a blessing haha jk I'm just being a dork.  The service is always good and my boyfriend says that he feels like the steaks are shrinking in size or getting thinner, but $5 food is $5 food and I'm not complaining!

just tryna get my fix for the week about to eat a whole sea full of crab . with sum sides of loaded baked potato after i eat this ill b slumpted for the evening ...wish i could tell my fellow yelpers about the rest of the menu but unfortunately this all i kno bout this place . didnt even wanna tell yawl this much but i decided to bless yawl with this gem

We came in around 12:30 am for the steak and eggs special. It was okay. I mean it's definitely worth what you pay for. I really like their toasts. This is located in Tuscany Hotel. I think this is a good and cheap place to go to for a late night munch!

Definitely a fan.

The food was above average for an excellent price.

I was confused on where it was, but it is in the casino/resort.

Go to the back......... park..... enter and eat.

One of the best bargains we have found in Vegas.  Good quality food at a reasonable price.  We ate here twice during our recent stay, for dinner and lunch, on 03/11/18 and 03/13/2018.  Stand-outs were the prime rib, shrimp cocktail, and meatloaf.  Our waitress Wendy was great.

We stayed at the Tuscany suites for 3 days and every day we came in to eat here and it was DELICIOUS. Usually I would never go to the same restaurant three times but this place was phenomenal and very affordable. 
They have a different special every day!

My first meal was the prime rib with the mashed potatoes and it was so great! The gravy on the potatoes was amazing. Must try!!
I finished off with the turtle cheesecake but they had a whole tray with all different types of things to try. 

The Marilyn's starter breakfast was a great deal and very tasty. I loved the sausage links and the pancakes the most


To finish off on our last night here on a Wednesday they had a Steak and lobster special for 13.99!!! Yes you ready that right 13.99.... the cheapest I've ever seen and it was the perfect amount of food. 
Must try the honey carrots and Mac and cheese

Also- if you are a guest at the Tuscany suites they will give you coupons for 2-1 drinks here as well! So pleased with this joint and I WILL be back!!!!
Chicken Fried Steak...good. Steak and Eggs...good. Prices are reasonable. Staff is friendly and attentive. Good place to recover from a hangover. Oh, and coffee is good.

Have been there twice now on their All You Can Eat Crab night. The food, the service, the atmosphere (buffet) are all superb! The Manager, Aldo Mencatto, and his staff are fun, courteous, helpful, and attentive. The food is fantastic. And the price - well, you can't go wrong. Definitely a place I look forward to visiting again.

I suggest ordering pizza - the handmade pizza's here are to die for!

The turkey ruben was a 4 star sandwich and I also tasted the patty melt which was pretty darn good also.

The servers are a bit slow, and the smoke from the casino is a bit bothersome but overall... good food great prices.

Great food! Great service! Great prices! What more can you ask for!! 
Sonia helped us out and she was awesome!!!
Not much on ambiance but the food is spectacular. It's the classic old Vegas specials but they are so good here.large, tasty portions and great service. Ya a winner.
Amazing prices for the portions and quality of food you get! Definitely recommend this hidden gem of a breakfast place in Vegas
Really solid spot. Pancakes were to die for. Skip the biscuits and gravy. Can't comment on the lunch menu, but for a cheap breakfast or brunch ($8-10), you can't go wrong!

Horrible Experience!  Waitress ignored our table for 10 minutes or more.  Then, we asked the hostess and the waitress acted like we were an inconvenience.    The food was slow to arrive and was mediocre.    Then, the slow waitress was mad when we asked for a refill on coffee.  My husband paid the bill at the counter but the slow waitress ran after us as we left the casino accusing us of not paying even though we did.

$5 steak and eggs!!

Definitely a must after clubbing! My friends and I ALWAYS come here after a long night at the club because it's such a great deal for a good amount of food! 

The steak sometimes isn't how you order it but the hashbrowns and eggs always hit the spot! it also comes with toast. for $5 you can't go wrong! it's never really that crowded that late at night but it does kind of suck trying to find a taxi after you eat. 

I've actually been here not at 2am and the food is pretty good! definitely worth trying if you don't mind going a couple blocks off the strip. 

Note: the $5 steak and eggs deal is only available late at night.

Best place for steak and eggs after a night of drinking! 

$4.95 for steak and eggs and $3.99 for AYCE pancakes, making it a great night owl place after hitting up the clubs or a night of drinking. 

The steak and eggs entree also comes with a side of toast and some hashbrowns. 

I've been here numerous times and I've always experienced good service even in the twilight hours of the night. 

They also have milkshakes which I recommend, both the chocolate and strawberry are delish!

Went here recently after some bowling. Wasn't expecting much but i was wrong. I order the steak and eggs, I ordered the steak well done, eggs scrambled and it came with toast and hash browns. The steak was a little small but I guess that's what you get for the price. The steak was good all on it's own didn't even need steak sauce, the eggs and hash brown was also great because I noticed they didn't overdo the salt.

I am definitely coming back here again!

Wow.  What a hidden gem.  Very reasonable prices for a lot of food that was prepared well and all tasted fresh.   The service was really good as well.   If you have a family, and are looking for good value and good food, I'd suggest here.

Umm, no.  Yelp fail.  I feel bad for taking my friends here.  Sure, I should know better than ordering steak and eggs ever, but this was, at best, a mediocre rendition of the breakfast classic.  I have had better biscuits at Popeye's; this isn't to denigrate Popeye's, but rather to note that if you can't beat low-end national chains, then you probably haven't reached a threshold bar to a three star review.  By far, the most enjoyable part of the meal were the oversized drinks.  While one of my friends foolishly ordered an absurdly sugary pina colada, our bloody marys were decidedly average.  Here, that is a good thing.  Unless you are looking for super cheap food, I wouldn't recommend the trek over here.

This place is just okay on the border of average and below that. My husband got baby back ribs. The flavor was good but it was severely over cooked . The texture was just horrible. I got the southern  fried chicken and again it was super dry and overcooked .Plus the service was super slow. All I can say is that you should really learn your meat temperatures. Good luck

I use to go to Southpoint for steggs however when my friends introduced me to this place, I always come here for steggs now!! For the price of $6, it's great because their food is pretty good and the chefs actually take into consideration on how the steak and eggs want to be cooked. I've gotten so many rare steaks and eggs from Southpoint when it wasn't even what I asked for (I always ask for medium rare and over medium) but for $5 how could I complain? Their customer service is also great! They're friendly and they always check up on tables. For a dollar more, it's definitely worth it for me!

Pretty good and super cheap! I had a breakfast that consisted of eggs bacon sausage pancakes toast ham and it only cost $9. They have steak n eggs for $5 as a special. Off the strip with easy parking.

!!! $5.99 STEAK AND EGGS FROM 12 AM - 5 AM !!!

Next time you find yourself in Vegas and awake after midnight, be sure to pay Marilyn's a visit solely for this special! This is clearly a blessing to late night partiers and midnight snackers alike. It was so great to enjoy a hearty sit down breakfast at 4 am after not having time to eat a proper meal all day. It's slightly off the beaten path of the Strip, but not too far to be inconvenient.

The food itself was average at best, but it was so cheap that it didn't really matter to me. If you care about the quality, then maybe you're better off going elsewhere. My steak had a lot of gristle on it that I had to cut off. The other elements (eggs, hash browns, toast) are hard to mess up so those were fine. I think the quality is comparable to normal diner food. My friend ordered a basket of calamari and it was not good, but then why would you get calamari at a diner? 

Service was polite and quick given the hour. This is a great spot for late night comfort food, good and simple.

Food: 2.5, Service: 3, Environment: 4, Price: 5

Good simple food, open 24 hours, best prices in Las Vegas, lots of food at Diner prices, located inside the Tuscany casino, always packed, you can order to go if you like, quick customer service, busy and noisy, but very fulfilling food, highly recommend.

UPDATE: I've hit this place at least twenty times since the original review (below), all on second shift, whenever I am in the vicinity. 100% flawless service, incredibly high-quality grub, fantastic pricing. Example: A charcoal-grilled 8oz chopped steak in thick mushroom gravy, side, bread and salad for about $9 out-the-door before tip. This is a Best Of Las Vegas pick for casino coffee shop - and it's well earned !!

ORIGINAL REVIEW: Service was somewhat confused and slow, but the six-buck steak & eggs graveyard deal more than made up for it.

I arrived at Tuscany Suites & Marilyn's Coffee Shop around 4:40am, then waited almost ten minutes at the register, staring at a dining venue devoid of any customers or staff. Then I ended up going into the kitchen to find someone. I was told I that Marilyn's was actually next door. That wasn't exactly true. What's next door is the property's 24-hour "Pub365" VP bar (and restaurant).

I was told at the Pub that Marilyn's graveyard shift was shuttered due to a monthly deep-clean of the kitchen. I am not buying that either. You are telling me there's a separate kitchen for the pub that shares a wall with the coffee shop? And why are the lights up in the coffee shop with no "Closed" sign or rope-off? My bet? The staff just wanted to vacant the coffee shop area (without getting caught) ... to save themselves some work keeping the morning shift set-up in place, since the VP Bar next door is open all-night no-matter.

Anyway, just after my drink was brought to me at my Pub365 table, I was asked to move BACK to Marilyn's because "the deep-clean" was done at 5am. Now I am wondering if I'm even going to GET the graveyard deal! When I get to my new booth in Marilyn's, there's some confusion as to whether my order had even been taken. We cleared that up ... and cleared up that my graveyard deal was going to cash in. Then it took well over 20 minutes for the food to arrive. Even though there were only two other table-tops working.

Any-who, there's the service. Now about the food. For a $6 steggs deal, this cut of meat was pretty durn good. Now we know this isn't going to be the Golden Steer or Steve Wynn's SW Steakhouse going in. But for this price, it was a pretty nice cut of steak. I've certainly seen far worse graveyard meat ... and at a buck or two or three more. The eggs were done well, the hash browns could have been a bit more crispy. But, again, for six smackers this deal was a real bargain. And the plates heading for the other table-tops looked pretty durn tempting as well.

And my wait comped me the beverage, in consideration of the seating fiasco. Thanks, dude!

OK, it's a mid-market coffee shop, not going with five-stars. And I'll dish out an additional one-star ding, not for the service & seating confusion - the food quality & the gratis beverage balanced that out - but for the ambient music. 'Ambient' is probably not the right word as much as the word 'blaring.' And what was blaring was mostly 1970s hard-grinding metal rock. During my 5:30am dining experience I was enchanted, in no uncertain decibels, by 'Rock and Roll Hoochie Koo' (Rick Derringer, 1973), 'Stay With Me' (Rod Stewart, 1971), 'Black Magic Woman' (Santana, 1970) and Janis Joplin wailing-out 'Me & Bobby McGee' (1970). I am presuming management has concluded this is the ambiance required to properly incentivize its target slot players of-age to drop coin. I totally get that; business-is-business. But let's tamp it down a bit in the restaurant at 5:30am, OK? 

Forgiving the service/seating samba ... and the rowdy head-banger music ... at 3am-5am, this spot is actually a pretty decent graveyard deal option, for sure. I'd would have much rather eaten what Marilyn's dished than what I would have gotten at Blueberry Hill for twice the price. And at The Peppermill, I would have easily dropped a twenty. And while The Peppermill is certainly a great spot for middle-of-the-night people-watching and for over-the-top, retina-numbing décor, it seems to me the quality of product at Peppermill has slipped in recent years, at least when compared to its price-point.

CONCLUSIONS: Tuscany already offers a nicely-appointed, vintage-Vegas-vibe lounge. Now I've discovered its coffee shop. So if I am looking again in this time frame ... and I am looking in this price-point ... and I am in the general area, I'll likely swing through Marilyn's again. 

Especially if I am trolling in the middle of the morning ... still lookin' for that blue jean baby queen. Prettiest girl I ever seen. See her shake on the movie screen. Rock on.
I love this place, I always come for the healthy section in the menu and the food is always good and consistent, thank you, and have a nice day.
Extremely good breakfast. The food was plentiful in portions. My wifes multigrain pancake was delicious, her words, and they are very reasonably priced.... Thoroughly great experience.

This was my second time here and I was so disappointed. It literally took about 30 minute to take our drink order, another 20 minutes to receive it, another 20 minutes to take our orders (btw 8.99 steak & eggs is from 6a to 11a only!). They didn't even bring everything we ordered out until we pretty much had to beg for it.

Overall it was the worst service I have ever experienced in Vegas and the servers had no remorse but then again why should they. 2 stars because their food is good, I'll give you that but at what cost, you know?

It was a Monday morning and we were staying at the Hard Rock, so we went right around the corner and I got the Steak and Eggs, and my girlfriend got I believe an omlette. 

We paid about the same for the orange juice as we did our meals, haha and they were pretty good. Obviously not 5 stars, but there was 0 wait, good deals, and a tasty breakfast after a night of going out.

We came here on a Friday night after going out clubbing on the strip at around 2:30am. For some reason it was PACKED. I think when I normally go on Saturday nights, it's not this bad, maybe people don't go to late night steak and eggs on Saturday, but they definitely went this Friday night!

Service: 5/5 - our waitress was dealing with a full house but was hospitable and friendly. She checked in with us once and assured us that our order was coming out despite waiting about 40ish minutes for 4 orders of steak and eggs. She then came out with a basket of delicious cornbread for us to eat while we waited, which was a first for me! Amazing service, props to this lady who took her customer service seriously. Even though we waited close to an hour after sitting to get our food, it was worth it.

Value: 5/5 - Great value, can't beat $6 steak and eggs (also comes with toast and hash browns). I always make it a point to come here every time I'm in town.

Taste: 4/5 - Not bad, not the best I've had, but good enough. I don't expect much but definitely gets the job done and leaves me satisfied. Can't really complain about the food, I always leave happy and satisfied.

Overall, fantastic service, can't argue with the food, and one of the best value places on the strip.

I love coming here for the five dollar steak and eggs. And the attached casino is pretty awesome as well. Great servers, a good selection of food at a reasonable price is never a bad combination. Everytime im in vegas i always make sure to drop by here.

The food quality isn't the greatest but considering the price, it's worth a try.
I highly recommend the steak meals as they're not only delicious but also reasonably priced.  Although the cafe is located within a casino, there are kid friendly options so bring the family.  
The servers seemed a bit gloomy but service was averagely paced despite the early crowd.  The plates are large so that's a plus.  The country fried steak was salty but the eggs were alright.  Toast was just toast and it came with the generic jam.  The pancakes were tasty and my sister enjoyed it.  The greatest disappointment came with the french toast.  They were soggy and bland; it resembled wet bread and nothing more.  
On the positive side, the servers were always ready for refills and attentive with the bottomless coffee.  The food is cheaper than most places and although the food isn't outstanding, it's filling and tasty if you pick the right choices.  The steak was cooked correctly to order, perfectly medium rare.  Each dish came with many options so it's easy to share.  

Wouldn't stop by for another time of day besides breakfast but it was memorable.

We have eaten two meals there one dinner and one breakfast and both of them exceeded our expectations and price and quality of meal also the waitress and the workers cleaning the tables were all very active, very busy and very friendly. I even met a family friend that had been moved off island (Hawaii) some 13 years ago working here. So far, this is one of the best breakfast places I have eaten at over here

If you find yourself here, but not late enough for the midnight steak and eggs $5.99 special, the NY steak is a decent alternate. You pick two sides and of course the steak. They didn't have A1, but I guess that's just personal preference. 
The layout of the cafe feels a bit weird and the service can't expect too much. 
The food itself was great. Ordered the fries with mac & cheese as my side. Since the cafe isn't isolated from the casino floors, there's a lot of background noises going on, but if I find myself on this side of town again, might stop in.

The chicken Caesar wrap is great. The prices are pretty fair. The service was good. The prime rib sandwich was good. The salad was a good price and the good side. It's nice it's right to the casino. This is my second time here and I'm sure I'll be back.

first our food was 45 minutes late, the server saida was great. They told us we could split our checks for a party of 7. We got up to the front counter in front of all of the other people, was told by a manager that they were not going to split our checks and embarrassed us. We had to come up with cash money, our server did not get ila tip, and they told us they were going to write her up. I have gone to this place multiple times and it was wonderful, but this was hands down the worst experience ever!. We actually went and talked to management ).   the manager on duty,  Her name was Dana.... She should be fired.

Steak and Eggs! Steak and Eggs! Steak and Eggs!

Definitely get the steak and eggs. They are bomb and so affordable. You cant get this good of a deal anywhere else on the strip. The sourdough bread was also bomb. I enjoyed everything about my sober late night foodie escapade. The only thing that might be discouraging is the walk to the restaurant. It's a little ways off from the strip, but it's for sure in walking distance.

Not too bad.

Everyone else's food was ok.  No on really complained EXCEPT for my friend who ordered the OMELET with Jalapeos, Bell peppers and sausage...... but ONLY got Jalapeos, Bell peppers and sausage (with the egg) but NO CHEESE.... he was a little butt hurt....

Our server Jennifer was really nice.

I had the waffles and they were FANTASTIC.  The PATTY sausages are pretty good too.
I change mind, this place is the BOMB BAY! The steak special is cheap and delicious!

Good quality breakfast, cheap prices, and very attentive service. Yelp saved the day again.

Surprisingly, the cafe wasn't crowded for a Saturday morning.

All those cheap specials that are being advertised on yelp are only at late night or early morning, which caused some disappointment for me as I convinced all my friends we'd have a cheap meal.

I ordered a skillet plate since the special was unavailable and it was packed with goodness. The wait for the food; however, was a little unbearable. We had about 6 people, but we waited around a half hour for our food. They might make you wait so the food can taste better. 

I wouldn't mind coming here again, but I might only come when I find out when that damned steak and eggs special is available.

We eat breakfast here quite often and dinner less. The french toast complete would be my morning recommendation. If you want real scrambled eggs instead of egg substitute you need to specify country scramble. Service is usually decent but the turn over at the cashier station sometimes causes delays as they are often training new people. Often have specials which are a bargain.

Our first time here. Never even heard of this Casino or the Hotel. Came here based in 4-star rating with over 300 reviews. 

We had to walk through the casino to find the restaurant. I was extremely impressed with the fact that there was hardly any trace of smoking in the air. Friendly staff, GREAT and freshly prepared food, and reasonably priced! Our waitress even offered us coffee to go workout even being asked.

We'll come back to this place, for sure!

STEAK AND EGGS. That's all you need to order here.. well also come after a night out because it's only $6!! Who cares if the steak is not top cut, it's SIX bucks. Probably the best $6 dollars you will spend in Vegas. It's very close to the strip, I think only one or two blocks away from Las Vegas Blvd. The steak and eggs comes with two eggs, hash browns (ask for extra crispy), and not 1, 2, or 3.. but 4 pieces of toast. Get the sourdough, slab some butter and strawberry jam.. so freaking food. (they put butter on it already, but if you want more butter). The servers are amazing and hospitable, even though they probably see a bajillion drunk people every night. The only thing is that sometime it takes a while for the food to come out. My friends have fallen asleep waiting for their steak and eggs. I always come back to this place at least once every Vegas trip.

what can you say about this place besides the $3.99 steak and eggs.  It used to be $2.99 but i guess you can blame gas prices.  Its a really good meal after a night of partying at the clubs and strip joints.  i always end up getting two orders and always hits the spot plus the service is always good.
Most of the food and prices are pretty good, with a couple of exceptions. They usually don't include some of their specials on the menu and you have to ask.
For $4, the steak and eggs fills you up. Reaaaally good

Ate here several times while staying at the Tuscany.  It's inside the casino.  Great specials every day and great inexpensive breakfasts.  Was able to fill up and get out quickly.  Highly recommended for standard diner fare.
Went for dinner. Good honest food. Great prices and service. Casino also has good low bet tables for those of us that dont wont to gamble away heaps!

Just ate dinner here after checking in at the hotel and receiving a 2 for 1 coupon.  I had the Chicken Fried Steak.  It came with two sides (I chose cauliflower and mashed potatoes with gravy) and a bread basket with real butter.  I must say, I thought the food was very good and the portions were large.

I got the club sandwich and cole slaw to go for another meal, since there's a refridgerator in the room to keep it cold.

My waitress was exceptional.  She was extremely pleasant, polite, and courteous.  One of the very best I've had the pleasure of being served by.  I wish I'd remembered her name so I could give her credit.

I don't have a single complaint.  I would have to recommend this diner for anyone looking for a good meal at a reasonable cost.

Good off of the strip breakfast eatery. Good portions and size for basic breakfast. The service is decent but hey, it's inside the Tuscany. I can't expect big time stuff from this 24hour cafe. I ordered the French toast with eggs, hash browns and cheesy grits for all under $11. You can't really mess up basic breakfast so if a place does, then it really must not be good. French toast portion was 3 huge Texas toasts and they were fluffy, comes with the standard powders sugar and butter. My eggs were scrambled well and my hash browns had decent seasoning and golden brown. The grits were cooked well and had good texture to it. They put grated cheese on top just the way I like it. It could've used more salt, but hey that's preference. Good cheap breakfast right off the strip close to flamingo and koval.

As of 11/1/2014: Friday Night is All You Can Eat Crab Legs.  $19.99

The AYCE crab is great and the butter is served with a candle underneath it so it stays warm through out the meal.  This is not a buffet...they actually serve plates of crab to your table.  Friendly and attentive service.

Pretty decent place to go and have a late night meal...or any time meal really. Decently priced, open 24/7, average service, cozy booths and pretty damn good burgers. There menu is pretty large but I have only been twice so I haven't tried much. I will definately be back and check out more of what they have to offer. I'll keep you posted and update this review as I experience more.

Wow, I haven't posted a review. I've been here a handful of times and I'm always satisfied! Can't wait for my next visit...breakfast late at "night"/extremely early, lol. 

Great selections and even better prices!!! A lot of dining places close early, so this spot is awesome for being 24/7. The service is attentive and the food/cappuccino is delicious! 

My only real complaint is the overbearing ciggie smell (gross). The only thing that makes that somewhat ok is I'm so hungry I just focus on food (that or I've been drinking...haha)! Oh & bring a jacket you sexy ladies, unless you don't mind all the stares (cuz this is a "dive" restaurant).

By far exceeded our expectations.  The food comes out hot and fresh. Our server Agnes was amazing she was just perfect in addition to our breakfast.  I would definitely come back the menu selection is diverse and not to mention the prices are not bad at all.
Really great prices and good food. Prime rib is decent but the steak and eggs is the real deal. Pizzas pretty good too

The food here is delicious. My bbq chicken was sooo tender it fell right off the bone. My mashed potatoes and mac n cheese were creamy and well seasoned. My dinner was only $9.99. My husband's breakfast was only $8.99. You won't regret stopping here.

Cafe with inexpensive specials. Had the steak and lobster, lobster wasn't bad at all for 4oz and the steak had some gristle to it but was edible. Service was lacking and my beer was just brought in the bottle to drink out of, should have been offered a glass before bringing it out and just setting it on the table. Green beans were so crunchy and inedible that when I told the waitress I was surprised she didn't offer to bring me something else since I didn't eat them; she just said "I'll let the kitchen know so they can cook them longer".  doesn't do me any good
Best prices and the quality is wondedul!  All the workers are so kind as well :) everything on the menu is phenomenal!!!!!!

Sometimes you want some greasy basic diner food. This is a great place for that. Perfectly crispy hashbrowns and scrambled eggs. You can also get one slice of French toast or one pancake on the cheap. Also breakfast served all day and it's open 24/7.

Didn't go on crab night. Had some of the best food our entire trip here. Dessert was the only thing a little on the basic/mediocre side. Prime rib was amazing and so was the liver & onions! Try their homemade potato chips! YUM

I wanted to order a make your own omelette breakfast. Agnes suggested I order the Supreme and substitute items that I wanted. It worked out better and was cheaper. It was delicious and way too filling. My wife ordered banana and yogurt with some french toast and that was also delicious. With a shot of Bailey's and a beer ,for breakfast , the bill was only about $30. I would suggest this place to anyone. Great food, great service, very reasonable prices.
Food is taste so good,half bbq chicken and half bbq pork.Definetely will come back more.

Place was pretty dope...breakfast was affordable and definitely will not leave hungry. Service was good and food was awesome. Definitely recommend to anybody looking for some good food at reasonable prices.

In the category of casino coffee shops, I think Marilyn's is one of the better ones in town. Lots of decent-to-great menu options, friendly service, open 24 hours, and some excellent specials.

Being inside the Tuscany is a plus too, as it is close to my home, they give me free slot pay $$$, the casino atmosphere is nice, they have a good selection of slots and table games, and parking is convenient and usually plentiful.

On this particular night, I selected their Ground Steak with Mushroom Gravy, and it was very good. Beef tasted fresh and the gravy was bursting with umami.  I choose their famed "Loaded Hashbrowns" as one of my sides, and they lived up to my expectations. Could have made a meal out of those alone!  My other side item was their warm cinnamon apples, which were fine, but did not look or taste like they were made in-house.

Looking forward to trying their pizza, which was recently added to the menu.
Nice restaurant, very clean. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Our waiter was funny and the food was good for the price. I would definitely come back.

My friend and I went here for one reason: the low food costs. This is far from a hole-in-the-wall establishment; this is a "I want a sit-down dinner for less than $10 a person." The menu is your standard casino cafe fair: breakfast, lunch, dinner.

 I made the regretful choice of picking dinner (I really love breakfast food). I opted for chicken cordon bleu with a side of mac and cheese and broccoli. I had my doubts about ordering the chicken cordon bleu and I really should have stayed away  and stuck with breakfast. I'm 85% sure my entree was fried along side my friend's chicken tenders. I could hold the chicken breast in my hand and it wouldn't fall apart. The mac n cheese wasn't anything special and the broccoli was standard. 

Despite an uneventful dinner, we still ordered dessert. We knew what we were getting into defrosted dessert pies. They were about $5 each and didn't taste the price. The dessert was $3 less than the entree. 

Overall, if I was stuck in the area again and wanted a cheap meal, I'd probably go back. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

This place was such a horrific experience that it inspired me to write a review and to actually join Yelp just to try to have some say in helping others know to stay away from this obvious 13th level of Dante's inferno.  This is where all the bad people who do really, really horrible things are forced to go after they die.  Trust me.  As a person with 26 years of management experience in all manner of retail and restaurant, I can tell you that this place is falling apart and has lost its bearings at ALL levels.  The food comes out cold and with the attitude of "I have been under a heat lamp for 7 hours, dear God please help me!"  I have been here once and already know that their mantra is "we can't do that, sorry we can't do that, sorry you can't do that No NO NO."  This is the complete opposite of customer service.  Want some specifics?  Okay:  Breakfast for Dinner?  Eggs cold and mixed with what appears to be Rico's Nacho Cheese from a 1985 General Cinema theatre.  Sausage out so long it has a hard outer shell like an armadillo.  Vanilla Milkshake that has all the right ingredients - milk, ice cream - but they aren't mixed up right, so you basically have 2 balls of ice cream floating in milk.  Nice try to deconstruct that dish my friends!  Pancakes were ok.  Hashbrowns were ok - ketchup can cover up all manner of sin.  My son ordered that awesome "milk float" and it took over an hour to finally get the thing.  He said, "Dad it doesn't taste good, but I am SO thirsty!" and promptly drank it.  I tried it.  Yep, ice cream in milk without being mixed.  We saw our waitress whenever she wasn't helping the other three hundred guests.  The drink guy understood a few words.  He made it with the water a couple of times.  Then we asked for separate checks and the waitress told us we could pay separately at the counter.  Then we were told they don't do that.  That would be ten times were couldn't do something.  The customer is always wrong at Marilyn's.  After a long discussion and working our way up the chain of command the manager, the wonderfully non-delightful Dana gave up arguing with us and told us flatly "we will not separate your checks, just pay."  I gotta tell you, I've never been arrested for a thing, but I really did want to just walk away without paying.  I wouldn't even use my card because I don't trust this place enough to give them any information.  And that is ok, because they will never be getting another penny from me.  The casino either.  Oh, and did I mention I have some pull, some blogs and some juice here in the Valley?  Yeah, word of mouth is gonna grip tight on this one.  I guarantee it.  Go at your peril dear friends.  Better yet, get better service and some decent breakfast food just up the Strip . . . at Denny's.

Located at the Tuscany Suites, less than 5 minutes away from the strip. And less than 5 dollars to give you the best drunk munchies experience you'll ever have.

For $3.99 from 12 am-5 am, you'd better not think twice to enjoy their steak and eggs. It's the perfect remedy after a long night of drinking. The steak is actually very flavorful, hash browns are crispy and lots of it too, buttery toast, and 2 eggs any you want it! I got loaded has browns (a dollar more) this has gravy and cheese all over it. My medium rare steak with a sunny side egg on top of it to let the yolk just oooze all over it, was so freakin' bombbbb. 

Honestly, one of the biggest reasons I made my recent Vegas trip was solely to have this deliciousness. And I'm lookin' forward to have my fix again.

Six dollar steak and eggs. Need I say more? The four times that I've come to Vegas, I've stopped here, if only because I manage to somehow arrive to the city after midnight and it's the best deal around. The place is open 24/7 but after midnight is when you can get the deal. The steaks are fairly thin and when we asked for medium rare, we got medium well. I'd give this place 3 stars for that but since I come so often and it's such a great deal, I can't give it less than 4. Ask for it rare if you want it to come to you pink. The portion is pretty big so you can get full for little money.
The service is terrible and I didn't like their breakfast , coffee and their cleaning conditions. The restaurant is old and dated. They even don't deserve one star.

Is it really a Vegas trip done right without that $5.99 steak and eggs? I'm gonna say no. I've been to this place a handful of times and I'm always coming back.

DISCLAIMER:
I've only eaten Tuscany's intoxicated, so my words may not be the sober truth. :)

Steak is juicy and a good portion. It's not your fancy steakhouse steak but it'll do at 3 a.m. when you're starving. Eggs are always cooked as asked (I mean, you can't really mess up eggs), and hash browns are cooked to a perfect crisp. I actually split a plate with my friend this past weekend and it was a great size for the both of us.

Servers are usually great and nice to everyone, which I think would be hard to do when you're serving dozens of drunk 20 somethings. Major props to them, lol.
Denver omelet was great. Top notch service, reasonable price for an in-casino restaurant, and good food.

Came here roughly a week ago to try out the steak and eggs special only to miss it by a half hour. 

Tip: Arrive 15 minutes before 11:00 AM so you can get seated and order their steak and eggs special.

Anyways, as for overall experience it was great. I came with a larger group of 9 people so we expected a long wait but only waited maybe about 10 - 15 minutes before getting seated. No time was wasted and our orders came out relatively quick. It took about 35 - 40 minutes between getting seated til our orders arrived mostly because this place was packed. After finally digging it, I can totally see why. The food definitely is reminiscent of an old school diner, quality frugal eats. 

I, myself, ordered the country fried steak and eggs. First time trying a country fried steak so this was a new experience but impressions were good. The steak was crispy like fried chicken with a mellow steak flavor when you bite in. Not too oily but it was also masked with their house gravy so difficult to tell. The gravy did help to cut the fattiness of the fried oil. Eggs were okay, not overly cooked nor undercooked. Would have hoped it to be a little less cooked. Seemed it was waiting to be served for a while as it was a bit drier. 

All things considered though, the food was good and definitely met my expectations. Almost all their dishes could feed two people. For the price, the food satisfied my needs but if I were to nitpick the food could have been brought out when it was hot. Fried foods aren't as great once they cool down in my opinion. Additionally, their hash browns were not thoroughly cooked. It was watery and made the toast a little soggy. 

All in all, Marilyn's is a solid choice for breakfast. The quality of the food is average and service was above average. The price and quantity makes the meal a solid four stars though.

You can't beat $5 steak and eggs!  I came here with my dad and bf after a night out.  It was open at 3 AM (no surprise) and not very crowded at all.  We asked for the $5 steak and egg special.  It took about 15 minutes before we got our meal, and the steak was cooked just right and came with 2 eggs, hash browns, and toast.  Everything was delicious and nothing was left behind on the plate.  Best $5 I've ever spent!  The service was pretty good, and the restaurant definitely had a cafe atmosphere to it.  Even though it's a little out of the way from the Strip, I would definitely come here again!

Loved the customer service.. on Friday they have all you can eat crab legs and omg soooooo delicious! Must have. My mom had club sandwich and really enjoyed it. I had the Cajun style Alfredo and I wouldn't order it again :/ it was really sweet and had some weird kick in the end but wasn't worth it. The Fries were really good and the cornbread/rolls were yummy. I suggest this place it's cheap and pretty yummy.

Bottom line: eat here if you can, but it's really not worth the crazy wait in line if you can't get in easily.

On all my trips to SF, we always try to stop by Marilyn's.  We always see the stupid crazy line out the door, and decide we'll try next time.  This time, we actually saw a few people in line, and quickly took advantage of the situation.

SURPRISE!  There's ANOTHER LINE inside!

OK, so it only took about 20 minutes once we got inside, and we ordered a variety of breakfast foods to sample.  We go the french toast and an omelet and the side fixings that go along with those dishes.  

It was good.  Would I eat here again?  Yes, if I don't have to wait more than 30 minutes to get to my food.  

I will suggest Sear's Fine Foods in Union Square as an alternative.  I think their breakfast food is comparable - and there's typically no wait.  I know Marilyn's puts fancier ingredients in their food and such - but with the foods we ordered, it only mattered that it was well prepared.

Steggs - steak and eggs.

After a long night of clubbing and shenanigans in Vegas, stop by Marilyn's and have their $5 steak and eggs special. You get steak and eggs prepared the way you want them, hash browns (order them extra crispy!), and toast. Very delicious, filling, and cheap - just the way I like it!
Service was stupid. Watched a take out carton get dropped off and sit at the counter for 10 minutes until someone finally gave it to me. Nothing like cold food. No apology. Terrible service.
Yum. Good breakfast and cheap beer. Staff was a little slow but pretty good food for cheap Vegas food.
Ate dinner here and was not impressed but breakfast was great. Good coffee they kept filled. Had several healthy egg white options and multi grain pancakes that had great flavor

$3.99 steak and eggs?! I am one happy and lucky girl. 

This place is awesome. You cannot beat $3.99 steak and eggs with crispy hash brown and toast. After partying hard, this is the spot to go when you don't want to break the bank even more. The cafe was not crowded at 2 in the morning on Friday and we were seated immediately.
