My steak was cooked the way I wanted, the sunny side up eggs were great, my hash brown was crispy and on top of that, got a nice hearty toasted wheat bread. Service was a little slow but I don't mind it just one bit. This meal would leave you full and very satisfied.

This is a quaint cafe located in rear of the Tuscany Casino. This cafe serves good quality affordable food 24/7. They have a wide ranging menu that can easily satisfy your culinary needs. They have a great steak & eggs breakfast. They have good southern style grits. Enjoy this gem with free parking and great prices for comfort food!

Awesome awesome awesome!

My whole family is a huge fan of the midnight special.  Steak and eggs, $4.99, and the quality can't be beat!  We stop in every time we come to Vegas.

My kid is a night owl and even if we are dragging on our first night in Vegas, she'll ask us to stay up and go.  And we wind up happy about it every time!  On our last trip, two years ago, the steak was good.  Now it's a dollar more for the special, and the steak is great!

And the rest.  This restaurant can actually deliver an egg over easy.  It's perfect every time.  The toast, buttery and filling.  Hash browns, nice and tasty, well cooked and not overdone.

You need to know what's on at what time when you come in.  The $4.99 special is midnight to 5 AM, but a regular breakfast special for $7.99 is available mornings.  Or fill up on pancakes for...memory is a bit dim but I think it's $3.99 around the clock.

Be sure to tip your waiter on something like what the actual price would be.  Service is good and regular, ours always keep our drinks filled.

Hit the casino for laughs with the Judge Judy slots behind the cafe, or just hit the video poker up the aisle.

Located inside the Tuscany hotel this place is a great place to stop. Quality and reasonably priced I would give this place a try. I ordered room service from here as well as had lunch a different there later in the week on my trip. It was so good I went back for round two!  They have a different specials nightly too so don't forget to check those out!

Amazing steak and eggs!  My BF actually liked the steak better than what he had at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill.  And for about half the price of what you'd pay at most of the other more well known casinos.  Service is friendly and super fast.  Great diner food...they also have comfort food (pasta, pizza, etc) and everything else looked really good too.

Originally came to the Casino, and stayed to have late dinner.  Pleasant surprise.  Now, I go for the food, majority of the time its early Saturday breakfast or Thursday late evening dinner.  This place is open 24 hours.  Ample food for the price. If you gamble, you can use your Tuscany Players Club card and use your points for payment.

Everytime I am in Vegas I make sure to stop at Marilyn's Cafe to grab a bite. I always order the prime rib medium rare and the chef always cook it perfectly. The staff are nice and pleasant. 
It gets really pack on weekends, which affects the speed of the service, but it's understandable. Great food for reasonable price!
Best place to eat at a decent price while in Las Vegas. Food and service was great. Went back many times and each time the service and food were exceptional!!!!

*ONLY REVIEWING THE STEAK AND EGGS, VENUE, AND SERVICE

Very very impressed with the remodeling of Marilyn's Cafe! 

I only came here for the extremely inexpensive steak and eggs and they were significantly tastier and cheaper than The Steakhouse at Bill's. The steak was cooked well with larger portions compared to Bill's, hash was delicious, and the best part was that Marilyn's had A1 sauce (YESSS!!). A cheaper quality steak without A1 sauce is just not amazing to me. 

I truly believe that Marilyn's renovation did nothing but benefit them. The food quality has improved leaps and bounds and the dining area is spacious enough for late night dining and extremely clean. 

Also, I went here three times in the 9 days I was in Las Vegas during this past summer and I always had the same waiter. I wish I remembered his name because he was such a sweetheart. He was peppy at three in the morning and was extremely polite. He made the experience even better!

I am confident enough to brush off my prior statements of the Steak and Eggs at Bill's being better than Tuscany. Fellow Yelpers, Marilyn's Cafe for Steak and Eggs is the way to go! You wont regret it!
I wouldn't go for the chicken pot pie, but the $6 burger was amazing value for your money!

#150

I was in Lost Wages, err Las Vegas for 2016 CES and staying next door at the Fortune Hotel. FYI, don't stay there (I will detail that experience later).

I went to Marilyn's for breakfast the first day of CES, Wednesday, 6 January. I tried the chicken fried steak and eggs with real shredded hash browns and my friend got the pork chop and eggs. We shared and the hostess had recommended the latter as one of her favourites. Good choice! The chicken fried steak was lightly breaded and the chicken so tender; the pork chops were so tender you could cut them with a stick pen. I thought the coffee was excellent but my friend thought it was average. José and Miriam took care of us this meal (one of 4 trips in 4 days). Excellent service with excellent food!

Next trips, my friend and I got the Steak and eggs which are $5.99 after midnight and $8.99 between 0600 and 1100. Great steak! Emilia and German took care of us and again, excellent service.

These meals also come with hash browns AND your choice of toast and jams.

Because of this restaurant, next trip we will be staying at the Tuscany which houses this restaurant.

Good food, good price, good portion, good location, good service. Now, that is my 5 stars; get yours soon!
For their grave shift prices, they were good food. My cousin brought me here and she ordered for us. Just a little past midnight snack. Lol
The steak and lobster deal on Wednesdays is such a good deal! Don't expect Wolfgang Puck quality, but with two sides and a bread basket, this is one heck of a deal!

We were staying at the Platinum hotel and needed a quick place for breakfast, so we decided to try Marilyn's.

First of all, you need to walk through a large casino area to get to the cafe. The cigarette smell was not a good way to start breakfast.

The seating area is okay, but pretty run-down. Our booth was comfortable though. The waitress was friendly enough.

Everything on the menu is extremely affordable, especially considering it's Las Vegas. The unlimited pancakes option was pretty great and only $4. The pancakes were perfectly soft and fluffy. The french toast I ordered was not so good: too eggy and not enough flavor. Ended up just sharing the pancakes.

You pay at the register, which was good considering we were in a rush. Total for four people was less than $30.

There are definitely better places on the Strip. We would not come here again, but it was okay for such a cheap price.

Tried out this little gem on a whim.  I was staying at the Ramada next door...and when I tried to get some food via room service, I was told they no longer carry food for room service.  Bummer.  The front desk attendant told me to try out the cafe next door, and that a lot of their clients like it there.  Five minutes later, I am ordering a meat lover's skillet type meal for dinner.  It was good.  If I am in this area again, I will try this place again.  They serve diner type food plus alcohol...so its a decent spot.

Did you have a raging night and you're hungry?

Cheap steak and eggs! $5-ish plus tax, plus tip. Service is okay. Don't expect them to be on top of it. They're short handed and trying to be quick and efficient.

I seriously just come here for the steak and eggs. Don't ask me how the other food tastes like.

Honestly, I've only eaten at Marilyn's on several occasions-- and each encounter was between the late (or early) hours of midnight- 4am. They are known for their late night steak and eggs special... for the very low price of $4.99! For $4.99 you get an order of steak, eggs, hash browns and toast. Portions are not huge, though satisfying-- option for a double order steak and eggs available for about $10. The late night steak and eggs special is not on the menu, but very much so available. Their thick, creamy clam chowder is also tasty and very filling! Despite being open 24 hours and numerous drunken encounters throughout the night, all of the employees here are wonderful! In addition to this, if you are sober enough to drive yourself here (don't drink and drive!), Marilyn's parking is easy peasy-- located right outside the Casino. No complicated parking structure to venture through. Marilyn's is perfect for late night, cheap eats.

We stopped by for brunch on a Sunday around 11am. It was busy, but we still got a table right away. It's a pretty typical diner/cafe inside of a casino, but Marilyn's is a good deal. There are many specials on the boards at the entrance.

The service was friendly and quick. The decor isn't super duper, but it's comfortable. What we're really there for is good cheap eats and that's what we got.

We both got the French Toast Complete special. Food is definitely tasty enough and really good for the price.

If you give Marilyn's a try, you'll be satisfied with the food and happy about how much you spent for it.

All you can eat crab!  It was good and plentiful. I was shocked at how good it was. Hot butter and plenty of lemon. Great service. I couldn't have eaten more. They are very generous with the crab. Some places give you a plate and forget you. Not here. Yes it's loud but that's a small price to pay!

Was half wasted, finished watching ufc fights and hungry. So 12 of us decided to check this place out. It's a hidden gem. It was $4.99 for steak and eggs after midnight. James was our server who was awesome and I told him he had a crazy dreamy voice and should be on television or radio!  He says I was first person to ever tell him that! lol then was more nicer!! Love it!! So worth it. Go, now.. Have 2 if you can!

Came in for AYCE CRABLEGS only to find out they ran out of crab legs. I just don't know anyone could offer AYCE and run out of your deal? 

I think it's extremely inconvenient for any customer to wait in line for about 30 minutes only to find out that they stopped serving what you came in for. 

Although the manager did apologize for the inconvenience it was a let down. Still a great place to go well worth it.

This cafe is tucked away inside the Tuscany Casino, and it's well worth the trip even if you're not staying there. The have breakfast, lunch and dinner specials every day including a steak and eggs breakfast special that you just have to try to know how delicious it is. I've been here many times after finding this place when staying at the hotel and everything I've ordered here is cooked to order and tasty. They're open 24 hrs and their pricing is very reasonable even when not ordering a special

For value, service, availability and delivery this place gets all the stars!  Open 24 hours at our hotel we dined at Marilyn's twice. Once was "room service" but it's actually just delivery.  We dined in as well and both times servers were kind polite and accommodating. Short order cook is awesome as well. Jason and Julian served us they were both attentive and friendly.  Bowl of oatmeal with Mille brown sugar and raisins is $3 basic breakfast $6.  Cannot be beat!

Best hidden gem off the strip! Located in Tuscany Suites, it's perfect if you want that quick humongous diner breakfast in the wee hours of the morning! I'd definitely choose this place and get steak and eggs with pancakes and potatoes for less than $10 instead of paying more than double somewhere on the strip. It's definitely a no-frills type of place and it's the opposite of fancy/elegant. But sometimes, if you just want cheap, good food that's a step up from Denny's or Norm's... this is the place!

We had breakfast. Sausage Omelet and pancakes.  Most of it was left on the plate after we ate.  All the ingredients of the omelette was cooked separately then folded in the cooked egg, held together by the cheese. The sausage was almost beef jerky like, if I had cooked it in the microwave then cut it to put in the omelette I might achieve the same result.  

Breakfast was just horrible. McDonald's is a better choice

Didn't fucking split checks and the waitress was a straight up bitch. Like wtf let us know what the fuckin policies are instead of lying and saying that you told us. Stupidest service, never coming here again wish I could give them half a star.
Prime rib delicious. Yummy me and my hubby loves it juicy don't like it any where else the employees are so nice and very helpful.

Took about twenty minutes for a server to notice us and take our drink orders then it took another hour for our food to come out. I got the big winner. My scrambled eggs were orange. Talk about strange. My boyfriend thought it was Mac n cheese. The bacon was burnt and the sausage links were overcooked as well.. The pancakes and hash-browns were decent. I probably won't come back here for breakfast. My boyfriend got steak medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. Service sucks so bad and the food was decent.

The advertisement i seen will I was driving caught my attention "All you can  eat crab legs",.  I thought this was a buffet but no you sit down and they serve you the crab legs and refills.  They also have other food to order as well.  The crab legs that I kept getting seemed to be the claws. (why me when I seen others getting the legs) The claws were so hard to open I even spilled over the tealight trying to fight with the claw.
  I asked the waitress can she give me more legs because it is difficult for me to open these hard claws.  The waitress was gone for a while and servicing others because it was quit busy in there due to the all you can eat crab legs.  When she would return she was always nice to me but she said, one thing and that this is all they have.  I was so disappointed due to I seen alot of folks with the legs.  So i order some prime rib taquitos.  (not good to me) 

 There was this one lady who seemed as if she was a "busboy"  always coming around asking can she get you anything and she is so happy to serve and help you. She did that a few times.  I thought How cool was she. I should have asked her to get me the legs.  I DON'T EAT CLAWS. LOL

Once upon a vegas weekend, I really wanted some steak, eggs, and a mimosa. Although this place is a little far ways from the strip(you'd probably have to drive/cab here) but it was so worth it! I came with my boyfriend and my friend and her boyfriend on a Tuesday afternoon after the advertised deals. But our waitress was SO nice to us. She was friendly, she joked with us, and she hooked it up! 

Instead of paying $12.99 for New York steak and eggs, she let us have it for the special price of $6.99 even though it was 3:30pm before any of the deals started. My boyfriend and I both got this deal and it was worth the out of way trip here! The steak was nice and tender and I can't complain for the price! The servings were generous, and the buttered toast was to DIE for (: My mimosa was originally $6.95 I believe but the bill showed it to be $5, so she definitely hooked that up too! It was just the right amount of bubbly! The meal total came out to be about $20, which I think is a really good deal!

I heard that there's a $3.99 deal for steak and eggs between 12am-6am so I'll definitely come back for that the next time I'm in vegas! Good food, even better prices, and amazing service !

Hidden inside the casino area of The Tuscany Suites & Casino, this place is a gem that's close enough to walk from the strip but just far enough that the prices aren't jacked up for tourists. 

What we got:
- Pot roast with mac and cheese, mash potatoes and house salad with Caesar dressing $12.
This was excellent. I loved the pot roast and was surprised at how soft/moist the meat was. The mash potato got raving reviews from my boyfriend and I was impressed with how tasting it was. The mac and cheese was a bit watery, not the best but not bad either.

- Coffee (unlimited) $2.39
I had 5 cups of this stuff and it was GREAT! I had several servers come by during to top me off with more fresh coffee before I was even done. The awesome staff even gave me a to-go cup! 

- Tilapia with mac and cheese and broccoli $10 
The fish tasted fresh and the side of broccoli was MASSIVE.

- Coke with Grenadine (unlimited) $2.39
Too sweet for me but the boyfriend loved it :)

Service - Was a bit bumpy at first because they seemed to be short staffed. There was a wait to get our orders taken and a wait to get our orders but after that the service picked up and staff was very attentive. A man who seemed like the manager was going around to each booth making sure we were all enjoying ourselves and then he followed up with me to ask if i wanted more coffee LOL, at this point I felt like an addict so I had to politely decline. Then I saw him giving out hugs to some elderly customers and thought that was really amazing customer service.

Totally worth it and I would gladly come back.

Stayed at the Tuscany and we walked to this cafe. We got to know about this "secret deal" on Yelp. Thank you thank youuuu!!! $4.99 for steak and eggs! It's not on the menu so we had to ask anyways JUST IN CASE! lol. Yes, it's LEGIT! Special price after midnight to 5am. 

The steak is thin, tender, tasty and just right. Had a couple OPTIONS for bread!! As if it's not cheap enough. I had the RYE and husband went for wheat. Medium done. Came with shredded hash browns. I ordered hot chocolate as well.  Overall a great place for cheap and good supper!

Finally came on a Friday night to attack this $15 AYCE crab legs special I keep hearing about. I quickly changed my mind after see what everyone else was getting. Pretty basic crab legs that you could get at anywhere. So I decided to skip the AYCE crab legs and try something else.

Order a full rack of BBQ pork ribs. Amazing. Add them to my list of bbq spots. Tender fall off the bone, perfectly cooked, real delicious BBQ sauce. Also came with 2 sides and rolls at your demand, ask for corn bread you'll like them. I forget the price but it was about $13-15. Plenty of ribs to go around.

Steak and egg were ok a bet pricey about $13 regular and $6 during its graveyard special.

The monster burger special is still a good deal at $5 but I guess it wasn't as gourmet as I last thought but still good.

As always excellent service on a busy Friday night.
Great place to have all your meals, they open 24/7, serve breakfast all day. cool AC

Two blocks off the strip tucked away in the Tuscany Resort and Casino.  The prices of everything is mostly under $10 and the food is excellent.  Wide variety from steaks to eggs to sandwiches to salads.  

We had a great visit. Our server, José, was friendly and was always present when we needed anything.

Cheap breakfast place, it's inside to Tuscany so don't think it's a diner by itself. Self-parking is plentiful, great location since it's a very short drive from the other big hotels on the strip. 

Everything here is fantastic, I don't know how people had a bad experience. No problems with my breakfast combo, and my friends enjoyed their meal too. Pancakes are perfectly golden brown and fluffy, eggs made as ordered... bacon even made extra cripsy when requested. There is really is nothing to complain about: inexpensive pricing, service friendly and attentive with clean tables!

Just love places in Vegas that don't shaft you just because they can. Like when you go to a theme park and they say, fork you! we have you trapped pay $6 for this small bottle of water! Thank you Marilyn's Cafe, keeping this place in mind whenever I'm in this area of Vegas for breakfast.
Marilyn's cafe offers a small diner feel but in the big city. Pancakes are excellent. 8.99 for pancakes , bacon and eggs. Love this place. Easy to get to from the strip. Highly recommended.
Steak, 2 eggs, and toast 5.99. Waiting for the food as we speak, don't imagine it being bad for the price.

I got the spinach mushroom and feta cheese omelette and my bf got the steak and eggs special. The omelette was good but his stake was meh. The hash browns however were an easy 5 stars. Coffee was average. Overall I think the food was 3 stars. 

We went for breakfast around 8:30am on a Friday morning and the noise level was ridiculous. I guess it's expected for the amount of people at the restaurant but it's a little annoying. Service was ok. Tried to get a coffee refill and I just gave up after asking a couple of people. I guess it's expected for how busy the place is. Our waitress seemed to be handling 20 tables.

Overall, this is your overage American breakfast place. Nothing exceptional. Would probably come here again if in the area BEFORE 7 am.

Perfect cure for a late night craving. Looked for a late night steak & eggs joint and found Marilyn's on Yelp. Got a double order of steak & eggs. Each steak was 6 oz, came with hashbrowns, choice of bread (I got sourdough), and eggs (I got egg whites).  The price is the best part of the meal. Single order is $3.99. The steak is definitely no Prime cut Ribeye but what do you expect? I ordered medium-rare. One of the steaks was right on but the second one was well-done. I think it got mixed up with my buddy's 2 steaks. So, the food was pretty good but the price is why I gave it 4 stars.
Went here to try their Wednesday special , Very friendly stuffs here but the food just average.

Many years ago a friend of mine got a gig at the Tuscany as a Cher impersonator. She made me come and all I remember is the old people with walkers blocking my way and the place looked old and terrible. Since then that's how I knew Tuscany looks like. So with all the good reviews about Marilyn's Cafe I really pictured an old hole in the wall Cafe. 
I was in the area and starving so I thought let's try it here. 
The casino looks great. It's remodeled since I've been here and for a minute I thought I'm at the wrong place. 
Marilyn's Cafe is very nice. I didn't expect servers with ties. Anyways,  I ordered the T-bone dinner ($16.99) and added half a Caesar salad ($2.99). It was pretty good. The meat wasn't bad at all. 
I got tiramisu for dessert and it was excellent. 
Service was wonderful too. 
I'm gonna come back one Friday to try their all-you-can-eat crab legs special.

This is your run of the mill Vegas cafe, but my review today will be based on their Friday offerings. Because of Friday, it's Friyay, and that's because you can get Cr-cr-craaaazy with their all you can eat CRAB!

Currently priced at $23.99 it includes two side dishes (mashed/baked/french fry potatoes, mac n cheese, fruit, veggies, etc). It's actually an impressive list of side items. Frankly, if you're there for the crab, like me, they just get in the way. My absolute favorite thing about their all you can eat crab is that it's served to you. That's right. NO BUFFET LINE!!! How awesome is that? They are steam crab legs, so buyer beware. In my opinion, they are outstanding. Much meatier than the Station Casino offerings, they are served with a little cut in the shell in them making them easy to break via hand. Almost all of them are juicy and not overcooked, which often happens at buffets. They even give you butter with a little candle under it doesn't harden. They must know that guys like me are in it for the long haul.

Oh yeah, and you always get complimentary dinner rolls and corn bread. These are really good too - the dinner rolls are always warm and fresh. The corn bread is surprisingly good, sweet, very much like my Mom's corn bread. Make sure to ask for it!

The one negative is that it can occasionally take a little while to get your crab refills. Because it's not a buffet line you have servers running around like crazy trying to keep up. They do the best they can, but often it' takes a good 4-5 minutes to get some additional crab. On a non-crab night their service is spot on, but I definitely give them some leeway given the demand they have on Friday nights. 

In my opinion, this is up there with the M buffet for best all-care-to-eat Crabbing, if not a slight notch above because of price point. 

Speaking of run-of-the-mill cafe's, they're kind of a thing of the past. I love the feel of older Vegas diners. Sadly they are all starting to disappear. There is something nostalgic about eating from a diner that opened in the 60's or 70's at 2am on a Thursday night.

This place serves a variety of really good food for a quiet 24-hour restaurant off the strip. My boyfriend and I came at 2AM because we were craving food. Their appetizer menu and side items made it really easy for those of us who want to just munch on something instead of having a whole meal. The to-go section was a very short wait and the waiters were really polite and helpful.

We ordered gravy fries which tastes better than it sounds. They gave us way more than what $3 worth of fries should be worth and successfully sent my boyfriend into the food coma he wanted.

If you're staying in the Tuscany, this place is worth trying if you come back after a long night and need some quick easy food in the proximity of your hotel room.

Good food, the pancakes were to die for. Service was outstanding our waiter Jesse was on point!!!!

Eggs were just right...

From my friends who went tonight - me and my folks went to Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany for all you can eat crab legs like we have done lots of times. This time we had a terribly embarrassing experience. After we finished eating, and while we were collecting cash from everyone(they don't split checks), security was sent by our table and asked if we were enjoying our meal. First off, all the food was gone and table was cleaned. So we thought that was weird. We paid our bill ($256.xx) and proceeded to leave, when Daniel the manager and security stopped my husband and my sis-n-laws and asked who was going to pay the bill?!! When my husband said the bill is paid, he told him "I don't think it is?" And proceeded to say my husband fit the description of someone who walked out on the bill. He then lied and said that security must of seen something on surveillance that made them come over. We later found out from the security manager that Daniel called security before we were even done with our meal! When confronted, Daniel was very condescending and rude and just kept saying "I'm sorry you feel that way." Anyway, we got our money back and won't be going back there. It's so sad that even though every person at that table works hard and honest everyday, we would be considered criminals based on the color of our skin. #RACISMSUCKS

Honestly this place is my new favorite place to eat! They have so many GREAT deals going on at all times of the day! One awesome specials is the $5.49 1/2 lb. Monster Burger served WITH fries. This offer is 24/7!!! The only catch is you have to fine in to get the deals (a small price to pay if you ask me). The quality of the burger was really good. The price does not mean lower quality. We spoke to the manager before we left, despite how busy he clearly was he stopped to have a full conversation with us. He was incredibly kind and professional. At the start of our visit we had to wait a 5-10 minutes before we were seated, but we were constantly acknowledged. They were very apologetic about the wait and it made the wait totally worth it. I am so pleased with out overall experience in the cafe.

We came here because we didn't want to wait very long for breakfast at some of the other options in the area. 

Long story short, it took them 45 minutes to get our drinks from the bar, and then more than an hour to get us our food. Which wasn't anything special. It's all your standard American breakfast fare, done without much variation. 

We didn't wait long to be seated, but it took forever to get serviced and our food. Ultimately, I won't be coming back.

For the past two hours, I've been struggling to understand why (and how) this place is so highly reviewed! I had the Turkey George... Egg white omelette with thinly sliced turkey and an avocado verde sauce. My boyfriend had the Belgium waffle topped with cinnamon apples. My best friend had two chocolate chip/strawberry pancakes with a side of hash browns. My omelette lacked so much flavor and the turkey was painfully dry. The avocado verde sauce was DECENT but, in all honesty, I can do a better job in my own kitchen. My boyfriends waffle wasn't any better. I think he would've been happier with a stack of Eggos. And my best friend described her pancakes as "no better than iHop." Not to mention, her hash browns were drenched in oil. Our meal was not worth the price. I would have rather bought groceries and cooked breakfast on my own in my hotel room. 

The ONE upside, (which is why I had to give two stars instead of one), is that they will bring you complimentary bread upon request. The corn bread is to die for and the dinner rolls are delicious as well.

I still wouldn't return. But just to help you out... Request the bread!
Nothing like on the Strip. .. you get what you pay as always a rule of thumb. ... staff was not friendly,  was as a inconvenience to them to help. Food was not good quality.

This was definitely an unexpected gem to find in the hotel we were staying at. It was so great, that we ate here twice within a long weekend. Their menu is ginormous and you can find something on the menu for even the pickiest eaters. The service is pretty quick, as expected since it is within the casino walls so people either have somewhere to be or they want to get back to gambling. You can come here for breakfast, lunch, dinner, desert, or even a snack or drink. They have it all!

steak & eggs!

steak and eggs for $3.99? i'm a fan. i think the deal is only valid between 2:00-5:00 am. definitely great after you've have a couple of drinks at a club dancing the night away. it does get crowded especially around 2:00 am. the deal is not on the menu, so you won't need it. just tell them how you want your steak and eggs and what kind of toast you would like. it also comes with hash browns! try the zucchini with ranch as an appetizer. it's worth it. will definitely come back again (it's a tradition)! check out the picture i posted.

I want to start off by saying, I did a lot of research for the most inexpensive and quality crab legs in Vegas! I'm very impressed with  this restaurant! They serve crab legs on Friday nights until 10pm for 23.99. AND GUESS WHAT, It's all you can eat WARM CRAB LEGSSS!!! Let's be honest what more can you ask for, right? They also give you two sides. I ordered sweet potatoes fries and green beans. Trust me when I say, this place is the bomb!

This place is a nope!  Took 10 minutes for the waiter to make contact after being seated, then waited 20 minutes for a boot-leather tough t-bone.  Basted eggs were burnt on the bottom.  Still looking for LV's best steak breakfast...

This is the spot for late night steggs! I feel like there aren't a lot of people who know about this place. Wayyyyy better than south point steggs for sure. 

When they say medium rare, they really make it that way! You ask for your hash browns crispy, they don't come out semi burnt. Eggs scrambled, it's not watery. I love love love this place! Doesn't smell like smoke and not too much belligerently drunk people. 

The servers are attentive, and some even remember my face and my order. It's almost embarrassing that I come here so much but I do appreciate those who value and remember their repeat customer. 

The only thing I dislike about this place is how they don't split checks and how they leave the dessert on a tray out in the open. I get that they want to display it but that seems kinda unsanitary to be when it's in the walkway where everyone passes by. They need to find a better way to feature their delectable dessert.
Good food and i love how the portions weren't disgustingly huge. It was just right for one person and some extra.

We came to Marilyn's Cafe on a tip from a local (THANKS HOLLY!) and we were satisfied. The decor is very pleasant reminiscent of an outdoor cafe along the coast of Greece. 

The food is great. It was so good we ate here two days. On our first day we came for breakfast. My hubby had breakfast and I opted for a patty melt. The patty melt was de-lish-ous! It was well seasoned and just enough of a portion where I didn't feel like I was overeating. 

On our second day we came for lunch. I had the shrimp skewer (which came with 12 very large shrimp). The prices are very reasonable also. You will not be disappointed visiting the place. 2 thumbs up

YES. Probably my go to now post clubbing.

Came in on Saturday night after an extremely long day of drowning myself in alcohol and got me a good ol' steak & two eggs. 

Lots of food for such low prices - comes with a piece of steak (I wish I knew how many ounces), hash browns, 2 eggs, and bread. Ordered my steak medium rare with eggs over easy. Steak was cooked perfectly and my egg yolks were still nice and runny. Everything was seasoned perfectly. 

Got the bill and what? Only 5.99 for that much food?! Both tummy AND wallet left extremely happy. :)
Delicious food, great value and great service. They have gluten free pancakes in all kinds of flavors. Great diner specials each night and the steak and lobster was so good! Portions are huge!

Average.
I had the chicken finger dinner because I too indulge in my childish desires from time to time. They were standard: somewhat dry, very fried, and not something you can quite eat without the assistance of sauces to lessen the scratching of the overly brittled flesh scraping at the inside of your esophagus. 
Mac and cheese was dry as well, mushy, and probably has been sitting under the salamander most of today. I suspect it was gingerly microwaved before it brought to us. 
Fries: probably the best thing. Crispy enough, well seasoned (which the mac and cheese cannot equally boast), and quick to disappear off of the surface of my plate.
Finally dessert: I had the oreo creme cake and my lovely companion had a turtle cheesecake. The oreo creme cake had unfortunately long sucked in the very distinct taste of freezer and was likewise quite cloying (especially with the addition of a saccharine chocolate syrup on the plate for 'decoration'). Turtle cheesecake tasted less like freezer. It was the better of the two for sure.

Overall what we expected. Not a place you're eager to return to.

Breakfast all day... check
vegas... check...
good food... ok service check
smokie smokes everywhere... gross.

Of course I got the eggs benedict ...... its a craving i'm special. My friend got pancakes and they were good. :D Nothing too extravagant but again its veygas so they had alchhol to serve me. nom nom nom

3.6 stars.

The service was terrible beyond our servers control. Quite frankly seemed like a shortness of staff and poor management. Environment was dirty and not welcoming. Even if you're looking for a cheap breakfast in Vegas it's not worth it. My friends whole meal was cold along with 80%of mine. I was hung over and my pancakes still wort worth eating.

Steak and eggs are $5.99! This starts at 12am till 6am! The steak was okay.. The service was pretty meh. Well they were pretty busy so I understood that part. Oh, and they got some good desserts too! The tiramisu, it's heaven!!! Try to eat here and you get what you pay for.

Did you even go to vegas if you didn't get $5.99 STEAK AND EGGS?? Now you're thinking the steak has to be low quality, right? NAH, THE STEAK IS SO TENDER AND PERFECT BRUHH.. It even comes with hash potatoes and your choice between toast (Either wheat, white, or sourdough), or pancakes! I didn't really like the pancakes as it tasted a bit like rubber, so I go with toast now. It comes with butter and jelly but I also like to eat it with my over easy eggs. 
They have plenty of different condiments available but I stick with A1 and tobasco yummy !! 
The texture of the steak is always consistent every time I come back too! 

My friend wanted to try something new and got the baby back ribs for only $14 and got the side of salad and mac& cheese. He let me try both and they were both pretty good. The mac & cheese dish was fairly large--I'd get full just from that. He had leftovers for the next day! :) 

This place is always my go-to when I'm in vegas. 
Service: I always have a good time here and the servers are always friendly and attentive. 

Location: It's in Fremont Hotel.
First time at this casino, came to watch the Rat Pack show.  Tried this restaurant and food was amazing.  Best prime rib!!

I reall enjoy this place kinda old school clean the food is great and is a break from the hustle and bustle off the strip I make it a point to stop by each year when I come to Vegas and the food is awesome with large portions I can't think of anything bad to say about this place .Anyway see you next year

Place is pretty neat it's not all crowded as I was expecting due to the casino. The food was delicious will definitely be coming back here tomorrow :) Service was good lady and gentleman were pretty friendly.

This is based off my second visit the first time I wasn't too impressed with the service but they made up for it tonight !!! All u can eat crab legs for $20 Friday night can't beat it !!! Come early there will
Be a wait. Food is good service was Great !!

Hash browns were not crispy.  Asked for it but they must've not heard me.  They were pretty soggy

NY steak is better at market at cafe.
Pancakes were pretty good

Inside casino but not smokey except for your short walk to get there.

Located in Tuscany Suites Hotel a little off the strip. Marilyn's Cafe was a good dining experience for me. For late nice and/or early morning breakfast food,  I like to go to Ellis Island for their steak and eggs etc. 

Marilyn's impressed me however. The menu options are just as good as Ellis island, prices hovering around $9! Tried this spot cause it was new to me. My family enjoyed their steak and eggs and other breakfast options as well. 

For this visit, I decided on the "Las Vegas winner" breakfast. With was 3 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, 2 pancakes and hash browns. Perfect combo and totally worth it for $10! Good portions here, and good service. Definitely would come back and eat here again!

Sloooow service. Definitely not coming back here since it's not worth it. If you want to have a late night meal go to Tacos el gordo, it's definitely worth it and very affordable. 

When we got here I can already see they were busy and understaffed. Took 10 minutes for someone to come up to us and greet us, by then we were already set on the steak and egg deal that I thought was $4.99. 

Steak and eggs was nothing  extraordinary, Norms is much better than what I was served. They over buttered my English muffins to the point where I scraped a few good chunks off. The steak was asked for medium rare and was over cooked to well. It was decent but nothing to get excited over. Had to use hot sauce and salt for more flavor. I ordered my eggs over medium since I love it runny and that was surprisingly cooked perfectly. I like combining it with the steak or hash brown, it helps give different texture. Eventually we finished our meal but service was no where to be found for a refill of water. I just grabbed my sister's water and finished it. Eventually we flagged our waiter to get the check and paid our way.

Located in the Tuscany hotel.
12.99 steak and eggs with hash brown or grits and toast. It was all bland but good thing for pepper and ketchup. Did not like the fact that they put butter on all the toasts but the jam spread made up for it.
Overall steak and eggs in Vegas is always inexpensive, love it!

Great steak and eggs special!! Short walk from our hotel on the strip and worth it. Food was out in decent time given how busy they were. The Tuscany had another spot, Pub 365, that looked nice as well.

We tried this restaurant on our last morning in Vegas for breakfast because it had such great reviews! We were NOT disappointed. The service was great, the staff, especially our waiter Oscar, was very courteous and attentive, the food was delicious and the portions were huge! All for a very low price! I wish we were here another night so we could try the infamous $5 steak and eggs. Definitely worth it! Oh, and the coffee was exceptional, coming I'm a coffee snob who thinks Starbucks is overrated!

Ordered room service from Marilyn's while staying at the Tuscany. The service was very quick (was well within the estimated 30 minutes quoted), and the pizza was tasty. I order the personal BBQ chicken pizza. The crust was crispy and the sauce was very generous. Also, the delivery guy was kind enough to point out that the tip was already included when I went to tip him. He could have easily taken the extra cash. The honesty was very refreshing to see. Room service prices were extremely reasonable.
Fast service, tasty & plentiful breakfast at a great price. I mentioned that to the manager who indicated he hadn't raised prices in a decade!

BEST STEAK & EGGS SPOT IN VEGAS! YEEEAH BUDDY

but they stop serving it at 5am. k go now!!

WHY 5 STARS FOR A CRUMMY DINER AT A SOMEWHAT CRUMMY HOTEL?

SERVICE IS AWESOME AND THEIR $3.99 STEAK AND EGGS IS AMAZINGGGGGGGGGGGGGG!!!!!

I have always come to this place almost everytime I go to Vegas. They're steak and eggs deal starts at 12am and goes until I believe 6am. Here's a secret, get your hashbrowns loaded, it's a dollar extra but soooo worth it! They top your hashbrowns with gravy and cheese and onions or something like that...I can never remember since I'm always a little...who are we kidding, I'm DRUNK when I come here! They've got powerade, for those who party too hard at the clubs...lol. But seriously this place is wellll worth the taxi ride!! :) Sucks cause I always forget to take a picture of my steak and eggs, since...you know...I probably can't even remember my name when I come here.

Best breakfast in Vegas!! I love breakfast and there are a million places to eat in Vegas so I looked on yelp for the best breakfast near the strip and this is what I found! It's inside the Tuscany Suites and Casino, straight back from the entrance of the casino. It's a 24 hour cafe that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. I would compare this to a mom and pop version of Denny's, with better prices. 

I got the "Big Winner" which comes with 2 eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, toast, hash browns AND pancakes..... for $8.99!!!! And this isn't even a special! They have cheaper prices if you come during certain times on weekdays. And the taste was GREAT. We really liked our server John. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made our experience even better.

Basically..... I can't wait to come back to Vegas to have breakfast at Marilyn's!

This place has good, no nonsense food.  The price is amazing.  In fact, the quality is on the upper end of food I've had in Vegas.  I will definitely be back if I'm even in Vegas again.

I had the turkey pot pie, and it was awesome.  I picked up the tab for my partner in crime, and it was lower by half what my next lowest dining bill was on this trip, just for me.
My husband and I always stay at the Tuscany.  Suites are very nice and most importantly Marilyns Cafe is delicious!  Great service amazing food all in one!

Let me start by saying "I Love sea food". So when my husband takes me to an all you can eat crab legs im in heaven.  
The restaurant was very clean and it was nice, Tuscany Casino is a small casino compared to what you expect to see near the strip. I wasn't sure on what to expect, but i was very pleased. If you order all you can eat crab legs and you want bread, you need to ask. They will only bring you bread when you ask. 
The crab legs where delicios and warm/hot, which i love. You get to pick 2 sides. I got green beans and mash potatoes, both were great. 

I'm giving them 4 stars because it took them a little while to bring more crab legs and also for soda refills. The waiter was really nice, I could tell that she got very busy and she was going back between tables. It's fine with me, i worked at a restaurant before and i understant how that can be. Over all great experience and the price is only $19.99 per person. *plus drinks

I picked up Togo food prime rib. Tara the graveyard shift manager was extremely friendly and helpful. I was just amazed how much she cared about someone picking up food Togo. Oh yeah the prime rib with 2 sides and corn bread was only 14$... Delicious! Will be back with my co workers considering they're open 24 hours
I ate here and I ended up with food poisoning for 14hrs. So sad no one has called me after living them a message.

Came here on Friday for the AYCE crab legs. The crab legs were fine, but after a while, I got sick of opening up the shells to get the meat...haha. It can get a little busy for the crab legs, so getting a refill on your drink can be a little bit of a challenge sometimes. The staff is nice, though. They will replenish your crab leg supply often, and most of the time before you're done with your last batch. I think it was nice to try once, but since I live across town, I don't think I will need to return. I haven't tried any of the other food, so I don't know if it's any good.

If you are in Vegas on a Friday night and craving crab legs then try this place. Just know going in that this is not fine dining and more like a glorified IHOP. It makes sense to go here for $22 p.p. AYCE if that's what you're craving and don't want to pay $50 at fancier buffets. It's located in Tuscany Hotel & Casino. 

The AYCE is only on Friday nights and there is a full menu for those not interested in crab.  This place is also open 24/7 and has a $5 steak and eggs.

I want to give a shout out to all the wait staff at this restaurant!  If you are contemplating getting into the restaurant business come see and experience 1st rate staff at this restaurant.  Everyone helps each other here.  Even though they were not waiting on us it was nothing to see fellow staff help each other out with tables they are not working.

The price you ask!  Is very reasonable, i felt guilty paying so less for some excellent food.  No I was not drunk when i ate here.  Well, maybe a few times.  We ate breakfast, lunch and dinner here throughout our week stay in Vegas.  We were not disappointed during any of our meals.  I would highly suggest 2 things.  Stay here and eat here.  You will have a great time and meals.

Oh yeah, WEDNESDAY specials Steak and LOBSTER!!!!!!

We decided on this place because they had 4 out of 5 stars! What we experienced was a 2 star restaurant at most. Very slow service with no one really in the restaurant. Food took a long time to come out, silverware had food stuck on them, soup & salad came out wrong. The only good part was the homemade potato chips were good.

I went with my niece & her friends, they wanted the all you can eat crab legs for 16 dollars. I like crab, but I don't LOVE it so I opted for the fried chickend, brocoli & mashed potatos. The mashed potatos were soooooooooooooo good! Everything else was ok. Now our waiter, Victor...was thee worst. I think he was having a bad day to begin with because when we got there he was having trouble with the previous table. Red flag #1 He was very quick with us, rude, impatient. I asked him if I could have the basket of bread that comes with my meal...he proceeded to tell me that I could not have it unless I requested it... Ummm sir that is why I am requesting it :) Some people at our table wanted to swap out their rice for something else because they didn't like it, he told us he was going to get in trouble with the chefs...etc.... And he also brought out an extra plate of crab legs and by the time they were ready to be eaten they were cold sooo unfortunately no one wanted them...he was really mad about that. I stayed as polite as I knew how to be before I went to management and let them know what was going on. I woould maybe go back to try something else, but I WILL NOT sit in Victors section #NOMAAM
Not bad but not great. Hostess was not friendly and the buffalo chicken was cold and not much spice to it.

$5 steak and eggs starting at midnight!

we got into vegas a little after 10pm and before we went too far along into the night of drinks, gambling, and more drinks, we wanted to grab some food. there weren't too many places that were nearby and open late serving decent food, but going to Marilyn's at the Tuscany was a unanimous choice given their steak and eggs special that we ordered right as we got in (which as luck would have it, was right at midnight).

ice tea, medium-well steak, and eggs over-medium, and sourdough toast for $5 and i'm a happy man, ready to burn the midnight oil on our first evening in Sin City.

the service was quick, which i'd imagine is either because a february Vegas trip isn't as crazy and packed as one in the summer, and/or the fact we got there right at 12. the other times when i've decided to stop at Marilyn's at the Tuscany for steak and eggs have been when it was closer to 3am, after a long night out cruising the strip or checking out one of the clubs and the waits (for our parties of 10+) have always been closer to an hour.

satisfying meal for the price. plus you can hit the $5 blackjack tables at the casino when you're done.

-civilities.

Don't kid yourself here...
This place is the late night king
When you want a steak.

Close proximity
From all of the major clubs
And always open.

This place has brought me
Back from the dead numerous
Times in my career.

The servers are great,
But we are here for the steak
And eggs with two toast.

No A-1 sauce but 
Lea & Perrings does the job.
Get the fried mushrooms!

Best in the city
For steggs that is priced just right.
Medium rare though...

Shortly after midnight the German, Starsky and myself checked out the cafe. This was my first visit. The other two had been here previously. The menu is huge! Burgers, Apps, pizzas, and other stuff but the key here is breakfast. I want my breakfast after playing some pokers for a few hours. 

We started off with some sweet potato waffle fries. Pretty good. Crispy and plentiful for the 3 of us. But what we came for was what we all ordered. Steak and Eggs for $3.99. Boom! Awesome deal. 2 eggs anyways you want, a petite strip steak that was tender. Not a hockey puck like Bill's Gamblin Hall's Victorian Room's steak and eggs for a $1 more. Oh yeah, it also comes with toast, which I got sourdough, and hash browns. Excellent deal and it hit the spot. 

The German and Starsky got dessert. Looked yummy. Starsky got a huge sundae and the German got some chocolate molten cake.
Service started off a little slow but once they took our drink orders everything went well. When we got the bill the total was $26! Easy game. I'll be back here real soon.

I've been here about 3 times, but it seems that each time is less memorable than the previous visit.  It's a good deal for the crab, but in my opinion there are so many options in Vegas that surpass Marilyn's Cafe.

Pros:  
  *  There's an AYCE crab feast for $15.98 per person on Friday nights
  *  the AYCE option comes with 2 side dishes 
  *  Free refills on drinks 
  *  Service was pretty good.  The manager of the restaurant even came by.
  *  Quality of the crab itself was mediocre

Cons:
  *  Outdated ambiance
  *  No refills on your sides
  *  Slow service
  *  Raised the price on the AYCE option (previously $12.99)
  *  It was cold throughout the restaurant.

Overall:
  Since the last time I went here, it seems that they have boosted up the price a bit on the AYCE.  That was the main thing that Marilyn's Cafe had going for them was the crab at a killer price.  Since it's a bit more expensive now (in comparison to before), there are other places throughout the valley that offer AYCE for a little more money (way better quality though and more for your money too).  It also doesn't help that was extremely chilly inside the restaurant.  It made my meal less enjoyable.  I live in the Northwest side of town and it's always a pain to get to Tuscany Suites from home (especially on a Friday night).  I do not think I'll be coming here for their AYCE crab anytime soon.  Perhaps on another night for their regular menu, but I have yet to try that.  I'll definitely update my review once I do though.  From reading other reviews, it seems like they have some other good deals that are worth checking out (such as the Steak and Egss for $3.99... unless they changed the price on that too?)

Tips:
  *  Make sure to check out the menu for all the other days.  Different days = different specials
  *  Bring something warm to wear.  It was very cold in there.
  *  You have to walk out of the restaurant to use the restroom, but its right around the corner.
Food was cold. Biscuits and gravy was bland. Ask for poached eggs runny and the yolk was hard. Go to Ellis Island if u want a cheap good breakfast

I'm a repeat customer, but it's been a while.  I was used to getting crab and having to tell the server NOT to bring more..but this time (Friday @7pm) it was more like "hey....hey......hey......hey.....hey......ok.......hey......hey" to get a drink, refill, crab, lemons, etc.   
so, be sure to try and sit closer to register, away from the big tables.
Service was fantastic. Our waitress Miriam was amazing, attentive, prompt and alert. The food was so damn delicious and so cheap. Like 3 blocks away from the strip behind the Linq.
The crab legs for 12.99 along with two sides on Friday are delish.. also the 16 oz steak is great. fast service and the food is so well prepared for the price.
Busy - reasonable prices with good food and nice sized portions. Service is non-existent. Two stars

This review is about the AYCE Crab Dinner

Mediocre corn.
Mediocre rice.
Mediocre crab.

What happened? I use to love the AYCE crab dinner here because the crab was so warm and juicy. This time the crab was just room temperature and the sides were just blah.The only thing that improved was that they now put their butter on burners, so it never solidifies. The thing I hate the most was that they raised the Crab Dinner price to $15.99 (drink not included)!! That's 3 bucks more than when I use to come here not too long ago. That's a big difference. For just a few bucks more than that I can go to a seafood buffet with unlimited drinks. I don't think I'll be coming here again for the ayce crab dinner. It's no longer a great value.
Graveyard special. Hash browns, steak and eggs all really good. Was at south point and their deal was 4.99. This was 5.99 and was a lot better quality of steak. Just have to try.

Our service was generally good. Despite the ravings here, I would say it's just OK. The food was adequate but certainly not "made with love" as my partner put it who came for their steak and eggs. The plates are huge which was literally awkward when they put one slice of French toast on it next to your eggs. We asked for no toast but it still was on the plate but once removed the spinach omelette look sad & small. The prices were inexpensive for Vegas but it's an example of getting what you paid for.

Food was great but there was one rude waitress that ruined my visit here . 
My husband and I came to get food for ourselves & his niece, as we pick up our food the waitress that handed us our food commented that it was a lot of  food, & how could we eat that much not even when's  hungry she'll be able to eat that much . 
I would have put a name but she wasn't even wearing her name tag .

I've only been here between the hours of 1-4am, but you can't really beat $5.99 steak and eggs after a long night of drinking and dancing at the club. 

The plate comes with a good-portioned steak, hash browns, 2 eggs (any way you like), 2 whole slices of toast (white, wheat, sourdough). I usually order it, medium rare, over-easy or sunny side up eggs with sourdough bread. 

TIPS: Dip the toast in the runny egg yolk for that next level deliciousness. 

You get what you pay for, but this hits the spot every time, I've always left feeling satisfied. Plus, I've never had to wait, so definitely my #1 recommendation for late night bites at a very affordable price.

What a joke! Service is way too long for 1:00am (not pm) and basically empty. Still it took more than 15 minutes to bring out breakfast food. I got up and left, disgusted! Overpriced...$8 for a breakfast bagel! You must be kidding. I will go to Starbucks instead and pay 1/'2 that for the same plus coffee.

so this place has a special from 12 AM to 6AM they have have a $5.00 steak and egg , with toast!
Amazing deal right ?!
yes & no. The service here is terrible, slow, and unfriendly.  I literally had to flag down a waiter, then he gave me the wait finger,  finally took my order and didn't even put it in , 
he was straight up just rude. I know it's 1 AM but if it's part of your specialty have some integrity and don't make the place miserable

Need cheap place to eat at 4am? 
Come here. It's a little hard to get to since this is located in a janky hotel+casino off the strip. Ask taxi driver and he will tell you this is a place to get steak+eggs for the best price.

My husband and I used to eat here all the time, today we picked up a couple of breakfasts; he had chicken fried steak that taste like flour the gravy was not cooked correctly and the steak was mushy the eggs over easy were overcooked and I don't know what's happened to the food sizes they've gotten smaller the quality of cooks they have now or terrible.

Juicy steak, perfectly cooked every time I come! Crispy hash browns, delicious wheat toast with my favorite strawberry jelly, and scrambled eggs which they serve you a generous portion of. This place is my absolute favorite Steak and Eggs place around town! 

It's almost embarrassing that the waiters that work here remember my order. I guess I just come here too much? Who can say no to the midnight special! 

Sevens are very attentive. They refill our drinks as soon as it hits empty and checks up on us every so often.

Wasn't sure how to rate this place, but it all came down to the service and food we received. 

We had an issue, where we sat. You can see the servers come in and out of the kitchen. We had a perfect shot of what was going inside the kitchen. We had noticed a couple of servers coming out to the dining area chewing on something. As it turned out, they were eating food from the kitchen! I get it, things happen in the kitchen all the time. But don't make it so obvious. At least finish chewing before coming out to serve the food. 
Besides that everything else was great. I had the T bone steak, it was great! I also enjoyed the mashed potatoes and gravy that came with it. Wife had the baked lasagna. Think she enjoyed it also. Service was great, and when we will stay at Tuscany in the future. Have no problem eating there again.

To be honest I have never actually seen their full menu and I've probably only ordered only their steak and eggs BUT They've got the best deals for steak and eggs near the strip!! Definitely one of my go-to places for a late night meal or drunchies (haha). 

Their steak and eggs come with 2 eggs (sunny, scrambled, over easy, over hard), 2 slices of toast (sour dough, wheat, white, rye), and hash browns! I typically end up leaving more than half the hash browns just cause it's just THAT much food! 

Service is definitely a bit slow in that time of night, so please bear with the wait times if you have a big party. 

Located towards the back of the hotel, make sure your uber/lyft/cab drops you off at the 2nd entrance (not towards koval).

3.99 steak and egg only for midnight to 5am! We walked in  this place in the afternoon. Regular price everything and tastes so so.  You can find better food with lower price in a lot other restaurants in Vegas such as Ellis island!  And service in this place is terrible no energy at all! 2 stars for the bread and butter.....

STEAK & EGGS ($5) is the reason why I come here after the club in Vegas. So cheap and so good! $5 gets you a steak, eggs, hash browns, and buttered toast. I get my side of rice of course to eat with my eggs. The perfect meal to end a night.

I honesty don't even know where this place is even located in Vegas, I just get in the cab and tell the driver Tuscany steak and eggs haha. The $5 deal I believe is late night only.

This place can be filled with lots of drunk people in the early morning but that's okay - the food is what matters :)

Maybe I should've kept to the meals that other yelpers recommend from this place. I stayed at the Tuscany Hotel and decided to eat a late lunch here the day we arrived. The restaurant has no ambiance whatsoever and the service is almost nonexistent. Even so, I figured the food might be ok since it has good reviews. Unfortunately my friend and I went with the prime rib dip and it was just Meh. The fries were good though. The main issue was that we both felt kind of sick about an hour later, thank goodness for pepto bismol chewables!

Not likely to eat here again unless I'm pretty desperate.

umm where do i begin! Really! steak and egg specials!! DELICIOUS!! SOOOO GOOD! It literally beat any other fine restaurant   in Vegas! I loved it! From my amazing waiter.. (forgot his name but, a white male with lots of energy) to my chocolate chip whip cream pancakes! Ohhh myyy goshhhhh If you dont try them after reading this review I feel bad for you! The location is inside the Tuscany Inn where I was staying and after the amazing nights of partying hard I knew I could depend on toppin my night off at Marilyns! open all night and very affordable!

I came here twice during my two day stay in Vegas. Good prices for a lot of food with pretty good service. It's like a hidden gem! It wasn't crowded at all both times that I went, at 1:30 PM and 5 AM. 

First time I got the 12 oz steak with loaded hash browns and potato salad. Potato salad was ok, so were the hash browns. I devoured the steak, I wanted it cooked medium well and it came out just the way I wanted! You can also request bread rolls but they ran out so they gave us corn bread which was delicious. For $12.99 it was a pretty good deal. 

Service was pretty good, the server came by to check on us a few times, refilled our water, gave us extra napkins... 

I don't have anything bad to say about this place!

Ate here twice, within the last month.  It's quickly becoming one of my favorite casino coffee shops.  On one visit, I had the NY steak and shrimp, and that was excellent and the price was very reasonable.  On my second visit, I had a reuben sandwich, and that was very very good. 
For a coffee shop, it's obvious that the staff takes pride in this cafe, and it even shows in the food presentation.  
I hope to be back soon!

This was our spot when we stayed at the Tuscany during our multiple Vegas trips. Open all the time and the $4.99 steak and eggs was a steal! Who could say no? It is especially enticing after a night on the strip and rounds of booze ;) So yeah, it might not be top quality steak or anything but drunchies claims otherwise!

The food was good but the service was AMAZING! The food came fairly quickly considering how busy they were. The server was so polite and patient with me. I had to send one of my chicken breast back due to it being overcooked but he took it to the back with a smile on his face. NOT a fake smile. He talked and chatted, he was quick getting our drinks filled and our bill taken care of. 

MILITARY DISCOUNT was given to us. 

Me, my husband, and our three kids all left with half of our meals. The servings are fairly big for the price. The lemonade is really good too.

Came here for an early dinner at around 5 on a Monday.  Had the prime rib special...prime rib not flavorful at all, glazed carrots were not glazed, although you could taste the brown sugar.  Broccoli tasted old.  Decent prices though!

Went here to try their all you can eat crab legs. I had  read there is always a line so we went early. They start serving at 4pm. We were there at 5 and there was no wait. The service was amazing. I never had to wait for a refill. The amount of crab legs that they serve was a full plate. It was delicious, I had 3 plates full!
If you love crab legs like I do, I would highly reccommend this place. We will definately be back nect time we're in town.

Thank you  for the exceptional service from our waiter  Arnold. This was the best service my boyfriend  and I  had all weekend.  The prices were very reasonable and the food was fantastic.  I will definitely be coming back to Marilyn s  the next time I'm in Vegas! :)

I love that it's 24 hours, I come here every time that I'm in Vegas and staying at the Tuscany it's so convenient, the only thing I would say is to speed up the take out orders I waited for like 40mins at 1:30am for my food but other than that it was worth the wait. Oh yeah and there is plenty of food options and the price is amazing with good quality food.

We had dinner here and it took 2 hours, making us almost late for our flight. A couple of things went wrong: one of our orders was messed up, the rare t-bone was medium well, and the service was extremely slow. It took us 10-15 min of waiting to get our check because after we asked for it our server went to take orders from another table, which took forever. It was an unpleasant experience because of all the things that went wrong. The food was decent but not enough to make us come back. All we got was a bunch of apologies and no improvement!
I stayed at the Tuscany hotel and this cafe/diner was really convenient with good quality food for affordable price.  Food was really nothing special, but just solid good quality.
This place is awesome. Food is incredible and the waitress Riza is absolutely the BEST!!!

Fairly good pancakes, especially for all you can eat at $3.99.
The French toast was also good as well as the eggs, hash browns, and toast. It's nothing to write home about.
Our waitress was really nice and attentive. She even had a great personality and was funny. She made it a better experience than it would have been otherwise (+1 star).
The music and sound of the nearby casino is the major downfall. It's in the "Tuscany" and they have pop music on. If that odd mix of genre isn't enough, there is a slot machine that plays western ompa polka music about every 30 seconds and it's louder than the pop music.
Overall it's a good cheap breakfast.

I used to come here more often years ago when they had a promotion where you would get $10 off on any bill of $20 or over.Almost everybody that I recommended this place to or dined with liked it.My friend Arthur is visiting Las Vegas and he is staying at the Tuscany so I suggested that we have lunch here.We both had prime rib and we both enjoyed it immensely.
The price is very reasonable and the quality of the food is quite good.You're not getting overcharged like you would be in a lot of the tourist traps in the Strip,where you're paying for a brand name.Our food server Wendy was an absolute sweetheart.She was very warm,friendly,personable and efficient.They have a large selection of side dishes,too,of which you get your choice of two included with any entree.I cannot recommend this place enough.You will get very good value for your dollar and the quality of your food should be to your liking,IMHO.
Nice clean restaurant just a few blocks off the strip.  Great breakfast at a very reasonable price

Ordered the steak & eggs and it was delicious. My eggs were scrambled as requested. Toast was yum, hash browns were yummy and my steak was cooked how I like it. My server was very attentive and stopped by often to check on me. The food came out pretty quick, no complaints with anything. I'll definitely be back. And paid less than $15.

I love finding good & cheap eats!!! 


PROS:
1.) Graveyard deal: $5.99 steak & eggs! 12am-6

2.) Big portions perfect for when you have late night drunchies.

3.) They cook your steak just the way you like it & it's perfect every time!

4.) Clean & spacious!

5.) Employees are very friendly! 

6.) Steak & eggs meal comes with toast that's already buttered for you!! 

7.) Hashbrowns comes perfectly brown! You can ask for it to be extra crispy if you like!


CONS:
1.) The service is questionable. The first time I was here the food came really fast but the second time I was here it took a while for the food to come out. 


VERDICT:
-You'll definitely see me back every time I'm in Vegas for a good meal!

Had late night dinner here last night with my wife. Food was great, HUGE potions at super price. Reminded us of old school Vegas pricing. We had James as our server and will be back many times thanks to him! He is great...
One of the best breakfasts ever!! Huge portions, really good eggs, homefriends, pancakes. BIG WIN!

My first breakfast spot on vacation and the food was good with a large menu. Plenty of options at an affordable price. Within walking distance from the high roller Ferris wheel and flamingo hotel (~15 mins). On the plus, I was able to build up an even bigger appetite walking over. Service was also quick and efficient. Seated and eating within 10 mins.

I'm gonna go out on a whim and say you stumbled onto this restaurant by searching for 'steak and eggs'. High five for you! 

Nothing says you've had a good night like some $4.99 steak and over easy yolk-porn.  It's a guarantee that the entire plate will be devoured in under 5 minutes. Time me if you don't believe me. heheh 

Don't complain about slow service and stop being picky about the quality. it's $4.99 and you're drunk, so just be happy and enjoy the rest of your night.

The reviews are true, great food, great service and great price.  Had the Veggie omelette and it was one of the better omelettes I have ever had.  

My service was always on the ready to fill my coffee cup and she was lightning fast.  

Parking is easy making this a much better spot for breakfast then anything on the strip!

STEAK & EGGS SPECIAL!!

**2016 Yelp 100 LV Challenge #4**

I purely come here for the Steak & Eggs, but time to time we get some biscuits & gravy as well. The place is very old cafe restaraunt style w/ all the condiments layer out on the tables. Every time we have been here.... the service has been pretty damn GOOD. Those who haven't gotten good service based on other reviews.... I don't really see it... or maybe we ALWAYS get lucky w/ an awesome server. On occasion our steaks don't come out the way we want it... but whatever... you get what you pay for. 

They have Steak & Egg special everyday after 12am 

STEAK & EGG SPECIAL $5.99 - for that price I think you get a pretty damn good meal... eggs however you like them.... a big slap of hash browns...  2 pieces of buttered toast, & what I believe may be around a 5oz. Steak that isn't too bad as long as it's not overcooked! 

I would come back all day any day I feel like have a cheap decent meal.... & honestly... wouldn't really care if I got bad service... you are getting McDonald's price for quality food! =]

I love that they have AYCE crab legs here but her are the pros and cons. 1) only 4-10pm on Friday nights AYCE snow crab legs $24 per person and it comes with two sides. 2) there was a wait for us (25mins) they don't take reservations and limited options for large groups. 3) not that I needed to but they don't do split checks. 4) first plate was cold crab but the butter sauce they provide is over a tealight candle so that got warm. 5) my butter sauce began to boil and would pop up at me distracting me from eating- call it personal but I don't want hot butter popping my face. 6) took over an hour to get napkins. I know they're busy but I had to ask three people. 7) overall great price for snow crab legs but the atmosphere had me uncomfortable at times. Plus there's seating next to Casino and people love to stare at you while you eat. So that was uncomfortable too.
They have a pancake special all-you-can-eat for just 3,99$ that is very good and the staff is very friendly!
never dissapointing at alll absolutely the best staff also/.....
I ordered the French toast complete with a side of hashbrowns, and my husband ordered the las vegas winner with side of cornbeef hash. The food was delicious.

I can't say enough good things about this place... I absolutely love it here. 

I have been eating here since 2008, I probably go, on average, once a month. I don't live close, so I usually make a special trip. The staff has always been amazing and for a casino cafe, the atmosphere isn't obnoxious.

The food is kinda homey and the portions are more than adequate, especially for the reasonable prices. I love the Turkey dinner, it's like Thanksgiving anytime!

If you haven't been, I totally recommend giving it a try!

This place is the $hit!!!!!!!!!!!!! I honestly can not give this place enough stars. We came here as a second option and boy howdy I am glad we came. Service was friendly and quick. Food was PERFECT. Pancakes were so dang good. The price, my god the price. I have 4 kids who all eat like little monsters so finding cheap meals has become an art form in our house. This place has the BEST FOOD and for the price the food just taste even that much better. Here is a comparison. My wife and I got a 1 breakfast plate(big portions), FOREVER pancakes(all you can eat), tea, and a coffee for less than 2 large cups of coffee and a breakfast pastry at Starbucks. The night before, yes we went there multiple times, got a breakfast bowl and my god it was so delicious. I pushed my stomach beyond what any human should ever do but it was so DAM good!!!!!! This will forever be a must for us if we come back to Vegas. It may be the reason we do come back.

Anyone below who knocks this place...well I cannot not think of any other plausible reason other than they are just not smart and are expecting the moon and stars from a 24-hr café at an off the strip casino/hotel.

The place is clean, well lit, and décor was satisfactory. The service was just right. Only coming back when plates were clearly done or to refill beverages which clearly needed to be filled; and they were friendly about it.

The food was pretty darn good. The $3.95 all day all you can eat pancakes are beyond adequate for that price. The steak and eggs special, while not on the level to make Gordon Ramsay not scream, were very good for the price and you got to pancakes as a side. The steak was a bit thin and had some more fat on it thenI would have liked, but nothing to cry about. The eggs weren't perfect, but having been to Vegas 8 times in 6 years and having 40+ breakfasts, I am yet to find good eggs. So I was not unhappy. I didn't get sick and they looked/tasted like eggs. Little ketchup and Tabassco did wonders (as they usually do).

My group also, took part in the all-you-can eat crab legs on Friday night for $16.95. We took down 100+ legs. None of us were sick or even felt uncomfortable...just full. Again, not the best I have ever had, but really, quality shell fish in Vegas is hard to come-by (I live in CT, good seafood is a staple in my neck of the woods, so I am spoiled...very few places in Vegas come even close to what I experience on the norm).

I will agree with one Yelper down below...BRING YOUR OWN WATER. The water was a bit funky. It may be the local filtration process, I do not know. But after a 'long night in Vegas', water the next morning is clutch. Not from here though.

I would give this 4.5 stars if possible. But I went with 4, because of the Water thing, and the steaks were a 'tad underwhelming' (that may be too harsh, but it is the best I can think of). Definitely check this place out if you are on or near Flamingo at or East of the Strip.

Unbelievably good. Had the best 10oz prime rib anywhere for $12.99 and it came with two sides and bread. Had a choice of about 15 sides. Chose the sweet potato waffle fries and green beans. Everything was fresh and well seasoned. Had a brewed iced tea and with tip paid $19. Heard the 4 piece fried chicken for $8.99 is excellent too but the menu said to allow extra 15 minutes because it's made to order. This is my new go to place.

Food was great. My cousin and I ordered the unlimited crab legs for $23.99 each. Service was nice but slow. Our original waiter was quick on it but he went home and the girl we got next was the slower one. She wasn't quick on refills. And when we got tired of waiting we asked for the check. She charged me over $77 for a completely different table. Then to fix it she charged me for my table $59. My money is still in limbo. So, if you eat here PAY CASH!!!!

I'd spend the night at Tuscany and got a buy one get one free entree coupon and used it here. The french toast complete is good deal. I'd split it with my sister and we were both full. Service is also vry friendly. Total was ~$8. Great deal if you get the coupon.

Ate here for breakfast, it's a few blocks from the hotel I'm staying at. The place wasn't packed at all, then  again we did come at 7am. I believe it's open 24 hours tho. The service was good and the food wasn't spectacular, but it was good.

Loooooooooove  Marilynns , always on point excellant food and staff, forget the strio resataunts tourist traps , im gonna write guy fiery a letter saying "weve been to Marilynns.....we want our money back"  lol the burger at Marilynns distroys any on the strip and its only like 8.49 , dont be a tourist get over to Marilynns and see for yourself
The best breakfast we had while visiting Las Vegas. The hash browns were AMAZING. The meat lovers breakfast was also AMAZING. We ate there twice in one week.

Really good food that's affordable & just a couple minutes away from the strip. We took the 202 bus there with no problems. The French toast is good , but I did not like the orange juice or the syrup that was served. It tasted old and the syrup was bland. Other than that , we enjoyed our food.
Man this place is great. Loved my chicken fried steak. My buddy really like his senior portion steak and eggs too. Will be back next time I am in Las Wages.

When in Vegas, one craves prime rib. So we ended up here. 

We were super excited when we arrived, mainly because we walked 15 minutes and were hungry as hell. The service was nice enough at first. Their free bread and cornbread was also great. 

For $13.99, you can't beat what you get. You get at least 12+ ounces of prime rib and their mashed potatoes with gravy was also great. Hooooowever. The flavor does tend to get old after a while and it just becomes hard to finish. We also felt a little neglected after a while but our server still did a decent job. I would give this place a try again. It's not like I hated it. Lol. I just wish it were a little better.

This diner-style restaurant is located inside the Tuscany, a casino where few younger party-folks venture out, and let me tell you... this place is freaking amazing as a 12-5am pit stop after the club for the $3.99 steak and eggs special. 

No, it is not the most gourmet quality steak you will ever eat, but it's a healthy-sized, juicy cut without tons of fat. The taste is decent, made delicious with lots of BBQ sauce. And when it comes to the drunchies when all you want is a satisfying meal for a low price, it's def a great value.
