Comes with two eggs cooked as you like, hashbrowns (and they're good!!) and with toast of a bread of your choice - makes for a HUGE meal for the price. 

Haven't tried anything else, but that deal alone is worth the trip. And the time window is pretty big - 12am is early in Vegas time!! If steak/eggs isn't your thing, they have plenty of other menu items and a couple other specials (I think  $5 monster burger?) but really, if you realllyy WANT something else, you're better off elsewhere!

How has it taken me this long to discover this restaurant?!  The best Steak & Eggs the Strip has to offer!  & what is better is that it is only $5.99!

My girlfriends & I came here after Omnia around 3a after our other girlfriend recommended it & it had quite a few customers.  Great customer service! 

Steak & Eggs, served with Hasbrowns & Toast - I ordered it medium & it was juicy, tender, & flavorful!  What a hearty meal!

We stayed at Tuscany for several days and we enjoyed the meals at Marilyns. Portions are huge. 

I had the french toast breakfast, which was delicious. Husband had the steak and eggs with pancakes for $6.99. Can't beat the price. The steak was properly cooked, but it could have used a bit more salt. For dinner, I tried the baked ziti. So good! Like super good. I crave it. Husband had the salmon which was also cooked perfectly. I will be back here the next time we are in LV. Glad we found Tuscany and even more glad we found Marilyns.

5/5 stars for great customer service!

[SERVICE]
I came here around 4AM on a Friday night/Saturday morning with a group of 10 and we were seated immediately. The servers came by to take our drink orders and patiently took our food orders while we tried to figure out what everyone was getting. They also made sure to check on us throughout our meal. Thank you to the servers that were so kind and friendly, it was definitely the best service I've received in a while, and especially at such a weird dining hour.

[FOOD]
I ordered the NY strip steak with scrambled eggs, hash brown, and wheat toast. You can't get good steak and eggs at any time of the day for such a great price anywhere else! I ordered my steak medium well and it was cooked perfectly. Very satisfied with my order.

To summarize, the place is worth coming to for steak and eggs on your weekend Vegas trip.

5.99 steak &eggs with a beer? COUNT ME IN! 

everytime i'm in vegas this is a must go to place! not only for one day but for every day that i'm in vegas &i do just that! the wait can vary depending on what time of the day you go but i come here around 11 am &the wait is about 10 min. ive only tried their steak &eggs but boy are they yummy! &did i mention the portion of the steak is huge &delicious?!?! the meal comes with steak, eggs, hash brown &bread and also your choice of beer all for only 5.99! can't beat that price anywhere &the service is also amazing as well we never had to ask for anything because our waitress always checked up on us &was very attentive! another added bonus is their hours! their open 24 hours a day so after the club this would be a perfect place to go too when you get hungry!

$4.99 late night steak and eggs!

We used to take a $25 (one way!) cab ride to South Point for their $2.95 steak and eggs. But since I discovered this spot, I'll definitely be going here instead of alllllll the way to South Point.

It took a while before we got our food, but the wait was worth it. Steak, eggs, hash browns, and sourdough toast. Perfect after a night out of drinking and dancing. Oh, and the fact that it's only $4.99 makes it better.

Check this spot out for the late night s&e cravings. It's located at the Tuscany Inn which is a block behind Bally's. Not far from the main strip!

All you can eat snow crab legs for $20 on friday night from 4-10.  Awesome!  Service was fast, snow crab was hot and delicious, plates were refilled promptly.  One of the best meals i've had in Vegas for sure!  Don't get the mac and cheese as a side, though.  It was nasty.  Cauliflower was delicious.

I was recommended to this place for some cheap food by my friend. I think he comes here when he's drunk/hungover. I was too sober for this. Our entire table got the steak eggs for $5.99 at around 12am when we had just arrived in Vegas. My dining experience was pretty much ruined by weirdos and loud skanky girls.

My friends and I absolutely loved this place. It's not too far from the strip and prices are incredibly affordable! Staff is friendly, upbeat and our server was incredibly nice and attentive. 
There's a wide variety of options for food and the portions are pretty decent. Everything was delicious.
I would highly recommend this place to anybody looking for a cheaper meal in Vegas!

I'm a regular here & I always anticipate consistent results with my same order.  I usually get the $5.99 after midnight steak & eggs special.  The medium rare steak I get is very consistent.  I did get side of green beans one time & that quickly became my favorite side order.

After a coworker found this on yelp and tasted the steak and eggs, I felt I had to try this place. One word comes to mind: impressive. 

A very warm and inviting atmosphere with a good view of the casino. It's a casual dinner witch is always a plus and also does room service for the hotel. 

Avoid a-la-carte items as these appeared a little heavy to me for a dinner. However the special menus(daily and lunch were VERY attractive.

The prime rib was sensational. Something I'd expect out of a higher end steak house. I asked for it rare and got it that way which was very pleasing. The horseradish was a nice balance of spivey and flavor. The greens and mashed potatoes were fresh and cooked just right. 

The service was just as good as the food and I'll probably be back a few more times this week!
Horrid service!! Food was decent. The waitress was quadruple sat and forgot an order. Sigh.

What's more better after the club than sleep or drink more (for you alchys, jk) ? EAT! haha! after the night of burning calories from dancing it got me hungry and my friends & I all decided to hit up Tuscany for steak & eggs!! WOW $4.99 for steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast that is such a great deal! It took awhile for the food to come out but oh well it was worth the wait! I was a bit bummed that my steak was more on the almost well done side than medium-well. All our steaks were not all correctly cooked to what we wanted but hey it was only $4.99 and it's late so maybe the cooks were tired too lol Definitely a spot to hit up for some late night grubbin!

Took my girlfriends here for one of their birthday's. We went early in the morning for breakfast and I must say the breakfast was wonderful. Now I do have one complaint the mimosa's were ok not very good. I usually order a lemon drop martini and they are bomb. But I ordered breakfast and it was sooo goo, french fries were awesome as well. Pancakes were fluffy and good. NO COMPLAINTS JUST GOOD

I would rate this place at 3.5 stars based on my two visits recently. The first time I visited it was about 23:00. I ordered french toast with bacon. The french toast was fine, but the bacon was limp and disgusting. The bacon, also, had a bunch of black specks on it, which I'm assuming is residue from the flat top. Needless to say, I didn't eat the bacon. Totally disgusting. The second time I came by it was about 20:00. I decided to order a club sandwich, despite the earlier issues with their bacon. This time, however, the bacon was fine. I made sure to look at it before eating. It was crisp and without any sign of foreign particulates. The sandwich was damn tasty, and it was a good deal like all their food. So, would I come back? Probably. Marilyn's is one of those old-school Vegas places that still has great prices and pretty solid food, which is becoming a rarity in Vegas these days. Coming here was actually cheaper than eating at the strip's White Castle.

This food was by far the worst ever. The powdered eggs look as bad as they look, soggy hash, undercooked pancakes and sour tuna melt were all just as bad. Management is rude and needs to step up on food quality.

We went here on Thursday morning, Thanksgiving for family breakfast. 6 people so we are seated right at the front at a larger table.  Drinks served quickly, order taken in appropriate amount of time.  And then the wait started. We waited just under an hour for food to be served. I have no clue why so long as the place wasn't even full.

Food was alright, nothing exceptional or horrible. We had both breakfast and lunch items. Prices were acceptable. Servers friendly but the wait was painful.  Staff at casino on phone were rude when i asked where the restaurant was located. We won't go back.

What a pleasant surprise!!   We went to this restaurant after watching a show at the Tuscany Casino.  Staff was very pleasant and the food was really good AND the prices are just amazing.  I had chicken parm and my daughter had Fettuccini Alfredo with shrimps, I had a drink, the check was under 40$!    After being gouged in the strip for dinners, this was a really good find.  

I'll make sure to return whenever I'm back in Vegas.  

It's worth the 6$ uber ride.

My group of friends and I always come here after a night of clubbing in Vegas at like 4am.  We got seated quickly and the place isn't crowded at this time.

It's cheap, tasty, and filling. It's roughly $6 for eggs, steak, hash browns, and toast.  I think they only offer this price during a limited time of the day. So, be sure to check on that. 

Service is friendly and attentive.

$4 steak and eggs. Need I say more?

Actually, yes I should!  Marilyn's also offers a $5 burger (with french fries) that is pretty decent and in my opinion, actually better tasting than the aforementioned meal.

Any time I can get steak and eggs for under $10 and the place doesn't make me worried I am going to acquire a food borne illness, I count myself a winner. That's what I got at Tuscany. 

Good and cheap food, friendly and quick service. Can't really bring myself to give more stars since nothing is all that impressive. It's just pretty much what you would expect and hope for given the price. I would certainly recommend the 10 minute walk off the strip for a bite to eat here if you are on a budget and want decent food at reasonable prices.
24 hours and everything is delicious. I have never heard of ANYONE getting food that wasnt up to par. Noce full menue. Friday nights all you can eat crab legs is always a hit!!

We were staying in Tuscany hotels and had no idea about this restaurant until I searched on Yelp for near by breakfast places. We went for breakfast around 7am on a weekday, so the restaurant was pretty much empty.
They have variety of options to choose from, even for vegetarians. Which made me very happy! 
We ordered pan cakes, Belgium waffles, and veg omelette. The food was very fresh and tasty.
Overall, the food was delicious, the prices are reasonable, the food portions is good, and the staff were very friendly and courteous. 
We will definitely visit for a lunch or dinner next time!
4.99 for steak & eggs at 3am. Oh yes. 3.90 for a glass of o.j.  Oh no. Stick to water guys and let your drunk body soak up all the meaty greasy goodness

Huge portions!! Opens 24/7!

It was getting late, we were tired, hungry, and just wanted something to eat. Thank goodness for the night life in Vegas where restaurants closes late or doesn't close at all. I know many reviewers stated they enjoyed their cheap steak and eggs, but we were neither late enough or early enough for that. So this review is for regular dining.

There is a special every day listed on their board in the front and their website. It was Wednesday, so their special was 4oz of lobster tail with 6 oz of steak and two side items. 

Chicken Parmesan $10.49- My younger cousins both loved it. They each had their own order. No side items but had two slices of garlic bread. They were full from the pasta that the bread was not consumed.

All included two side items.
10oz Prime Rib $13.49-Not bad! I got a coleslaw and hash brown. It came with dipping sauce. Not a bad price at all!
Turkey dinner $8.99- It didn't look appealing to me when I read the description and it wasn't good. The turkey slices were tough.
12oz steak-Dad chose medium rare, didn't try it, but he said it was good.

TIP: Open a membership card to receive their discount booklet. Since 4 of us were able to open a card, we took advantage and did just that. It had a 10% discount of an entree at this cafe (not including specials). No limit per a table.

Good service and food. 18% gratuity was included for our party of 6.

Will be back! I want to try their inexpensive steak and eggs!

I think some previous reviewers of the Friday Night Crab Leg Special must be deaf. If not, they will be if they continue to visit here. Wow, so loud we could not hold a conversation at our table.
Crab legs were so-so. Decent portions, but the legs themselves were smallish.
Service was spotty. They were busy, so I'll cut a little slack.
Overall, I'll be looking for a different crab leg spot.....

We were looking for a good place for breakfast and found Marilyn's on yelp. I ordered Eggs Benedict and they were perfect. Large servings of food and great prices. We were here around 9 am and it was busy but no wait to be seated. Our waitress, Rebecca, was very friendly and kept our coffee cups full! I'd definitely come back again for breakfast! Compared to other 24 hour Vegas cafes this is one of the best - clean, comfortable and a great value.

I was at the Tuscany for a week long convention and this was my main staple of the trip.  The menu is extensive and everything looked great.  I had the Marilyn's omelet a few times, the breakfast croissant a few times, potato skins, mozzarella sticks, club sandwich and a few other items that I can't remember.  Everything was really good...every time!

The service was great.  The waiters, the bus boys and the cashiers were always very very friendly.  I really like this cafe and when I come back again next year I will eating here for the majority of my stay.  Did I mention that the prices are very reasonable as well?

Yummy brunch location with very decent prices. We just got the basic breakfast with coffee and French toast with cornbeef hash and an egg. 

The service was fast and food was tasty, I love brunch.

Steak and eggs is a staple of drunk or "been drinking a bit so now I'm really hungry" food in Las Vegas. 

While there are a few choices in Vegas I always choose Marilyn's Cafe at the Tuscany because its 1. close by to the strip 2. its not crowded, no wait in line 3. it taste OK.

Your steak and eggs is $4.99 from something like 11pm - 5am, consist of a 6ish oz steak, two eggs, hash browns, and toast. Pretty basic, but a core essential in waking up without a hangover. 

I've had the other food before on their extensive menu and it gets a pass.

If you do come here for steak and eggs they no longer allow bill splitting during steak and eggs time so bring CASH.

At a very expensive city, there is this place that has a very affordable menu items. Their service is super great, fast and accommodating. Staff is friendly and will assist how ever possible with no questions asked. Ordered their steak and eggs and it was hecka cheap for a piece of steak ($13). Also had their specialty cheesecake and that too was super yummy. Although you'd have to really make your way just to get here, it's definitely worth it. You will not find anything else like this in vegas. So it's a must try.

Price was great for all-you can eat pancakes - honestly though, I couldn't even finish the first plate - they are huge.  I got a side of corned beef hash too and it was A-OK by me (as was the coffee).  I ordered my pancakes as the 'red, white and blue' style - which means strawberries, bananas, and blueberries.. the bizarre thing (which I did not like) was that they actually mixed all the fruit into the batter - so I got pancakes full of mushy cooked fruit.  I guess it was ok, but not my favorite and not what I expected - I thought the fruit would be on top of regular pancakes.  Oh well.  Service was nice and quick.  I definitely don't mind stopping in here for food whenever I am staying at Tuscany and need to get a quick bite.

We went to celebrate birthdays. My husband and Dad love crab legs and Friday night is all you can eat. The server was great and we all loved our food. Everyone ordered the crab. The sides were really good and a nice surprise. The green beans were excellent! I love that they serve the butter with warmers, very nice touch!

This place and the management are a joke. I argued with the staff for a good 15 mins about having French toast. Asked to speak to a manager and was refused. Instead the manager sits and stuffs his face while he tells the server to go tell me he's unavailable.  The strangest part about it all is I even offered to pay the difference from the start of the whole argument.  No mater what I had to take the meal the way it was served on the menu.

service was pretty shitty here. besides "hair" as i liked to call him, the servers would consistently mess up our orders, give us corn (why??) instead of the actual veggie sides we'd order and didnt know about any drinks they make. anyway, the chicken fingers and taquitos are good for appetizers. the cajun shrimp pasta is fantastic. the fish they had was nasty and tasted dirty. but the breakfasts! deleecious!

It's 2am in Vegas, hungry like there's no tomorrow. What? Steak and eggs? Sure! $5? That just makes it even more appetizing! 

Marilyn's cafe never ceases to satisfy! Located in the Tuscany Suites & Casino, it's just off the strip by a tad. Their graveyard special is just that - steak and eggs for $5. I haven't tried anything else, but this definitely makes a girl like me happy. You can order your choice of white or wheat bread, choice of cooked eggs (over easy is the way to go!), and it also comes with a side of hash. Yum. Steaks are the perfect portion size and cooked just right to your liking! Sure, it may not be the best steak and eggs, but for the price, it's excellent! 

Service is great and attentive! Friendly is a plus! Seating is always available which makes it even easier! 

Convenient and reasonably delicious! I'll be back for midnight munchies!

This place is a hidden gem!! I'm preggo and stuck in Vegas for 5 days working. This equals ZERO for me to do or look forward too. A couple days ago I started craving a Mouth watering grilled steak. I ordered one from my hotels room service.... I almost cried. Such a waste of $40. If you've been or are pregnant, you know that craving will NOT go away until that spot is hit perfectly. tonight I decided to walk next door and give their cafe a go after hearing the food was decent. To my surprise- it was amazingly more then I would have ever expected for $14. Perfectly cooked meal, extremely friendly staff (thank you Rueben!) and desert decedent enough for the most lavish bakeries.  
  All in all. I highly recommend if in the area. More then worth the price and great staff. I'll be back for sure.

Great for the Price
Ok - I am rating this for what it is -  a cafe.  The service was fine and the food very good. I had the Wednesday Steak and Lobster special - it was really pretty darn good.  The veggies were not very flavorful, but edible.  The food came out very quickly. Drink service was a little slow, but again, not a problem.  Everyone was friendly.  I would definitely eat here again!
The food is great , ordered the chicken fried stake , I cleaned my plate ! it takes some time but it's worth it and the desert was amazing.

All you can eat crab legs on Fridays for around $20 makes Marilyn's an unbeatable option.  The crab legs were cooked well, there was plenty of butter, and the waiter was prompt with our reorders.  Unbeatable deal!

Wow what a great experience and hidden gem!  So we came here on our way out of Vegas and went based off the Yelp reviews!  Of course since everyone was raving about the steak and eggs we had to try it and it was everything everyone said and more!  Great food great cooked perfectly coffee was very good, and our waitress Riza was soo amazing, super friendly and helpful,  the perfect waitress!!!!

I have NEVER had such a good experience in a hotel/casino cafe before. The food here is off the hook! So good that we dined her twice a day our entire stay. My only complaint is that the staff could be a bit friendlier. Especially the night staff. 
Had the staff been friendlier, I would have given them 5 stars.
I've heard this place has steak and eggs that are to die for.. um not so much. Food was ok. Service lacked. Experience wasnt horrible but it was great either.

Three words: STEAK AND EGGS. 

Probably one of my favorite places to fulfill drunchies, or breakfast fill after a long night out in Vegas. From what I can remember, the prices are quite decent, if you're here before 4 am, I think you can get your steak and eggs for about 5 bucks? Don't count me on that quote, but for sure VERY CHEAP regardless. The place is located in the Tuscany Suites & Casino, and seems to always be busy when I'm here. 

Menu has a lot of different options, but I come here for the steak and eggs deal for breakfast. With an affordable price, well cooked steaks, eggs and hash browns with toast on the side, definitely a great breakfast for anyone. 

They do have other breakfast options to fulfill your cravings, and great daily specials for affordable prices as well. You will definitely find something that suits you. I always enjoy my food when I come here. 

I will say that the wait for your food can be a little while, but I tend to not notice when I'm around really good company. Just keep that in mind if you're not the type to wait for a while when hungry! 

Will definitely be back again!

After a successful night of clubbing in early October, my friend said he was going to The Tuscany to get $4.99 steak and eggs and offered to bring some back for me. I'd never heard of such a thing and was skeptical about how good a $5 steak would be. I also don't like eating late at night but he told me I'd regret it if I didn't.

I was starving by the time he got back since I stayed up waiting for him to return. My take-out box had steak, eggs, hashbrowns, and toast. The steak, to be honest, was barely edible and had a ton of fat. Another friend, who was also starving, thought it was delicious and ate most of it. The eggs were scrambled, pretty bland, and could've used some salt. So... why 4 stars?

The Loaded Hashbrowns -- it's $1 more to get them loaded, but do it anyway (uh, it's only a $1). I can promise you you won't regret it, because it's the most delightfully delicious concoction of hashbrowns, gravy, cheese, and only God knows what else (crack?); especially when you're starving at 4 AM. I'd pay $5.99 just for these hashbrowns alone.

So, go. Marilyn's steak obviously won't be the best you've ever had, but for $5, who's complaining?

Stayed at the Tuscany for my birthday weekend.  My wife and I went here after we checked in and this place was amazing!  Our server, Melfer, was very attentive and professional.  Food was awesome!  Also came here for breakfast the next day and it was even more delicious than I expected!  We will definitely make this restaurant a staple on our future visits!!

Food is so goooooddddd. I went here 3 times on my trip to Vegas. I had the chicken and waffles, french toast breakfast meal and chicken Alfredo. All three meals were so good. Can't wait to go back to Vegas just so I can eat here.

My family was looking for a late night meal and this popped up.

Kenny provided superior and exceptional customer service.  Never was our waters empty.

The bone in steak was amazing and the cost just made it that much better.  Will visit again on my next trip.

First time I came here for $5 steak and eggs it was bomb. 
2nd time it was good, but the first time was better. 

$5 steak and eggs though. 
Eggs, steak, buttery toast, hash browns, 67 sauce. 

Vegas: Drink, party, clubs...4 AM....Steak and eggs.

Wow I'm wondering if the other reviewers ate at the same place I did???
I stayed for 2 long weeks at the Tuscany and  the service at Marilyn's was average the food was a notch below Denny's.  I even told the manager calling ribs or chicken Bar B Que because you pour bbq sauce over them doesn't make them Bar B Que.   I've had five dinners here and one breakfast so I'm not rating this place on one visit. 
All my dinners were poor in every way. I had dessert one night and the cake tasted stale.   I sent it back an actually had to tell them to remove it from my bill as they were not going to. 
My breakfast meal was a very good omelette    Prices are good here but then again you truly get what you pay for

I don't know how many times I ate here, like 100. For breakfast and when I was drunk, so it must have been too often. The food isn't too bad, but the price and it being open 24 hours is what makes this place so nice. I stayed at the hotel, so it was pretty convenient for me to eat here. The staff here is nice, even though I was probably a drunken fool.

Had the $5.99 Steak and Eggs, was good, better than over at Ellis Island and amazingly cheaper... the cafe itself needs a renovation.  Was there at 4:10am on Saturday, was pretty empty.  I'll definitely return.

UPDATE... went back a few days later, and the steak I got on my first visit, bore no resemblance to the steak I got on my last visit.  And the service was non-existent after I ordered.

So I dunno, you can't beat the price but I'd lower my expectations.  If I could give it 2 1/2 STARS, rather than 3 which I did, I would.

How do you beat $4.99 steak and eggs?  

Went here after having $5.99 steak and eggs from Ellis Island Cafe the previous night.  Marilyn's Cafe is definitely brighter and nicer in ambiance.  However, the potatoes from Ellis was better; and the beer at Ellis was cheaper too!

Our server was friendly and food came out quickly.  Check out both places and decide for yourself.

Yuck! The other reviewers were drunk when they wrote their reviews! I ordered the meat loaf with loaded hash browns and mac 'n cheese. Everything tasted mediocre at best and super processed. It all tasted like it had been heated in a bag. The meat loaf had no texture - it was shaped mush. The hash browns had zero crisp - mush. I haven't left that much food on my plate in a long time.
It's a very basic 24/7 restaurant. Not worthy of 4 stars. Nothing spectacular about it and just decent grub when you need it. Not worth the trip unless you are staying here.

Another one of Vegas' hidden gems. 

This one is off the Strip inside the Tuscany Suites and Casino on East Flamingo Rd. It's just located around the corner from Ellis Island Hotel & Casino, another gem of a place for good and bargain eats. 

Marilyn's Cafe is open for 24 hours and they have a daily special from 4PM - 10PM ranging in price from $7.99 to $18.99. Check out their menu here: http://www.tuscanylv.com/d/tuscany/media/PDF/marilyn_menu/marilynmenu.pdf

However...there's another special menu from midnight to 5AM. Yes, the special and staple that's ubiquitous of Vegas - The Steak & Eggs. 

How much? $4.99

That's more than a bargain; that's a Willie Mays steal of 2nd base without a throw from the Catcher kind of steal. You get an 8 oz. of juicy, delicious steak and eggs cooked to order. These steaks ain't the cheap kind they serve in Reno for the same price. It's a good-sized piece of steak that's tender, meaty and flavorful. Don't expect a cheap steak for a cheap price, but it was pretty decent quality for the right price. 

They also have an All-You-Can-Eat pancake for $3.99 for their midnight special. I'd have to say that's a lot of carbs for me, but it's there should you get the munchies. 

And I have to add that service was impeccable. I forgot our server's name, but he was a nice gentleman that was well seasoned. By that I mean experience and class. Servers from other fine-dining establishments could learn a thing or two from him. He made us feel at home, comfortable and relaxed. 

So the next time your in Vegas and hungry and starvin' like a broke-ass college student, don't run to the border or any closest fast food joint on every corner. Get some quality instead and your stomach and wallet will thank me for it.
it's all about the graveyard special.  $3.99 steak and eggs!!  The steak is actually alright and the service is good.  Drunk people everywhere would like it because it's cheap and its fast.

Got into Vegas late and didn't want to drive far at 11 at night. They get 3 stars because the portions are huge for the price you pay. They lost two stars because the food just doesn't taste all that well. Come in at certain times for excellent deals. They charge 18% for groups of 8 or more even if half of them are kids.

Best damn breakfast we had in Vegas.  Take my advice and STAY AWAY from the buffets at the casino and head to this place, may be off the strip but there is a bus that will get you here!  Service was pretty good, the manager seemed to walking the busy restaurant assuring satisfaction and refilling coffee.  Nice little casino from what we saw as well.  I enjoy going to the non chain restaurants and after a very disappointing breakfast at our own hotel on the strip, this place was great!  This was my first time in Vegas but I will head back to Marilyn's the next time we are in Vegas!

It's late at night and you're on the strip and you want something cheap and filling to satisfy your drunken cravings!  I usually come here after partying or after a long hard day of work. Staff here is friendly and service is usually good and food comes out good most of the time (Note that I order the same thing almost every time I come here! Lol). 

This is 'THE SPOT' to go for some cheap late night steak and eggs. At $5.99 from 12am-5am you can't really complain. Compared to another Cafe, located at a point somewhere south, the service and food quality is substantially better and it's located closer to the Vegas Strip off of Flamingo @ The Tuscany. Recommended spot to go to after the club.

JuL's Tips
* Dollar extra to add mushrooms or cheese to your eggs.
* Gets busy on weekends (Naturally because of clubs) Don't be shy to wave down a server if you need something they are nice.
* After 5am you'll have to wait til 6am for $8.99 Steak & Egg special which runs til 11am.
* Food taste better when you're drunk.
Service is great as well as the food.  A great local spot.  Daily specials and breakfast specials are competitive with everyone else.

My girls and I (Katie H. and Kelsey W.) just finished a night at Marquee and wanted some grub after all that dancing. They convinced me to come here for late night food and we got there at around 3:30am Sunday morning. 

Based on location and decor, I was not feeling this place. Only thing that saved my hesitation though was the fact that so many people were there at that foresaken hour!

We each got the famous steak and eggs (steak medium and eggs scrambled) and damnnnn was I in for a treat! Eggs done well, steak just the right portion size and texture, a ton of crispy hash browns, and toast slathered in butter beauty. OMG talk about satisfying! 

I didn't care about the decor, I didn't care that we went off the strip to get here, and I def didn't care that I was eating that much food in the middle of the night! AND ONLY $4.99?!!! So much beauty in one night.

Woooooo good work Marilyn's Cafe! You made a fan out of a disbeliever!

This is the best kept secret going. Their appetizers were meal size portions, then came the main course, there is no way to eat all of this food. Here is the kicker, you know how you go to some restaurants that serve hefty portions but the food is bland; not here, their food is excellent, the staff friendly, and their hospitality was out of this world. We will come here every time we visit Vegas.

McGill
Amazing food, and great prices. New favorite restaurant in town. I will definitely go back!! The specials are my favorite & the ribs omg yes!!

The best thing to come here for is the steak and egg special for $5.99. You get a steak, hash browns, two eggs, and white or wheat toast. It is a great deal, but sometimes it takes a really long time to come through. There were a few times where I felt like it was taking a really long time (30 min+) but I won't complain because the price is extremely affordable.

The service is nice, they usually refill consistently. The entrees tale a very long time to come, especially if you get the steak and eggs.

Upon finishing the meal, you just bring the receipt up to the cash register and someone assists you with the transaction from there.

While some Vegas hotel-casinos are known for their grandiose buffets, others are more known for their cheap, late-night steak & eggs specials. Marilyn's is an unassuming diner found within the Tuscany casino. Open 24 hours a day, this special only runs midnight to 6:00 am and is off menu. 

Looking back at reviews from a few years ago, the price of the steak & eggs special has been steadily increasing by about a dollar a year. It was $3.99 back in 2011-12, $4.99 in 2013, and now currently $5.99. Still, it's a cheap deal for a 6 oz. NY strip (see what they did there?), 2 eggs any style, hash browns, and toast (wheat, rye, or sourdough). Don't expect too much because the steak isn't like Lawry's across the street, but it'll do for late-night eats. 

The best tip I can offer is to order the steak one level rarer than what you usually get. I once received a well-done steak after ordering a medium-rare. My rare order last night came out a decent medium-rare.

You can't beat the $3.99 steak and eggs after midnight, but I like going in the morning M-F btw 6-11am for their $6.99 steak and eggs special with pancakes because the service during those times are awesome!  I can't remember her name, but our server was one the best servers I've ever had...and I'm not just saying that because she was cute.  The party in my table came one after another so we all ordered separately.  Our server didn't mind at all coming a multitude of times to take orders and run the food.  She was the best!  The other servers during that time slot rock also.  As for the food, surprisingly the cut of the steak isn't that bad.  I only had to slice off a bit of fat strip on the end, but after that the steak was pretty good.  On the down side, this cafe doesn't have A1 steak sauce.  They have Lea & Perrins which is sweeter, kinda ketchupie, but it isn't A1.  Pancakes were delicious and plentiful.  So plentiful I shared half my stack with my little niece.  Can't wait to come back in Christmas time to take advantage of their $3.99 steak and eggs!
Got unlucky with the server but for the prices and the quality of the food... it doesn't even matter! Best part is you can order dinner during lunch hour!

Great food. Great service. Great prices. Clean restaurant. It is located inside the Tuscany hotel and casino. It was crowded and the staff was still attentive. They have daily specials and you can order breakfast for dinner or dinner for lunch or a late brunch, whatever!  We didn't stay here but am glad we came across this cafe.

The fried chicken is to die for.  Four pieces with the greatest, crispiest skin in the world.  I'm thinking buttermilk dipped.   I thought the Rio Buffet had the best fried chicken, but Marilyn's may be the best.  

Menu is huge, like Cheese Cake Factory.  So many options, there is something for everyone.  French fries are fabulous.  Mac n cheese side is super good.  Mashed potatoes are awesome.  I try something new every time I go.

It's inexpensive and you can use your points from the casino if you want.  

If your looking for a champagne brunch and buffet, hit the Bacchanal Buffet Casesars, as Marilyn's isn't it and it's not supposed to be.  

24 hours inside Tuscany Casino on Flamingo, east of Las VEgas Blvd.  
***Park in the back of casino if you want direct access to the restaurant.
This place is so good! It's super low key, the prices are awesome, and the food was delicious!

We came here for steaks and prime rib dinner. Service was great however you have to be patient to eat here because they are always busy. Getting seated is not a problem...it's getting the food is a little wait. Which is normal when you come with a big party. I love the service we got from our waiter and busser...I wished I could've got my waiters name but I didn't catch it. 

What I don't like is having to pay up front at the cashier. I think it is inconvenient. I did go and tried to pay for our dinner but I did not like how I had to wait there without be acknowledged by Sonia (the cashier...and could be the manager. I was standing there for a while...she could've at least say she will be right with me or one moment please. We sat all the way at the back so...I did walk up front and forgot to bring my ID because I'm paying with my debit/credit card. I was already annoyed by Sonia so I told her that I'm already having to come up and pay for my bill...now I have to go back and get my ID plus come back up. I took my card from her and went back. I asked our busser named Enrique which was nice of him if he can take my bill up front. He helped me out with no complaint. 

Good service comes a long way and I appreciate good service! I gave our busser and waiter a good tip because they deserved it!
The food was good, but I was super impressed with the staff.  Very friendly and dedicated despite a busy breakfast rush.

My friends and I walked here from the strip and it took us about 20 minutes following the GPS on our phones. At 1AM in the morning, the walk felt pretty shady. But we made it safely!

After wandering into the Tuscany hotel and casino, we were directed to Marilyn's Cafe. As a group of 5, my friends and I were seated nearly immediately. Once our waiter came around to take our order, he automatically asked if all wanted the steak and eggs. Assumption correct!

At $5.99, the steak and eggs were such a steal! Steak and eggs were both cooked according to personal preferences and they even include toast plus hashbrowns.

Not sure if it was just the late night hunger talking or what, but the steak was delicious! Best $5.99 I spent in Vegas! I'd definitely recommend coming here!

Wanted to make it out here for steak and eggs (supposedly $6) between 12am and 5am. The club gods were not kind to us, so at 3am we went back to the hotel instead of having food.

Steak and eggs were still on our minds the next day, so we came out here before heading back home. It's $13 during normal hours, but you get 8 oz of steak, 2 eggs, 2 pieces of toast (we opted for English muffin) and hashbrowns.

Service was quite slow due to large parties, even though the restaurant was not full. The food was really good - not sure if that's due to my hangover state or the actual food. The steak was cooked nicely, although a bit more on the rare side of my medium rare than usual. It could've used more spices. But then, I'm not judging it like a steakhouse, considering for my one steak at CUT in LA I could've gotten 10 of these.

Tip: ask for the butter on the side. There was so much butter on all the toast/english muffin/etc that one of my friends thought she got a grilled cheese instead of toast before biting into it...

Overall, good cheap-ish option. Would have totally given this a 5 star if I had the $6 steak and eggs. Ah well, there's always next time.

$5.99 steak and eggs from 1am to 5am, though it doesn't seem to be advertised anywhere. We came as a party of five at around 1am and were seated immediately. Service was attentive. They were always checking up on us and refilling our waters.

Steak and eggs are cooked to your liking. You also get a choice of toast, as well as hash browns. Extremely filling! Fantastic portions for the price! I would actually recommend sharing if you aren't famished.

This place may be a bit hard to locate. It is in the 1pm direction of the casino. Definitely worth hitting up when you're in town! Also, no split checks allowed so have cash or venmo ready if you're coming in a big group!

Okay. So it's no Morton's or Flemings, but for $8.99 for a decent 8oz steak cooked perfectly MR which I was actually shocked. Two eggs toast and potatoes it was most differently worth the money. My server was very obliging and polite. 
I give it a strong four stars.

i miss this SO much about las vegas!!!  

i went to UNLV for a year and a half and this is definitely a highlight of my collegiate career in las vegas.  after midnight until 5 am there are a bunch of specials.  the best one is the steak and eggs!  when i was there, it was only $2.99 but its a dollar more now but hey, its still a great deal.  you get two eggs, two slices of toast, hash browns, and steak!  LOVE IT!  there was this one lady that always served us.  she had a dude's name but she's super cool!  

for anyone going to vegas, this is definitely a place to hit up!  marilyn's cafe is inside of the tuscany hotel.  i recommend this place to EVERYONE visiting vegas!!

This is one of Vegas' best hidden gems! The last 3 times I went to Las Vegas, I went to Marilyn's each time after each night of clubbing. The $4 steak and eggs here are as good as it gets. It definitely satisfies your drunchies - it comes with toast and hash browns too! I've also tried the chicken pot pie, but it's $7 and still not as good as the steak & eggs. I've never had to wait in line, but then again I only come here around 2-4 AM. Every single time, we see a certain waiter - James - and he is the absolute best! I don't know how he manages to stay to happy and friendly and perky at 4 AM to all of us drunkards. I will be coming back again, and again, and again, every time I come to Vegas, and each time with new friends, so long as there are $4 steak and eggs here. This place is an essential part of all my Las Vegas memories.

I'm a Fan!! 
The first morning that we were in LV, we came in for Breakfast. I had the 8oz steak and sunnyside Eggs with hashbrowns. It was DELICIOUS!! The service was friendly, and quick. 

We came on Friday 8/15 for the AYCE Crab Legs. The wait was about 30-45 minutes (which was not a problem being a Friday night in Vegas), and there is so much commotion and noise (OH, but SO worth it for $19.99). 

**** Can I suggest a quick weekly STAFF MEETING to organize the chaos to be expected on a Friday night AYCE Crab legs meal??  It really was sheer chaos. We had several different waiters take our order, bring our order, refill our cups, etc.. I was confused on who the hell to tip @ the end of the night so We ended up leaving the $$ on the table, and let them fend for themselves.  

Upon my next return to LV, I will be visiting Marilyn's again

I've eaten here several times and the food is generally good.  Last night, I had the Grilled Chicken Salad with Blue Cheese dressing.  The salad was fresh, tasty, and a good sized portion.  Drink service was handled quickly.  

There have been times when slow service has been an issue.  Last night was OK.  With the restaurant about 1/2 full, one of the other servers was watching other tables.  He came over and asked what I was drinking and brought me another iced tea.  Later, he brought some rolls.  Although he was not our server, it was great of him to keep an eye out for us.

Prices are moderate.  I enjoy Marilyn's.

I stay a the Tuscany Suites every year for a convention.  Their Marilyn's Cafe is the best "in casino" cafe I've ever eaten at.  They have a wide variety of food and I really enjoy their chicken pot pie and 24/7 breakfast.  There's been occasion where the service can be a little slow, but for the most part it's average for Vegas.
Don't go expecting a culinary experience, but good basic food that is not Over-The-Top Vegas food.

Came just for dessert. 
it is not on the menu, but the serving tray full of desserts, you will find something. They have all kinds of desserts.
We got carrot cake and apple pie, both with vanilla ice cream. 
The server was great. 
Desserts were great.

I'm not sure what all the fuss is about, because we found this place to be rather average. Here's the rundown. 

Off the strip so prices are normal for the food that is served. Like Denny's but in a casino. 

When we had breakfast there the bus boy must have been on strike, because many of the tables were a mess. 

The hostess tried to sit us at a couple messy tables and then found one that had a Bobby pin on it. Apparently she was puzzled that I found that gross. 

The waitress we had looked like she was in a perennial state of pissed off! 

Overall - This may not be a place that you would go out of your way to have a meal, I know I won't.

Solid 3 1/2 stars. My friend always raves about this place, (he usually goes Friday nights for the all you can eat crab legs) so he brought me here for lunch today to try. Friday, around 11am, no wait to get in. Restaurant less than half occupied. They were going to seat us right next to (and almost on top of) a huge, obnoxious group of people, although there were other close tables in that same little section. I wasn't going to ask to sit at a different table, but my friend did. Hostess moved us 3 tables over from where we were going to be originally sat. Menu offers breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert, and had a lot of options!! Also several options for us herbivores! It was a good 10 to 15 minutes before anyone came over. I figured service might be a little slower since we moved to possibly a closed table/section, but this was extreme. Especially since we were located very close to the kitchen walkway and servers were constantly walking past, ignoring us. Eventually a server strolls over and flatly says "do you know what you want?". No "hi, how are you, sorry about the wait", nothing. She was very unfriendly, borderline rude. He ordered the special, steak and eggs with pancakes and cottage cheese, (huge meal) for $8.99. I ordered a personal size (7 inch, $5.99) veggie pizza. You have the option of thin or regular crust, to which I ordered regular. We both ordered waters at that time also. She brought our waters, and then we waited. And waited. And waited. A good 45 minutes passed. He ordered medium for his steak, so it shouldn't have taken that long. Our food finally arrived. This is the only reason I gave any stars at all. His steak was cooked correctly, and said everything he had tasted good. My pizza (cheese, green pepper, onion, olive, mushroom, and tomato) was great!! They did burn the outside of the crust, but everything else was fresh and full of flavor. Never were offered refills. She did ask at one point how everything was. Took a while for her to drop the check. We were at a 2 top, very small, yet our table was never prebussed. (We had several plates due to his big meal). Cashier at the front wasn't friendly at all, either. All in all, the food was so good, and menu so large, at such cheap prices, I definitely want to come back and try other things and hope for better service. Maybe their wait staff was having an off day.

Ein sehr gutes Frühstück, alles frisch zubereitet und sehr freundliche Bedienung.
Das Preisleistungsverhältnis ist gut.

I loved the $4.99 steak and eggs... A lot better than some other chains out their ihop, dennys, etc. Best deal in town too. Their blueberry pancakes were delicious as well... I also ordered the grits - do not order. It was very watery and bland.

Okay so for their $5 steak and egg deal from midnight until 5am, it's almost hard to beat. But to be quite honest I don't think I could come back as the place oozes sketchy people and slow service. 

Steak was tasty, eggs made to order, comes with plenty of toast and hash browns all for $5... My mouth is totally drooling but my heart is telling me no. If you can hold your own after the club then by all means, go because the food is awesome for what it costs! I however wouldn't come back. Hope this helps (and makes sense!!!!)

I love this place! Located in the Tuscany casino, this is definitely a hidden gem. Marilyn's is a traditional cafe that is open 24 hours. They also serve breakfast all day. This place has amazing food at very cheap prices. The quality of food is very good, and the service is always above average. 

Gluten free options: They offer some gluten free options, such as gluten free pancakes (they are very good), and also have options such as scrambles, omelets, sandwiches w/ no bun. They do not have a specific menu, but they do offer some options, and they are happy to make substitutions.  

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for good food at a very reasonable price!

Best steak and eggs around. Like everyone said. It's only $4.99 for the night owls (12am-5am). It really is a perfect place to eat. 

It tastes like heaven literally ... Literally after coming from a club it's the best place to enjoy delicious hot meal. 

They ask you how you want your steak and how you want your eggs. Yum!!! 

The waiters are so nice and so helpful.... It makes a really big difference when you're tired from being out and your feet hurts from the heels and you have someone so wonderful serving food and always has a smile from their faces.
Fantastic little place! Food came out quickly and correctly, was delicious, and did not cost too much. Definitely worth it!

Marilyn's Café is located inside the Tuscany Hotel & Casino.  The restaurant is 24 hours and they're known for having the best deals, especially for their crab legs.  I recently stopped here because I has starving and behind on my calories.  A little over $20 can get you a lot of food at Marilyn's Café.  I got the New York Steak & Eggs, Marilyn's Starter (2 eggs, 2 sausage links, 2 strips of bacon, and 2 pancakes), and a cup of Marilyn's chili.  I debated on getting a burger in addition to my meal, but felt that maybe I'm over doing it with the calories.  The bacon was the highlight and the chili was good too.  As for the steak, I guess this is where I state "you get what you pay for".  Overall, I didn't find anything special about Marilyn's Café.  The restaurant is just A-Okay.

Had them for 4 straight days last week and loved every meal.  Good selection and reasonable prices.  The 8 oz Angus burger blew my mind!  Room service was always on time and served till 10pm.  Thats a big plus for fat guys like me...  Food arrived still warm.  Was very impressed with the staff. 

Recommend to all...

I ate here with a few friends while in Vegas. The prices were great here and service was helpful. It is located inside of the Tuscany Hotel and Casino. We came in with no wait and was able to sit immediately. I think this is a good spot to eat at the following day after a long night in Vegas. There isn't much to the place when it comes to ambience, but don't let that stop you from striking a good deal on some pretty decent food.

All I can say is the Friday all you can eat crab legs special for $24 is a bargain. Servers started me off with 2 plates and before I could even finish one they were bringing more!! And the more they brought the portions were still the same they didn't try and reduce the amount of crab legs they brought. Crab legs were nice and meaty and you will never have to ask when are the rest coming. Whenever I'm in Vegas this will be a must stop on Friday night....though due to the popularity I'm sure in due time this price will go up and something will change. I sure hope not though....fingers crossed!!!!

I would give this place no stars if able. But I have to give it one star. The service was slow. They would NOT split our checks and there were only 7 of us. It caused lot's of confusion at the check out register.  Our server was Saida. She was working her butt off for all of her tables.  At the register the manager on duty Dana was rude, unwilling to accommodate our party. It was very busy and it took 45 minutes to get our food. Which was not good at all. It was crap all around. My son ordered a vanilla milkshake that was 2 scoops of ice cream and milk not blended.  We called it a vanilla milk float. I will never eat at this cafe again and The Tuscany Suites & Casino will never get a dime of ours again.

I found this place from yelp. Not knowing what was around the area and staying at a hotel on the strip. I paid over $9 for an ice tea and croissant. So I decided to find something more reasonable. I walked to the restaurant in the morning and was really pleased with the staff. Very friendly attentive. The food was very good. I had the country fried steak and eggs one day and eggs Benedict the other. I highly recommend going. It is very reasonably priced and you get a full breakfast.

Great place!  I found this gem on my Las Vegas trip.  I needed a place that gave me a specific Vegan diet and that is exactly what I received!  The staff was so friendly and the conservation was something I will surely cherish.  Thank you so much for running to the store for me and thank you for the free coffee!   

There was one con...no beans...but it was made up for!!!

Breakfast is always the best! I come to vegas at least four times a year, on the way the last place to stop os Marilyn's at the tuscany casino. Food and service is always tops, not to mention the decent prices of the food.

Little restaurant inside the Tuscany Casino. This was a mixed bag. 5 of us ate there twice:

Good:
+ Price
+ Selection
+ Some of the dishes were good: roast beef (pot roast) 
+ relatively quiet location
+ time - Their hours seem to be round the clock 

Bad:
 - Most of the dishes were just so-so. My chicken cordon bleu was extremely disappointing and not any better than a frozen microwave chicken cordon bleu
 - Plating or presentation was poor - just slap it on the plate.

All you can eat crab leg Friday.....the crab was cold but good, the sides were not as good the first two times we were here and we sat by the beverage station and it had this smell that wasn't pleasant I'm sure it was all the crab legs they were boiling. Still the service was great as always. I would suggest bringing your own cracking instrument as they have this little plastic one that doesn't really work.  My husband was jealous of this young lady at another table, who was eating her crab while she was talking and bringing out huge pieces of crab everytime.  I took a picture of him because he was so hilarious.  Needless to say this was his first time eating crab legs and he didn't get stuffed or even full. Next time we'll bring pliers and do it right so he can get stuffed.

Definately does not dissapoint. Its very affordable and not far from the strip. I came here for breakfast and ordered a Breakfast Burrito and my BF ordered a Regular breakfast. Staff was very friendly and everything was great. My hashbrowns were a little cold but they took care of it and were really nice about it. The food was really tasty. Great experience!
A little better than you would expect for the cost. Breakfast 24/7. Think GOOD greasy spoon!!!

Hit this place a bunch of times during our trip to Vegas. Great great great breakfast. The food is awesome, the eggs were fresh, and the service was very friendly and very fast. The corned beef reuben is freakin amazing too. Top notch Reuben I have to say. I was very impressed, and I'm usually a Pastrami Reuben kind of guy, so it says a lot when a corned beef reuben does it this well for me. All in all, this place is great, I will definitely eat here again next time I'm in Vegas.

Came here while waiting for the Rat Pack show. Ordered the pork chops,mac n cheese and mashed taters. Let me tell you that this was a wholesome homecooked style meal. So flavorful and filling. Loved everything about my meal.service was a bit slow...but all in all a great meal.
Our server Miriam is awesome and attentive.. Very affordable. Look into their specials.. It's all god for the price $..

Food was really good but service was somewhat slow. Prices can't be beat, especially in Vegas! I got the banana chocolate chip pancakes with eggs and bacon and my husband got a waffle with sausage, eggs and bacon and with tip we paid $26! Talk about a steal! 
It's located in the Tuscany right off the strip, take an Uber there and walk back, that's what we did and it was perfect!

On my last day at Vegas I wanted to eat somewhere affordable. I found Marilyn's at the Tuscany and I can't believe how amazing the food is. Their steak and eggs are great and my kids loved the pancakes. Even my wife left vegas happy because of her breakfast there. Thank you Marilyn's and staff we will be visiting the next time we're in

My wife and I were staying at Harrah's on the strip last weekend. The first morning we just needed a quick bite before we started the day with some friends so we worked our way down to the café in the hotel l. Luckily I decided to take a look at the menu before we were seated because the prices were way out of line.  A standard 2 egg, toast, bacon and coffee breakfast would have run about $13 each.  I figure that this is Vegas baby and I want a cheap steak and egg breakfast with all the trimmings for under $10. We then stopped by the buffet and found that the Friday morning breakfast buffet cost was over $20 each! What happened to cheap eats at the casinos? Needless to say we walked out and found McDonalds next door and had a quick cheap fast food meal for under $10 for the both of us which was much more to what we really were looking for. The next morning, after a late night out of fun and drinking we wanted a good sit down breakfast but again we didn't want to over pay by double so since I did have a car I figured I would yelp some local breakfast joints.  There were many but for some reason Marilyn's really stood out to us.  It was close, had tons of great reviews and it just sounded like exactly what we were looking for. Marilyn's is located at the Tuscany suites on Flamingo inside the small casino. Parking was a breeze and since the casino was very small we weren't too far from it when we walked in the front door. We got there around 10:30am and found it was perfect timing because we got a booth right away and the place was packed about 30 minutes later and had people waiting for a table by time we left just after 12. The menu was varied and you can choose breakfast, lunch or dinner anytime but we opted for breakfast.  I had the 2 pork chops and eggs any style that was served with has browns and toast which I subbed out for a biscuit. The  pork chops were thick sliced, center cut and cooked to perfection, the hash browns were crispy, the eggs were perfectly cooked to over easy with the whites cooked all the way through and the yolk runny and the biscuit was nice and flakey. My wife had a ham and cheese omelet  that was very tasty and also came with all the standard breakfast trimmings.  I noticed that they do offer a $4.99 steak and egg deal that is served midnight to 5 or 6am and then goes up a couple of bucks after that until I think noon and then goes up a couple of dollars more. We enjoyed our breakfast so much that we took our friends there after midnight on Saturday night and we all had the steak and egg special that is the perfect nightcap to a night of drinking dancing and gambling! I highly recommend Marilyn's for any meal and will go back next time I'm in town.

The CLASSIC FAMOUS steak and eggs places in ALL of Vegas. One of my staple Vegas post-midnight places to eat. They serve steak and eggs until 5am. I miss the days when it was only $3.99, and $5 will get you in and out with tax and tip. It is more like $5.99 + tax and tip now, but still full of all its glory and deliciousness, especially a hectic night of Vegas shenanigans. Definitely will be back next time!

Hailing from the land of the San Gabriel Valley, aka The SGV, where late night cafes were O'plenty... There is place know as ABC Cafe which WAS formerly home to the only $5.99 Steak and Eggs I have known to be in existence... And then they raised their price to $8.99 Which is ludicrous because you know that steak served with frozen veggies and fake instant mashed potatoes ain't worth that damn price... Until LDW '14 my world was about the change.

I've heard many stories of "The Steak and Eggs of Tuscany Suites"... And finally got to experience th for myself this Labor Day Weekend! After night at the nightclub, this was the brightest of ideas to pop into our semi-sober minds! To my astonishment the fabled Steak and Eggs were located at Marilyn's Cafe inside of Tuscany Suites! Stayed there on several occasions and in retrospect, am ashamed I did not take advantage of this when staying only minutes walk from where we stayed.

We were seated immediately and got straight to business! Majority of us went straight for the meal of stories while others went for the Spaghetti and Meatballs which was advertised on the board when walking in. 

Once the meals were out and it was finally right before my eyes, I was in amazement of the quality cut of beef they used. Cooked medium rare, just the way I liked it. This was hands down wayyyy under priced! Quality was way better than any steak you would get at any Denny's or Applebee's for 1/2 the price. Me being a good friend... I would recommend this to anyone looking for a quality late night meal! 

Oh and don't bother trying anything else... That good. The spaghetti and meatballs aren't anything worth mentioning... But until next time! When the 250 miles are no longer between me and my tastebuds. My wallet will miss you in the meantime.

Came on Friday for the AYCE crab legs for $20. There will be a wait, but it is definitely worth it. I came with a group of 10 and we have never received this type of service on top of that we were STARVING. Only reason I gave this place 4 stars is because they told us we had a 30 minute wait but it ended up being 1 hour... They will drown you with crabs!! They bring plates of crabs out before you are even finished with your plate! They were delicious   definitely come here if you love crab legs!!
Great Food and Service!! The menu is extensive and has something for everyone. The steak and eggs was amazing. We will be back for sure!!

Great food and good prices but the server was rather neglectful. He never checked back after we got our food even though he walked by us numerous times. The real downside was having to walk through a smokey casino to get to and leave the restaurant.

We tried this place because there was a coupon in the Entertainment Book. Since we like the mexican restaurant inside the Tuscany, we figured it was worth trying.

We had two sandwiches- we split it (our MO). It was very good, surprisingly, for a casino cafe. It's about $10 per person, without the Entertainment coupon. We've been here a couple times. The service is very good. The atmosphere is nice, and this restaurant is spacious inside. There are tables and chairs as well as booth seating available. 

It's truly "hit or miss" at these casino cafes. This is probably one of those little known/forgotten casinos and two of the restaurants here are really good.
You can't beat $4.99 steak and eggs cooked just as you would like it. Come right after you go out - no wait, quick and friendly service, and BUTTERY toast. Seriously... $4.99. Yesss!

CRABALICIOOOOOOOOOOUS! That's what you come in here for. I came  here on the AYCE snow crab deal for $19.99. I've had my crab cravings in the past, and I'd call around the buffets in vegas (Bacchanal, wicked spoon) to ask if they specifically serve snow crabs. Why pay $40-$50 when all i want to do is get my mulah's deal worth on some crab action.

4pm-10p.m. only on Fridays. I came here around 5:00p.m., thinking that there'd be a line, but no, it was a shoe-in. Service was quick, waters were constantly filled, and the crabbies were loaded on my plate. You get two sides included (which isn't AYCE). I highly recommend the SWEET POTATO WAFFLE FRIES. Probably the best I've ever had in my LYFE, SON! 

The french fries, mashed potatoes were average, and the fresh chips were really good. I just ate off of other people's plates, hence I got to try my medley of sides. 

I was stuffed by the end of the night. They also had some cookies that they sell Subway style by the cashier. I like my oatmeal cookies so it was yummy for my dessert. 

I'll definitely be back to fill my snow crab cravings!

WHAT?? $4 steak and eggs you say?? Yeees, I heard you right!

The steak and eggs were SOOOOOO good after a night at the club! Definitely worth the $4! They give you a strip of steak, 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and a lot of toast but be careful eating those as you will get full before you eat the rest of the plate! I asked for my steak medium and they did the cooking right! The bbq sauce on the table is so good with it! My eggs sunnyside up and again they did that right. Can't really go wrong with eggs though. The hashbrowns were so good with the crunch on the top. Throw some ketchup and tabasco on those babies and they're perfect!

We also got the gravy fries. Those were amazing as well. We didn't finish them though because we were all full from our steak and eggs.

This will definitely be my early morning spot when I come back to Vegas. I love that they're open 24 hrs. 

Taxis don't frequent this hotel since it's not on the strip. My friends and I didn't really know what to do to get back to our hotel. Luckily a few minutes after we went outside a taxi came to drop some people off so we took that back to our hotel. I'm pretty sure you can go inside to ask the concierge if they could call a taxi for you though!

Meh, had an OK lunch here. Went with a coworker based on the good reviews, I should have realized many were based on their steak & eggs deal. The place was nice enough, and the waiter was really nice, but the food was really mediocre.

I got the Philly cheesesteak with sweet potato fries. The fries were good, but the cheesesteak was pretty abysmal. It would have been OK if it weren't for the fact that the roll was separated (or maybe so soggy it fell apart) on the bottom, and it just made eating it really difficult. That plus it was very greasy just made it a meh experience. 

I was also expecting dirt cheap, but 8.99 for a bad cheesesteak is way too much. Wouldn't recommend it, though the people were very nice!

== Review is just for the Steak & Eggs ==

Everytime i hit up sin city I have to have Steak & Eggs. Love Love Love em!!!
By far of all the spots I've tried close to the strip, Marilyn's Cafe is by far the best (aside from Mr. Lucky's 24-7) in terms of cost & quality. It's nothing super duper special but a great place to get your fix. 

Very friendly servers. Service is pretty on spot here except one time they were super super slow and the restaurant was 3/4 empty. By not means is this an upscale, fancy cafe. There is no modern decor nor an ambiance. Just a simple, old-school cafe & serves yummy bfast. There are various tables & booth seatings.


:: FOOD ::

STEAK & EGGS BFAST SPEICAL    (5/5)
 - Price of $8.99 (6AM -11AM Daily)
 - 6oz tender NY Strip
 - 2 eggs any style
 - Hasbrowns, Toast or 2 Pancakes

OJ    (2.5/5)
 - not fresh squeezed, taste wise mehhhh.... wouldn't order again.

COFFEE   (3/5)
 - very light roasted taste, sorta does the work just to get the morning going

Great food and very fast!  Service was great and prices are very fair!  They are open 24 hours.  Jesus was our server and he was very prompt and had great recommendations, too.  They have Alaskan Amber on draft, too!!

Verrryyy friendly staff ! I wish I knew the name of our server, she was really sweet . Black girl , I wanna say her name is AJ ? You go giiiirlllll  Came here w a party of 8, we all got the steak & eggs special (5.95 boyyyeeeee , jump on it) and ofc we all ordered it differently & she handled it well w| no mistakes . & it was really good too , cooked the way I like . Aha , Will def be back

We had good expectations about dining here, unfortunately it was terrible. We eat out twice a day at least 5 days a week.
Got the chicken cordon blue, it was average and the two sides were cold, and the portions poor. My companion ordered the pot roast, which was above average, both, the size and portion. It was tender and yet dry.
Our plates were delivered close to 40 minutes after we ordered and a bread basket close to finishing our meals.
The worst service in all Las Vegas area. Server was not interested in providing a good meal experience. Bad waiter.
We are not coming here ever again!!

What a HUGE menu, and this place is open 24 hours! Everything on the menu is a steal, the prices are so good. I've been here a couple of times, its no 5-star dining experience, but its the most bang for your buck around.

I was in a party of 4 and we seated at a very small table, we asked to be moved to a different table. Apparently our new table was in a different waiters zone, but out old waiter (who had not given us anything other than the menus) decided to keep serving us. Both waiters kept repeating the other by asking for our drink orders in succession, each unaware of the other. Once they found out there was a slight verbal disagreement as to who would actually serve us. Made for a bit of an awkward experience for us. Our original server, probably not used to serving this table, neglected us a lot, and we found ourselves asking the server for this area for assistance quite often. Our food took tremendously long, almost 30 minutes to come out, and this was at 1pm....

I would come back again for the menu, hopefully service will be better organized next time.

Best 24 hour cafe in Vegas and best kept secret!!!   It's inside good ol Tuscany! They don't even advertise it, but they have Steak, Eggs, and Hashbrowns for $3.99.  You definitely cannot beat that anywhere on the Vegas strip, that's for sure.  If you are a hotel guest, they even give you coupons and you can get 2 for 1 pizzas at Marilyn's...overall this cafe is the bomb-bizzle.  

Customer service is wonderful also.  The staff is always super friendly and attentive.

Yeah for Marilyn's!!

After a successful night of clubbing, we all had some late night munchies and took the cab to Tuscany for some steak & eggs! We came around 3am and the place was pretty empty. All 10 of us ordered the usual steak & eggs (steak, eggs, toast & hash browns). Along with 2 cups of coffee. I'm not sure how much each plate was but the end total for all of us was $62 - probably including gratuity & tax. Not too shabby :)

The waiter was friendly and took our order quickly as well as refilled coffee whenever needed without us having to asking.

Only been here once for their $3.99 steak and eggs after clubbing with my best friends. First thing, the server was nice and friendly (and also very pretty). She was taking three drunky people's orders and she was patient and didn't show any annoyance (at least not to our faces), since we were being loud and constantly laughing. Our orders came fast and for the price the serving was HUGE, almost couldn't fit three plates on a table that seats four. The steak wasn't dry and they didn't give us scrap meat either. I'm really impressed how delicious it was for only around $4.

This is a definite go to place for a great plate of steak & eggs.

Roll in anytime from midnight until 5am to get the steak and eggs special for ONLY $5.99! My ears couldn't believe it either when I heard the price.

For $5.99, you get a decent sized steak, 4-5 slices of toast, hashed Browns, and eggs. The servers are very nice and service was wonderful! 

This place has my stamp of approval!

Service was excellent! Price is very affordable! I ordered the fetuccini Alfredo, and I gotta say, it's one of the tastiest I've tried! I would've gave this place 5 stars if the steaks my friends ordered wasn't so over cooked and dry. So I suggest if you want your steak medium-well, just get medium. If you want it medium, then get medium-rare, and so on..

Decent. 

Diner style restaurant but classier. Open late for your drunk munchies after you go h.a.m. in the club. Came here with some friends and opted for the breakfast choices. I mean the food doesn't look pretty, but its edible. The bread isn't entirely fresh in terms of home made. I am pretty sure they order like Wonder Bread and give us those slices.  I don't even remember how much everything costed..... Probably pricy because it's vegas? 

Whatevs.

The food was terrible.  Everything we ordered had absolutely no flavor, very bland.  I would have rather gone to denny's or IHOP and gotten way better food.  It didn't really seem like some other people in the restaurant were really enjoying their food.  The service was not really the greatest either.  I will definitely not be back,  I'll spend my money elsewhere.

Truly fantastic restaurant inside The Tuscany Casino.  Both of our visits we had the same waiter, this guy was hands down the best waiter I've experienced in my life.  Great sense of humour, competent and offered up specials and all options.  The food was top rate, one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had, perfect sized portions too.  Prices were extremely good and the dining area was very comfortable, welcoming & quiet.  This will be a regular stop for me!

My friends and I stopped by for our last meal before driving home. The restaurant is located within the Tuscany Casino, a short drive off the strip. We were seated immediately which was nice considering we were hoping to beat some of the traffic. 

It didn't matter though, because our service was terrible. Our waitress, Patty, was the worst server any of us had ever had. She didn't introduce herself for over 20 minutes and failed to provide any reason for being so inattentive. Our food came out another 30 minutes later and was all cold besides the country fried steak. Although cold, the food was pretty tasty. 

Having already watched our neighboring table wait another 30 minutes for their check, we decided to skip the suspense and approach the hostess to pay. We would loved to have express our frustration to Patty herself, but she was too busy using her phone to check on us. Luckily we made sure her manager knew of our discontent.

@TuscanyCasino #Vegas Friday Night All-You-Can-Eat Crab Legs $12.99!!! WOW

A small diner located in this off the strip casino offering 24/7 dining with breakfast,lunch and dinner plus DAILY specials. Great Prices, Great Service and good food....Plus Food Coupons for locals in the newspaper:)

We decided to dine out for Crab Night and enjoyed 4 plates (probably 5+lbs) of HOT crab legs with HOT drawn butter plus I ordered a Prime Rib with Baked Potato.

The food was good. The crab was really good nice and HOT!! :) The Prime Rib was a little bland however-no real seasoning but still decent. 3 people dining out for under $40!!

Staying at the Tuscany Suites, my family went down to Marilyn's for dinner to kick off our Vegas vacation with a square meal.  We were seated immediately in a booth at the back of the restaurant.

The staff was very happy to have us there.  I am certain of this because the waitress said to us in a genuine way, "We're so happy to see you!" 

I ordered fried chicken ($8.99 + $1.99 for side salad); the Mrs. ordered chicken fried steak ($10.99), and the kids agreed to share an order of lasagna.  

The adults drank water and the kids "made their own lemonade" with water, lemons, and sugar packets.

Our waitress brought fresh warm dinner rolls and cornbread.

All of the dinners were very good, as were the sides.  

The only thing I would have changed was the side salad came with shredded cheddar cheese on top.  This is unnecessary when I order blue cheese dressing.

Service was also very attentive.  At one point my son spilled water onto the table, and a staff person was right there to wipe it up.

Total with the coupon we got at check-in was about $24.  I left a good tip on top of that.  Not bad at all.

Thanks Marilyn!  and kudos to your staff as well.  You haven't seen the last of us.

Went here late so food review might be a little off.   The place is good size with nice wait staff and the kitchen was quick.  We had steak and eggs and everyone was happy.  The deal of the night was all you can eat pancakes.   Who doesn't like pancakes at 2am.  Great little find.
Lives up to the hype! Fresh food and great service. Why eat on the strip when you can pay and get exactly what you pay for. No overpriced meals so tip well because your server deserves it.

This is definitely the spot to go after a night of clubbing and walking the strip! 

$5 steak and eggs includes steak & two eggs (both cooked to your liking), hash browns, and four pieces of toast with butter and jelly. You really can't beat this meal for the price.

Service was kind of slow (or maybe we were all just starving ...), but expected since this place fills up with people getting back from the club. For the low price, I can wait.

The steak & eggs special isn't on the menu, so just ask for it. It runs from midnight - 5am.

Pros:
Friendly service
Fresh ingredients

Cons:
25 minute wait for omelet, steak on a non-filled morning
Food was not seasoned

Had the "Cowboys special" breakfast (only offered during the December rodeo week in Las Vegas).  On a side note, this same breakfast is offered for $8.95 outside of Rodeo week in December and the difference is that you can swap toast for pancakes.  For he Cowboys special I had a Steak, 2 eggs, hash browns, toast and coffee...all for $7.95plus tax.  Amazing value.  Delicious breakfast.  Jose was our server.  Jose is a class act and truly kind gentleman offering excellent service.  Highly recommend this spot for breakfast in Las Vegas.  Open 24 hours.  Tuscany is a great value place to stay as well if looking for a place off the strip at a great price.

My husband had dinner here while I was exiled in NJ and he raved about it.  But he couldn't remember the name.  So when I checked on Yelp I figured it was Tuscany Gardens, which has some really good reviews. Big surprise when it turned out to be Marilyn's Cafe.  It's an effin' coffee shop!  No atmosphere, unless you like the "ambience" of a tired coffee shop.  And lots of people who can't talk in a normal tone of voice, along with shrieking children.  And a waiter (not ours) who goes to clear the vacated table next to us, finds no tip, and SLAMS the hard plastic drink card onto the table loud enough to make me jump out of my seat.

To further compound the misery, it was my birthday.  We weren't here to celebrate it, gawd no, but needed a quick bite to eat before an 8:00 pm Lionel Richie concert at PH, so we were captive.  

Having said all the negative stuff, I had a Reuben, and it was genuinely good.  I hate it when I order a grilled sandwich and it's floppy and ungrilled, but it actually was perfectly done.  The table had the usual condiments, but I like deli mustard on a deli sandwich.  When I asked if they had it, the waiter brought me a cup of a very drippy Dijon.  Not quite what I had in mind, but it was better than yellow mustard.  I can't remember what my husband ordered, but just as before, he liked it a lot.  

The service was pretty good, and if we're ever in the same circumstance, I might consider coming back.  The sandwich was that good.  But I'll bring my own mustard.

The service was kinda slow. 
But portion sides were huge!!

My coffee came out a little on the cold side. So make sure u ask for super hot coffee.
