Also had the steak and eggs everything was cooked as ordered , Seemed a little dis organized on taking orders , bringing  food mixed up on plates and not bringing somethings,Just ordered coffee and water to drink but had to flag down someone to get them after sitting for awhile. Asked for salsa and was almost done eating before it was delivered to the table. Ordered a Cinnamon roll it didnt show so asked for it to be taken off the bill it was and was delivered no charge.. A little unorganized for the shift might have been a turn over going on at the time..All in all it was a good experience..Will go back when in Vegas.

Eh, second time here and service is terrible but cheap food. I ordered the turkey pot pie & it tasted like something was moldy inside. I returned it and ate only a side of hash browns. Only reason I give it three stars is because my boyfriends food was good but over all the place is mediocre at best.

Marilyn's is a traditional American restaurant located in the Tuscany Suites and Casino ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/tuscany-hotel-and-casino-las-vegas#hrid:tHx9zD374l4yfy6zp3rLZw ) on Flamingo Street in Las Vegas. It was pretty late in the Evening last week, and we heard about the popularity of the $3.99 Steak & Eggs - there really aren't any more CHEAP Breakfasts around Las Vegas any more - this is one of the remnants from the good ol' days. The inexpensive Steak & Eggs, from what I understand, are especially popular with Students.

Marilyn's is named after one of the original owners of the Tuscany Casino... even though presently, the Tuscany is corporately owned. Decor is laid-back 50s, especially with the dim incandescent tube lamps over each table or booth. Reminded me of a Spanish Hacienda or an Italian Villa themed restaurant with the dark woods and dim lights.... in keeping, I guess, with the Tuscany theme of the Casino.

On the menu...

Prime Rib (**** $10.95) Meat! That's what I like! The only qualification of a good cut of Prime Rib, IMO, is... leave some Fat in my cut of Prime Rib! And that's what the Chefs at Marilyn's accomplish. Quite a bit more than the 10 ounces stated on the menu... that's alright by me! Side of Cauliflower (** 1/2) - way, way over-cooked, though. And a side of Baked Potato (*** 1/2)... pretty hard not to mess this up. Prefaced with some Dinner Rolls with Butter - OK. Also came with a tin of Au Jus - kids were asking why I wasn't dipping - I never mess up a piece of good meat with anything else!

At less than $1.00 per ounce of Beef - a very, very good value, especially with some Fat left on the Prime Rib. Lucky for me tonight, Marilyn's didn't try to get "Healthy" on me... Ate the Whole Thing! Nothing left on the plate!

Fried Bananas (****) The low rating for this Dessert was primarily my fault... took a little longer to finish the Prime Rib than I thought it would. Therefore the Fried Bananas just sat for a few minutes longer than it should have. I'm a meat guy... wanted to finish off that Beef before starting on the Sweet Stuff! Don't "mess" with the Fried Bananas with a side of Ice Cream... liked it the way if was... just Fried. Really, really good finish to the meal. 

Iced Tea

Value (**** 1/2) As with most restaurants in Casinos, the value factor in a restaurant is usually pretty high because the losses you incur at gambling usually will cover the expenses that most Casino restaurants incur. 

Not crowded on a late weekday evening, just three tables occupied when we dined here... BUT, as with any restaurant associated with a Casino or Hotel in Las Vegas... there WILL be lines and lines of people on the Weekends! This is a basic Casino Coffee Shop, if you don't equate Marilyn's to Fine Dining you'll be OK.

My husband and I ate here over the weekend and had the prime rib dinner and it was delicious.  The food came very quickly and the service was very good.  I ordered a side salad expecting it to be tiny and it was actually large enough for both of us to share .  If you are looking for a good meal at a great price check out Marilyn's Cafe.

Marilyns' cooks everything well like most Vegas coffee shops...Ate there three times last week.  My colleague claims and I quote "The best dry rye toast ever"....not sure where he regularly eats toast

Hoever, I ate a couple of omelettes and both excelled as did the hash browns and the toast.  They have great specials like all you can eat pancakes, steak and eggs for 4 bucks as well as dailys like chicken pot pie

Marilyns is a great find...open 24 hours

$4.99 Steak & eggs between 12-5am! Comes with 2 slices of buttered toast and hash browns. Service was great and FAST which is excellent when it's 3 in the morning and you kind of just want to creep off to bed before the food coma hits you too hard.

My steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare, and was MUCH more tender than the steak over at Ellis Island. No sawing necessary. 

Park to the rear of the casino building for quick and easy access.

We were at the Lounge in the other building attached to the casino and we wanted food.  The Tuscany Garden was closed so this was the only place to get food.  I went over and ordered food to go to take to the lounge.  We ordered a Waldorf Salad, some potato skins, mini burgers and a corned beef sandwich.  Everything that came which was cooked in oil tasted LOUSY.  It tasted like the oil was rancid and had not been changed in a while.

The salad had what they call chicken which was not real chicken, it was processed and tasted nasty.  Needless to say, $38 down the drain because other then the mini burgers and the corned beef sandwich, everything else got thrown in the trash.  The sides with the sandwiches, the potato skins, the salad....Maybe the Steak and Eggs people talk about after midnight might be ok unless you are too drunk to notice any better, otherwise this is a place I would NOT recommend.

The food at least last night was horrible and really deserves a 1 star but the service was good and staff was friendly even though the food was EXTREMELY disappointing.  CHANGE YOUR OIL....

Das Café / Restaurant ist im Tuscany Hotel & Casino untergebracht, es hat 24 Stunden geöffnet. Es ist frei zugänglich, egal ob Hotelgast oder nicht. Hotelgäste haben jedoch den Vorteil das vorhandene WLAN kostenlos nutzen können und ebenfalls Coupons bei der Ankunft erhalten. Es gibt vom Frühstück bis Abendessen fast alles rund um die Uhr. Die Preise sind wirklich moderat und der Service ist auf Zack. Es ist immer wieder eine gute Gelegenheit mit 2 Personen für ca. 25 Dollar ein gutes Frühstück zu bekommen. Ein kleiner Wermutstropfen ist bei vollem Gastraum die Lautstärke.

We were staying at the Tuscany (got there in the afternoon) and had to eat somewhere before seeing a show that night. Big menu so you should find something you like. The food is just OK but decent value for Vegas. Not worth a special trip but if you're nearby you could do worse.

I have to say this place is a quiet low key place. The food was good. I was on a girls trip with my friends. But I have seen many people out of control in public and this one takes the cake. We were seated and the food was out at timely manner. We were seated next to some people who were over the top ridiculous. They were so extra as soon as soon they ordered. They were outright unfair and mistreated the staff. I have to say this staff at Marilyn's Cafe were one of the most patient people I have ever come across. They took all their abuse and ignorance. The reason I give this place 5 stars is because even though those guests were straight up rude. Not once did they loose their cool. They kept offering to fix anything but this case was one of compensation in monetary form. Thank you staff at Marilyn's Cafe and I apologize on behalf of those immature "adults."

The prices here are very affordable and the portions are huge. Our server was really attentive and the tables were clean. It's located inside of Tuscany Suites. I highly recommend grabbing a quick lunch here if you're on a budget.

Late night steak and eggs are the best!

For ~$6 they have a steak and eggs deal that comes with toast and hash browns which frankly cannot be beat! Steaks and eggs are made to order and you can choose which type of bread you would like!

I personally don't care for the toast so I never eat it but for the price, it's not bad at all!

Servers are all great and nice, however, my biggest downside is the wait. The fasted I've gotten my food was 20min with a fairly slow night, avg 45mins, the longest I've waited was 80 mins and half our table was falling asleep!

So biggest thing would be to be wary if you have a large group and or there's a lot of people already there!

$4.99 for steak, eggs, potatoes, break - say what!?  You can't ask for a better deal, especially after a long night of partying at 3 - 4 in the morning.

Don't expect quality steak at this price.  However, the food for sure hits the spot at the wee hours of the morning.

Our waiter was awesome, funny, attentive, and super friendly.

After reading some suggestons for cheap eats for breakfast from various posters on Las Vegas message boards, we decided to check it out. I am all for fine dining and cheap eats while in Vegas, LOL!

Hubby ordered biscuits and gravy and I had the eggs benedict (8.99), and it was plain nasty. The Canadian bacon had a rancid oil taste, yuck and the hollandaise sauce wasn't good either. I prefer my hubby's version, yum! Not to mention their coffee was too strong. Slow service, and our waitress showed no care either.

I guess you get what you pay for, but if you really want cheap eats for breakfast in Vegas I'd go with Ellis Island.

Don't let the Denny's-like decor fool you, this place is the bombbbb diggity.

$5 dollar steak and eggs, SAY WHAT?!  It's not really advertised you just order it, only available from 12am-5am. Soooo either stay up or stay out so you don't miss out on this super awesome deal.  

You know what they say, the early bird gets the the worm! Well, in this case...a steak cooked to your liking (medium-rare ftw!), crispy hashbrowns, two eggs prepared on your word (over easy done right!), and two full slices of toast smeared in butterrrr (white, wheat, rye, sourdough).

Hungry hippo, you're welcome.
Drunk ass, you're welcome.

(I am both of these, so no judgment here!!)
woohoo! late night steak and eggs!  4 stars just for that!  ever since the one at gold coast turned into a TGIFriday, i have been looking for a late night steak and eggs.  victory!
Amazing Breakfast, eggs were perfectly cooked, hash browns were delicious, and the French toast was amazing, crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. Yummy!!!

Great little GEM off the strip. We stayed at the Tuscsny and decided to try this place out. Glad we did. Very nicely decorated with a Tuscany Italian theme, fantastic service and the food was excellent. I ordered the chicken cordon blu, which you don't see offered in many restaurants. The entree was prepared perfectly and the sides, brown rice and whole kernel corn came out hot and were delicious. Highly recommended.
open 24 hours, the have a great selection of food, and the servers were all so nice, They have a burger and drys special for $5.99 its WAY WORTH IT.

Friendly, fast service with a very wide array of menu choices. Food reasonably tasty and priced. The downside? Smoke from the slot machine area infiltrates the cafe, which is adjacent and open to the casino floor.  Also, one has to walk through the smoky area to even reach this restaurant. No thanks.

I'll start with the food. I had the supreme omelette which was good and very large. Coffee was also surprisingly good. So overall, for the quality and the price it's not a bad choice. 

Now for my experience with the staff. My waitress was great! Very attentive and friendly. However, my experience with the manager on duty did not make a good impression. I was waiting to be seated and a waiter walks up to the hostess and asks her a question in Spanish. So the hostess responds to him in Spanish then the manager walks up. She then proceeds to say "English only please". I can't understand what it matters. As I get seated I then hear the manager continue telling the waiter now, "if your customer speaks Spanish that's fine, other than that I want everyone to speak English". First of all, this is Vegas, I hear tons of different languages here a few it's awesome to have so many people from all over the world descend here for work and pleasure, a true melting pot and that's part of what makes Vegas so much fun. Second, I wasn't being responded to in Spanish, my entire conversation with the hostess was in English so she was speaking English, the manager just butted her way in on a conversation and made assumptions. I don't understand why a private conversation can't take place between two co workers in a language that they want. I don't need to know what they're talking about and I doubt that they're trying to hide what they're saying from guests, a ton of people speak Spanish. Lastly, what if I was a fair skinned Spanish speaker and I initiated a conversation with the hostess before she arrived? Isn't that kind of dumb to make an assertion that I speak English? I really didn't appreciate how she spoke to the hard working staff. 

So for that reason, unfortunately 3 stars.

Best cafe breakfast meal that I have had in Vegas to date. My breakfast croissant with a side of grits was delicious! I'll probably go back today. I've eaten here before but it's been a long time. We ended up here by default because Ellis Island had a 45 minute wait & we weren't up for it so I remembered this place & decided to come here. The waitress was sweet, however, the wait for the food was quite bit longer than we expected. When the food finally arrived, I literally shouted "Hallelujah "!! The waitress just cracked up laughing! Lol!! Anyways, this is a great spot for breakfast. You likely won't be disappointed.

Thanks to Yelp, I found this 24 hour place in the middle of the night after a major party at the Cathouse.  We ended up going here twice a day during our four day trip.  

Good prices on some good food.  See my pics!  

The ribs were falling off the bone, WOW!  The Frisco burger was yummy juicy.  The steak n eggs were fresh and full filling.  AND the Lasagna was oozing over with deliciousness!!!!!

It was a great way to start off the day and end the night.  This place can be found in the Tuscany Suites less than 5 mins away from the strip.

Convenient if you stay at the Tuscany Hotel, otherwise, you can find so much better. We had dinner there, then breakfast. Dinner : we ordered pizzas, and i'm pretty sure mine was bought at Walmart and defrosted. Breakfast : not very good, and I suspect it made me sick.
All you can crab legs on Friday night.  You get the legs with two siDes.  $23.99 ayce crab legs.

We had some phenomenal service on a busy Saturday morning!  Nedra, our waitress, was awesome.  (pretty, too!) She was attentive, always nearby and had some great suggestions.  She actually seemed to be happy to do her job, not like some of the soulless eyes that stare back at you in Vegas.  

Jeff got the eggs benedict.  He had ordered them the day before and decided to do them again.  They looked great and the eggs were perfectly cooked.  He got some orange juice.  It was ok, but it had a flavor that we couldn't quite place.  I think there may have been something else in the juice mix, maybe tangerine.  

I got the chili omelet with grits.  The grits were delicious, not too dry and not undercooked.  They added a dollop of butter, which is the way that everyone should eat grits.  (Now, if they had some cheese, I might have added a little of that, too.  I guess I could have asked, but a chili omelet is already enough gut-busting damage as it is.)  The chili was kinda funky and didn't have much flavor.  The omelet was well done, however.  It wasn't too dry nor too runny.  I wasn't going to order toast, but then I changed my mind.  Nedra had toast out to me in less than a minute and it was hot and buttered.  Damn, that is good service.

Jeff got excited and accidentally knocked over his juice, all over the toast.  Within 3 milliseconds, there was a waiter/busboy with a stack of napkins to wipe up the spill.  He was gone and back in a flash with more napkins.  Nedra came over, tsk'd us, offered more juice and brought out more toast.  So impressive. Most places would just ignore you.  
The style of the restaurant reminded me of broken-down Santa Fe style, though I'm sure they were trying to imitate some rustic Italian villa.  (It doesn't work.)

Normally, I would give this place a 3 star, but Nedra made it 4.

First, it's a diner. Not to say that you shouldn't expect decent food but these places have a certain kind of menu and in my opinion, it was executed very well. Food was great and extremely inexpensive for Vegas, we're from Orange County and even at diners we're used to unnecessarily high restaurant prices so my boyfriend and I were both pretty surprised at how reasonable it was.

The service, however, is what the five stars is for.

James was our waiter and I'm pretty sure I've never had a sweeter, more helpful gentleman assist us. He was prompt, kind, and enthusiastic. He checked on us constantly even though the place was packed (at 1:30 am too!) and I know they were slammed that weekend since most of the city was booked out completely, including the Tuscany. We even called the manager over at to complement his service and she acknowledged that he always had a great attitude. I would come back for that alone!

We were addicted!
A big group of us were in town a few weeks ago and stumbled upon Marilyn's Cafe, while searching for a yummy breakfast off the strip.  We had breakfast here 3 of the 4 mornings we were in town!  

Great prices, yummy food and awesome service (I wish I could remember our servers name from our final breakfast there bc she was the best)!  

Their chicken fried steak is amazingly good (it was my first time ever trying it and I was hooked after trying a bite my first morning).  

Great place and will definitely be visited time and time again when we're back in town!

This place is one of the most consistent cafes near the strip. They can always fill up your appetite for very small amounts of money. I would say this is the best late night 'steak and eggs' deal in town. (12am - 5am) The steak for a $6 dollar plate is surprisingly high in quality. Their bbq chicken and ribs special is always a hit, and they also have all you can eat crab legs on Friday nights (ends at 10pm). The staff is very nice, although service can be quite slow sometimes.

They do not do the steak and eggs special to go, and they only do call in orders if you are a guest at the Tuscany. 

Grant it this is not a high place for fine dining (or even modern fast casual), they seem to deliver every time when one is look for a bite to eat.

This review is only for the steak and eggs. Prices keep increasing every time I come (it was like $3.99 back then but now it's $5.99), but it is still the best late-night steak and eggs in town. Note, this pricing only applies after 1am or something super late like that, but hey, it's perfect for those after-clubbing munchies. I've never ordered anything else here.

My steak is always cooked perfectly medium rare. The one at Ellis Island is always overdone. I get my eggs sunny side up with runny yolk. Sourdough toast, which they spread melted butter all over. You don't even need the jam that they give you. And then hash browns to round it all out. Some places give you fried potatoes, which is just not the same. 

Located inside Tuscany Suites, which is only a few blocks away from the Strip. Open 24 hours, for obvious reasons. Never a wait. Seriously can't beat that!

Went to dinner at Marilyn's Café in Tuscany Hotel, and had the worst dining experience.  Ordered Roast Beef Medium Rare, and my friend ordered the steak  Medium Rare.  The Roast Beef came out PURPLISH GRAY AND I COULDN'T CUT IT WITH MY KNIFE.... sent it back and ordered the steak instead..  Waited one hour for my steak to come out of the kitchen.  My friend meanwhile finished his steak which was OK nothing to rave about, but was still waiting for his vegetable corn to come to the table.  He had ordered glazed carrots which came out of the kitchen brown and carrots are orange so he sent them back and said he'd have corn instead. He was finished his steak when the corn finally came out, but my steak was still a mystery.  Were they butchering the cow out back in order to make my steak?  After waiting one hour I asked for the manager and he really did nothing much but say "I'll go look in the kitchen"....instead of saying " I'm sorry you are waiting so long, what can I do to make it better."... nothing, couldn't care less.  Finally my steak came out and I ate it, just to eat something because after waiting that long I was hungry. 
 I decided to put in a complaint to management and asked for the GM of the restaurant to call me .... as of this writing he still has not called me to find out what happened, or offer an apology for the terrible food we were served and length of time it took to get it.  
Tuscany's restaurant Marilyn's Café is terrible.  Sure they have specials which is where they do most of their business, but for regular dinner items.... they serve food that really could make you ill, purplish gray roast beef?  and the waiter brings it out, instead of saying to the cook this doesn't look right.  
Will never eat there again and my advice would be don't bother to dine at Marilyn's Café, you'd be better off at the IHOP or Dennys, at least there food is the color it is supposed to be and you don't wait an hour for it..... Terrible, terrible dining experience.

I fought with my boyfriend about coming here for over a year.  He kept telling me how amazing it was, and a favorite with the locals, but I was unconvinced.  About a year ago I gave in, and feel like an idiot for not coming earlier.

This restaurant is located off the floor of Tuscany casino.  Don't let that bother you.  If you want a home style meal, whether breakfast, lunch, or dinner, Marilyn's is perfect.  I have had both breakfast and dinner here.  The menu is extensive, there is something for everyone.  I always get the half-chicken dinner (it comes with big fluffy rolls and 2 sides of your choice (a list of anything from potatoes, veggies, salad, fruit, etc).  Dinner is always super fast and delicious.  The breakfast menu is expansive, as are the portions.  They serve a very high quality of food here.

I have never had a bad meal here.  It is not a fancy strip restaurant, more of a diner ambiance, but that is part of the charm.

When here for our last night in Vegas and it was a lovely dinner. 1st a wonder blond lady I believe her name was Leandra she when out of her way to help us with choices to let us change what we wanted and she never ever made us feel like we were bothering her. Food wise there meatball soup is really good and filling, the prime rib taquto we're a great appetizer, dinner wise I had there turkey pot pie which was soooo good and my hubby had the steak which he could not  put down. Next time we're here we will be back, also price was very nice. Get down here and enjoy the meal

If it's the middle of the night/early early morning, this is where you wanna go.  Cheap steak & eggs.  It's not a silly portion either.  Pretty dang big and filling. There wasn't much of a wait when I came..and a group of 9 of us. Though I must say the service took a while to take our orders..and we noticed that other tables were getting their orders taken even when they came in later than us.  Sometimes frustrating, especially if you're starving.  But when the food came out, all was well.  The hash browns were crispy and tasty. The English muffin was buttered and good.  The eggs...hard to mess up eggs. Now the steak.  Mine was fine, some fatty parts that I tried to avoid, but it was expected. But my friend sitting next to me, almost half her piece of steak was fat....so it looked as though she only ate half of it and gave up..but it was because there were so many parts of her steak that would have been just mouthfuls of fat..tasty.

I'm giving 4 stars because I've yet to try anything on the menu but the all you can eat crab legs on Friday evenings but if I were to rate that I'd give it a 5. This is the best place I've found in Vegas so far to have all you can eat crab that's not the buffet!

I've eaten here more than I'd like. It was really good 7 - 10 years ago. It's gone downhill sice then. Even when the cook of the evening is bad, I could mozzarella sticks and fries. Not now. Even they're horrible. So is the service. Too bad. Probably hit by recession, like so many.

Not great but not bad at all I actually think they deserve 3.5 stars but thats not an option here on Yelp. The prices were decent the food was pretty good but the service was sort of slow. I think this is a good place to go if you're with a group of people because they had a very large selection and the prices were reasonable. Oh and I must mention that they have Sweet Potato Fries.... yum!

this place is really stupid. first
of all the servers are rude and obviously hate their job???? idk but they have horrible attitudes. second they can't split checks at all? I work at a restaurant it is extremely easy to split a check or at least put a certain amount on different cards. the sever just did his side work the whole time which was rude and when we needed something he wasn't around we had to go up to him. so we had to use an ATM and get charged an extra 2.50 and then we get charged 18% gratuity like for what??? the service here was disgusting and it was annoying.
they need to get their shit together and I work at a restaurant so I do know how it goes and I think it was horrible it was a disgrace they need a new system and new staff because it was not good at all. I don't want to come back for those reasons

Marilyn's Cafe is located inside of the Tuscany Suites and Casino.  Just off the casino floor, it's a fairly open restaurant and is very convenient for those who happen to be inside Tuscany.  We came here for a cheap dinner before heading out to the strip.  I had the spaghetti with meatballs for a reasonable $7.  It's cheap and affordable and the portions are average sized, but reasonable.  My friends enjoyed their dishes as well and we all finished our meals and ended up with empty plates.  The service was pretty slow, and even slower when you realized that the cafe was not quite filled up at all.  However, we couldn't deny the deal we were getting.  

Pro Tip: Apparently there's a deal for $3 steak and eggs early in the morning (3 am to 7 am).

Every time I'm in Vegas, Marilyn's Cafe is always the place I go to for amazing food at great prices whether or not I'm staying at Tuscany Hotel.

It's a nice little restaurant plugged next to a casino inside a hotel; just a 15-minute walk off-Strip. The atmosphere can be for casual or romantic occasions but, as far as I've noticed, a lot of people eat there after partying so expect a few energetic crowds. That could be because I always arrive at odd hours after clubbing or raving--anywhere from 3-6am. The decor is warm, the furniture placement is spacious, and the whole setting is inviting coupled with some of the best service experience I've had. With the right friends, this place is perfect. I remember a couple years back, after my friends and I drunkenly collected handful of escort cards walking down The Strip, we played our own version of 21 with the cards and the staff didn't bat an eyelash. The waiters and waitresses are very charming and friendly. Once, they even warmed up food I got from Earl's Sandwiches. Ask for something nicely and they'll return in kind. So overall, the staff and environment is really great.

Their menu is so vast--spanning at a whopping 127 total entree choices for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner (~40 each; not including beverages)--yet they don't lose the quality of their food and their portions are very generous. Each entree comes with your choice of bread and butter or jam. They gave me enough (delicious) baked ziti to last me a couple of days. I've also had their vegetarian omelet a few times which was a little more bland than I would have liked but, luckily for me, I like dousing my omelets in spicy sauces or dip it in ketchup so it tasted just perfect. My friends always, always, always order their Steak and Eggs which I would recommend for anyone who loves Vegas' meaty breakfast foods at affordable prices--sometimes they have Daily specials for this at $6.

Whether you're pumping yourself full of food for a hard night out, hungover, or just hungry, this is the place to be. With the friendly environment, great company, delicious cuisine, and college student-friendly prices, it's a perfect dining experience. My friends and I always visit here whenever we're in Vegas and we have some really great memories here. It's a tradition we plan on continuing for as long as we hang out in LV together.

$4 steak and eggs special during midnight graveyard hours. Its not on the menu but you can ask the waitress about it and they will tell you about it. NOT bad for the portion they give you, it comes with hash browns and toast as well. What a deal! I only go here for their steak and eggs specials after a long night of clubbing and partying. Inside of the Tuscany suite at Marilyn cafe.
All you can eat crab legs on Fridays 4pm-10pm. Be prepared to wait 20 to 30min. Well worth the wait! Nice warm tasteful crab legs with hot butter!

Our waitress was the best!! I don't remember her name, but she had us call her "Auntie." She was so nice and accommodating. One of us don't eat meat or the other prefers something else, she'd tried to make it more suitable for us and was very attentive.

Food was fast.

I ordered one of the hash bowls: hash browns with cheddar cheese, spinach, mushrooms, and sunny side up eggs on top - SO GOOOOD, such good comfort food served as breakfast, not too heavy, comes with 2 pancakes so you get that sweet as well

NY Steak and eggs - Senior special $8, steak is tender, comes with hash browns
$4 after 12am

Chicken pot pie - good, my friend ate it all but kinda small

We came here because Ellis Island's line was too full. I heard the food is better, but I definitely don't mind coming here either. Ellis Island is mainly meat and eggs I believe, whereas this place has ALL the american food you can think of! from breakfast, lunch, to dinner, anything you want or craving, so come here!
Great prices. They have 4$ all you can eat pancake. About 13$ for a big good breakfest. Free wifi
Food is considerably very good compared to the price. Prices are VERY reasonable and there are a ton of great different choices. Breakfast is so-so but Southern Fried Chicken is a must-try!

This place is a god-send after a long night on the town, because when the clock strikes 12am it's time for $3.99 Steak and Eggs!!!!!!! 
  Seriously what can sound better than that? And if your thinking they'll skimp at that price, oh no my friends your dead wrong. Your getting a good sized slab (4oz?) with two eggs served your way, a heaping helping of hashbrowns, and the glorious buttered toast. ( Eat it with jam or use it to sop up the yolk) It's all the  right components to soak up all the booze in your system. 
  This place was so awesome I came here both nights I was in town. I hear the wait for your food to come here is pretty ridiculous, but both times I was so far gone I couldn't tell. LMAO
First meal I ate in Las Vegas. Porkchops and eggs.  Very good. Clean place, friendly service.  What you would expect from Las Vegas.

THE GOOD: They serve alcohol, they're open 24/7 and have all your diner needs. The prices are an ode to old school Vegas back when awesome food specials would draw you into random hotels. Perfect for after the club "sober me up" delectables.

THE BAD: The wait!!!  Oh my goodness!  You'd better have plenty of time to spare cause you'll have 3 major waits to deal with. First off its not on the strip, Second you'll wait a while to be seated and finally you'll wait a longer while to actually get your food.  I believe the long waits puts an unnecessary additional amount of pressure on the taste of the food.  We wanted Steak and Eggs and Yelped this place specifically for that reason.  Sadly the steak was REALLY tough and the hash browns were bland and uneventful. 

ALL IN ALL: Gets the job done but not at all memorable! Again it was probably the long wait that hurt the taste so I gave this place an additional star. With all that said I'd definitely go back at some random hour with less expectations.
I will eat here every time i stay at the Tuscany just for the tomato and basil omelet. All of their food is awesome though. So is their service.

I walked over here from The Westin because of the delicious photos I saw of the waffle sweet potato fries and the great prices. It also looked like the environment was a lot better than Ellis Island.

Once I arrive I have to wait 5+ minutes to be sat because the host is off somewhere else. Then I'm sat and NO ONE comes to greet me, ask if I want something to drink or anything for 10 minutes! Finally a server on his way to drop off a guest check at the last remaining occupied table in my section stops and asks if I have been helped. I told him no and he takes my order and brings me back a water using lots of 'here you are beautiful'. He was the only saving grace of my visit but that was short lived because I overheard him telling his last table that his shift was over. 

I order the four piece fried chicken and it is brought out in about 12 minutes by a lady. No one comes back to check on me the entire time I'm eating. When I'm done I ask the food runner who I can get my check from and he says he'll let my server know. I find that interesting because 'I' don't even know who my server is. The lady who dropped off my food but never introduced herself or spoke to me drops off the check and asks if I want a box. I say yes. It then takes a little bit to get the box. As I get up to leave to go to the cashier she then yells out "Thank you so much, have a nice day!" as if she just remembered she wants a tip for her non-service.

So then I get to the cashier and it's a whole new barrel of monkeys. I hand the cashier my debit card and she says she needs my id for credit cards. I tell her I didn't bring it in my little wristlet because I didn't want to gamble and just came over for lunch. I say it's debit and I'll put in my pin. She says they don't have the machine and that I would need my ID.  I only left $8.79 in my wristlet and my check is $9.74 and I tell her again I didn't bring my license cause I walked and wasn't planning on gambling and just brought my debit card. I ask for a manager. She goes away, comes back and says the manager is busy but that it's their policy to need ID even for a debit card cause they are going to run it as credit and that I can go use the casino ATM. I tell her there is no way I'm taking out cash at a casino ATM and that there should have been a notice prior to a guest sitting down and eating in the restaurant that I would need id to use my debit card as that is not common practice to need one at restaurants. The large sign by the cash register only says you need id and room key if you are going to make a room charge. Seeing as how I'm at Tuscany eating and staying at The Westin that didn't apply to me. She then walks over to a small notice in small writing on the other side of the other register that says for credit cards you need id. Again I tell her that I brought by DEBIT card, and that little sign won't be seen by anyone, AND it would be seen after the fact. After someone has already eaten. I told her I'm trying to pay but I'm not using using their ATM and I only have $8.74 in cash on me and if the manager is too busy to come speak with a guest (I even showed her the copy of my work id that I have a pic of on my iphone that shows I'm airline crew which has helped many times at hotel front desks when I've locked my room key in my room and I need them to reissue me another one) then thatbis not my problem. Finally, she goes back to wherever she went before, comes back and takes the cash I do have and says next time bring ID, and I tell her there won't be a next time.

Between the horrible service, then the cashier incident, I would not go back to that place. The food was fine, but nothing special. Not to mention the pieces of chicken were 25-50% smaller than any normal sized chicken pieces you would get at KFC or the grocery store.

$6 for steak and eggs, hashbrowns and English muffin!? Yes please. This is a great deal from 12am-5a, after the club! They had signs up that they would not split checks. I assume due to the deal. It was decent for what it is. I would recommend getting the steak rare. I usually eat my steaks medium rare, but you know with these random cafes. Also if you like your hashbrowns crispy, get well done and they cook it on both sides. Yummy.

I went for their Steak & Eggs late night special for $4.99. Specials run from midnight 12am to 5am. Heard about from Yelp when having hunger pangs late at night during a Las Vegas vacation.

The special come with a strip steak (cooked medium, my preference), two eggs to your liking (mine is sunny side up), hash browns shredded-style, and toasts. Sure hits the spot and satisfies!

I guess they have time limits on everything and they expect you to eat within two minutes to get the dinner special.

Was excited but now I'm not, I guess I'll take my money elsewhere and leave this awesome review on yelp

This cafe is the gem of Tuscany suites and casino. First of all, I love staying at Tuscany because it is super close to the strip, very cheap compared to the hotels on the strip, & extremely spacious!! So much room to fit huge parties.
And of course it has Marilyn's cafe. I'm pretty sure this place is open 24/7. They are known for their steak and eggs and it is under $10 I think! So cheap!!! It comes with some toast and hash browns as well! Pretty delicious, I mean of course it isn't some fancy steak but it definitely does the job for your late night hunger after the club!

I usually always order the steak and eggs but today I decided to try something else. They have a pretty large variety of items including breakfast and I was definitely in the breakfast mood so I decided to get a vegetarian omelette, a blueberry pancake, and a banana pancake. Yes, I definitely ordered with my eyes.

The wait was kind of long for the food.... but once it came I legit vacuumed my food up!!! Everything was delicious! Our server was also very friendly and delivered excellent customer service.

I would recommend the steak and eggs for sure and after what I tried today, I'm sure there are other great items too!

Worse customer service ever. I get that they're busy, but for a waiter to cater another table every 5 minutes and our table every 20 mins is just complete bs. It had to tale someone to complain to get attention. 

We ended up super upset after being so patient with the service. Manager helped us a good 20mins later after we asked to speak to him. He gave us 25% off and went about his day. I work in the industry too, but there was no sympathy with the manager. We were there for 2 hrs, just waiting for some service. Which, btw, we ordered the all you can eat crab. Within the 2hrs, we barely got much to order. Crabs were small, but not bad. You literally would have to order 3-4 plates to get full. So, imagine being there for the length of time we were there and had no service just waiting.

This is a hidden gem inside the Tuscany. The prices are fantastic, the menu is solid across breakfast lunch and dinner. It is part of the reason I use the Tuscany any time I come to Vegas.

Lunch is my favorite meal - the personal size pizza is huge for 1 person, and the soups are awesome. I love the beef barley soup. The sides and aka carte items are reasonably priced, so if you don't see what you want as a combo, you can craft your own without paying a penalty.

I'm biased. The only thing I order here is $4.99 steak and eggs. 

I can't get over that for $5 I can get a legit meal of steak, eggs, hashbrowns, and toast. (Medium steak with over medium eggs.. yee) . It's perfect after clubbing food. It's also great that its 24 hours. Also, the service there was pretty good. It was 2 am and the guy working was still peppy. Props to you man!

Just terrible, even for a 24 hour cafe.  

I came here because, well, just LOOK at these other reviews.  This place looks great, right?  Fellow yelpers, how could you fail me so miserably?!

I made a special trip.  Not there to gamble, just to have breakfast.  I've had better food at nursing homes.

The eggs Benedict was unrecognizable as such.  Is that megaplex nacho cheese?   I didn't even want to try it because it looked so hideous.  Like congealed latex.

And the eggs were not even remotely poached.  More like hard boiled into some thing beyond a solid.  As in, like maybe something one would find on the surface Jupiter.  

And the grits?  Well, I guess I should know better than to order grits in Las Vegas, but   these were somehow both watery and grainy at the same time.  

I kept looking for the hidden camera, because surely I was being punked.

Top it off with a bloody mary that was basically clamato juice and (a half shot?) vodka with a touch of tabasco.  ie. about the most uninspired version of a bloody mary I've ever had the displeasure of drinking.  

I rarely send back food and then not give them the opportunity to try again.  But this place was clearly beyond all redemption.

$5.99 steak and egg special!  We came here because it was cheaper than at Ellis Island haha (only by $1 though).  It was pretty great to finally try a midnight/late night steak and egg meal, and we are happy we came to this restaurant.

The meal came with steak, eggs, hash browns, and buttery toast, with plenty of jam to go with it :D  It was definitely a great meal and a great deal!
Had 6 oz Steak& eggs. Soooo good. Wheat toast, French toast were delicious as well. Servers are attentive & friendly. Hash browns eh not so delicious.

I've been coming here since 2010 for all you can eat crab legs. Over the years I've come in large groups, I have brought dates, coworkers, my daughter and friends. The service, food, ambiance and food have always been great! However, last night was absolutely horrible! Our waiter John was very negligent! He brought us cold food. The cheese on what was supposed to be Mac n cheese was hard, dry and tasted like it was sitting out all day! He didn't bring butter with our crab nor a bucket. When we saw him 20 minutes later we asked for these things and after waiting another 30 minutes I literally went into the back kitchen to get butter and a crab bucket! Mind you it was 5 of us, which I informed the waiter who gave me the butter but she still only gave me butter for myself. She advised the others had to wait for our waiter. When John finally made his way to our table for the 1st time since bringing our food, we asked where has he been and where's the butter for the crab? He didn't offer an apology but instead the poor excuse that, "it's busy tonight." He refused to take the old cold Mac n cheese stating, "I saw you guys eat some already." Well of course! That's how we know it tastes like garbage! He didn't bring our 2nd serving of all you can eat crab legs until 40 minutes later! We became so desperate for service that we were asking the bus boys to please get us water, more crab, butter, etc. Of course that's out of their job scope so we were unfortunately stuck with John's extremely poor service. We asked for a manager and were advised there isn't one available. At the end if it all, we waited an additional 30 minutes for him to bring us the check. Our bill was $138, we paid then ventured into the Casino to gamble as we usually do. To our surprise John the waiter came into the casino to ask, "no tip for my service?" I replied, "we don't tip for non service." This is the 1st time I didn't leave a tip and I go out to eat at least 4 times a week! Since this is Vegas there are all you can eat crab in almost every casino. We will NEVER come here again!!!!!!!!! They have lost a 7 year customer for good!!!!!!!!

$3.99 steak and eggs after midnight!
that's pretty much all you need to know about this place. It comes with hash browns, and toast. The quality of the steak is so-so. I went here twice the last time I went to Vegas. The first night I ordered my steak "medium-well" and it was too red and bloody. The second night I ordered it "well-done" and it was still red. It wasn't that big of a deal for me because I'd still eat it but it might irk some people. The hash browns were also a bit undercooked. I only eat the toast top of the hash browns. 
But again, for $3.99, you get what you paid for. 
Service is great though. They were friendly and peppy for midnight =) That's why I give them 4 stars.

Listen well: I come here with this expectation that any regular, run of the mill breakfast place--no matter where you go--..."breakfast food is always horrible when it's not gourmet". Some of you should write that down ;P 

But, not everyone can just sit down and afford $20 breakfasts at the top notch places. Some of us just want steak and eggs and don't want to spend a ton of money (me)! And some of us are drunk and hungry and need a 24/7 breakfast place (sometimes me)!!!

That being said, Marilyn's Cafe is not that bad. It's on par with IHOP and Blueberry Hill in terms of food. And let's face it--every cheap breakfast place you've stopped at is probably horrifyingly average.

AMBIANCE: 3 - The Cafe, or at least the inside seemed out of place. The Tuscany looks like a classy casino, until you step into the cafe, where it seems a bit worn down and old. However, it was very spacious inside and they try to sit everyone at booths since not a ton of people come visit them! 

SERVICE: 4 - Our waiter was really friendly and fast at servicing us. Our food came out quick--I know, how can it not?! It's steak and eggs!--and they left us alone for the most part except to refill drinks. 

FOOD: 3 - Word to the wise: Alert! Alert! BYOW. Bring Your Own Water. The water I had was nasty. I would strongly suggest some bottled water, or maybe you could get a soda! My steak and hash browns  were okay, as long as I had it with steak sauce! Don't get me wrong, the steak was big and juicy, there was just something off with the taste.  The eggs were good! I usually order either scrambled or over easy with cheese. 

Fun Facts: Their jelly that goes with their Toast is Heinz jelly instead of Smuckers! It's way, way better. 

Times were fun, MC. It's a win when you're on a budget! If I go again, I might just taste their pancakes because it's so cheap!

This place is great for late night steak and eggs. Just make sure you're aware that they do not split checks in the later hours. Their steak and eggs are delicious and very inexpensive. If your waiter turns out to be James, you're gonna be in great hands because he's a great guy, very professional and genuine. Definitely recommend this restaurant if you want something late at night!

The food is actually really good, but they hardly ever get the order right when it's to go. On my most recent trip I ordered a hamburger no cheese. I know for a fact she understood this because she repeated it to me " hamburger, so you don't  want the cheese?".  I got a patty melt with lots of cheese, now i'm not lactose intolerant or allergic to cheese so i'll live, i'll be a big girl and eat it, but then I notice it's on the only bread that I know of that I do NOT like at all, Freakin Rye! but hey i'm already at home and maybe somehow someway they've taken all the ingredients I don't like on a burger and made this the best taste treat ever. Did it work you ask, did they accomplish the impossible?....... Do you see 5 stars?! Honestly if I was reviewing this meal alone i'd be giving it 1 star, I had to throw the burger away, but wait there's more I also ordered  a fried chicken salad ( to eat later) and I received no chicken on my salad, when she took it back to fix it she came back with grilled chicken. Oh I know it's healthier, but this is what I cook at home all the time I don't go out to eat what I make, and yes I let it go, I took it which was a good thing because as you previously read my burger sucked. I went out to eat and ended up with exactly what I already had at home. I do put up with it because the food is really good and the portions always leave you with left overs.
Food was really good.  It's just simple cooking with a low price tag.  Service was average. Serving size is average to large, neither one of us were able to finish our meals

This is our go to spot every time we hit up vegas. Its located in Tuscany Suites.. The hotel itself is on the older side and not the greatest filtration system when it comes to the cigarette smoke, but the restaurant itself doesn't carry the smell. The food is great and decently priced. Service is good, the prices have gone up over the years but understandable. Good place to go when you are looking for a quick bite. The prime rib is good (best medium) if they have it available for purchase.

We came for the all you can eat crab, so as you can expect it was super busy. We were told Our wait would be 30 minutes to an hour, which we waited the full hour. The cafe is located Inside a casino so you can also expect it to be loud and Smokey. The AYCE crab came with two sides I got the garlic green beans Which were ok, they were canned green beans with a tiny bit of garlic and slivered almonds, and a sweet potato which was served in half with a side of butter and brown sugar. The crab legs were little, like baby claw little served with warm butter over a tea candle. Wait times in between servings were about 20 minutes long. 

As far as the service goes, I'll say the server assistant was more of assistance than our actual server was. She got our drinks, placed our ordered, got us refills on both drinks and crab and after we asked our server for the tab and he never returned, the "assistant" was ever so kind to bring us the bill! 

Is this place on my destination for awesome food list? Not so much! 
Would I come here again? On someone else's account.
This place has good food but bad service thats all
The food was great , we ate off the 50+ menu and got Chopped Steak with Mushroom Gravy , I got Brown Rice my husband got White Rice, it was Delicious, and the service was great .

First time here, nice quaint casino... I ordered the breakfast croissant and it came with hasbrowns.  It was tasty and plentiful.  The decaf coffee was really good and the waitress was very accommodating.  I like it here.  I enjoyed the gambling too.

Just to be clear, in my experience, there is one thing and one thing only to go to Marilyn's Cafe for, and that is the graveyard breakfast specials. It certainly isn't the service -- it's absolutely ridiculous how terrible the service has been here. In fact, there was one time among the twenty other times we've dined here when we were waited on by a lady who received a 100% tip from us, and all she did was do her job. That's it. It was just such a pleasant change for us, we decided to let her know. A lot.

The graveyard breakfast specials aren't bad, and the price is outrageously cheap. Steak 'n eggs, taters, and toast -- $2.99. Pancakes or two eggs 'n toast -- $0.99.  Perfect place to go after a night on the town. Just, like I said, be patient with the servers.

Went here for a well priced steak and it delivered. I got the prime rib and it was cooked to perfection. The server was very nice and the prices were good. The atmosphere is a typical cafe, nothing fancy. If you get a players card you can get a 10% off coupon. The only reason I didn't give more stars was the sides weren't great. The green beans were over cooked to my liking and the baked potato could have been cooked longer. But the meat was good and that was most important to me.

This is a late review, but this was a memorable spot from my weekend in Vegas some months ago.

They have this late night special where they have steak, hashbrowns, eggs, and toast for $5!  The girls and I did this two nights in a row, and if the weekend was longer we probably would have been back again.  I have never had any of the other food, but I've heard that it's also decent.  

Next time you're leaving a club/party with drunchies (drunk munchies), come here for an affordable and filling meal.

We loved this cafe! Amazing food. Hash browns were wonderful and the senior discount was loved by my grandparents. The country sausage bowl was great, and the croissant sandwiches were huge. Overall we had an amazing experience & the staff was wonderful. The best part was the prices. Extremely affordable.
Ate here everyday on our trip to Las Vegas. 5 days and I couldn't get enough! The prices are reasonable and food portions are big. Would recommend to anyone.

Wandered in around 11 pm and inhaled my yearly dose of second hand smoke in the hour I waited for the graveyard special to start. Totally worth it.
Two eggs
Two pieces of toast
Hashbrowns 
Steak medium rare
$6.48 including tax.
Crazy.
Food is so gross. Deep fried junk sh*t. Seriously. So disappointing. The service is great tho. I don't understand why this place has a lot of reviews.

Came here again this past weekend for the steak and eggs and I noticed they now had $3.99 unlimited pancakes. So for $8 bucks you can get both and the pancakes are pretty good. Or you can split them like we did and just keep ordering more plates!

This is a good spot depending on the servers of the night to have steak and Eggs with friends after going out. This is my least favorite place to eat steak and eggs or eat in general especially how there are a lot of late owls roaming this casino wanting to grab a bite to eat. They do not split checks at night and they only take two types of payments: one card and the rest cash. I think it's ridiculous that they have to implement the rules that we can't split checks and on top of that we can't have multiple payments?! It makes it stressful on my group and other customer's groups, and it strongly deters people from dining in here. The cashiers sigh and roll their eyes when a group has difficulty arranging the payment method, and I'm just standing in front of them like you guys are just standing and taking payments, no need to roll your eyes when customers are struggling to pay because of your unnecessary rules/ limitations to big groups. Some servers are sweet and I appreciate that but other employee's just don't know how to hold customer service. When we dined in one time, my cousin put her head down because she had a headache and an employee comes up to our table to let us know that she can't be laying her head on the table... why not? We are paying customers clearly waiting for our food, what else should we resort to while sitting down?! I've only had steak and eggs here and it's good but never will I ever make this a go to spot due to the bad customer service and attitude.

The all you can eat crab legs are a hit ! There steak and eggs are a bargain and their Pizza is delicious !!!! T bone steak was huge and well worth it ! These prices remind me of old Vegas !! Great spot and the casino is nice !

One of the best "unexpected gem" secrets that I found out about by a Las Vegas native. I would always come to Marilyn's Cafe after clubs in the AMs for their Steak n Eggs which is like $5.99 I believe?? This cafe is located in Tuscany Hotel which is kinda far from most clubs but worth the uber/lyft over. 

I believe their Steak n Eggs special is usually in the middle of the night which is the perfect drunchies. You can order the steaks however you want (rare, medium rare, medium well, etc.), you can also order the eggs however style you want (poached, scrambled, sunny side up, etc.), and you can order whatever your 2 pieces of bread you want too (wheat or white). It also comes with a big piece of hash brown. DEFINITELY WORTH THE COST. 

Service was pretty quick but the food sadly does take a long time to come out. Sometimes when it's busy, the wait for the food can feel like forever. However, once the food is out, the happiness begins because the food is bomb. I think it's one of the perfect ways to end a night. The steak is definitely worth more than the price you pay. The bread is probably my favorite part because they put butter over it and it tastes so good and toasted.

Definitely a must go to place for people should go to when they're in Vegas!! It's definitely exceeded my expectations and I can't wait to be back here

Sooooooo yummy! Portions are huge, we still had leftovers enough for dinner. Mmmmmm slppp yum yum 

Waldorf Salad and Tuesday special 1/2lb ribs & 1/2lb chicken with two servings of fries 

Plussss complementary corn bread, so yummy too! 

Always drink lemon water before meal  helps with digestion.

Ughhhh food coma cuz food is so bomb

My tummy is happy and fully satisfied. I'll definitely be back.

Service: SLOW! Our waitor was SLOW! Big Turn OFF!  It was like as if I were watching a slow motion video. SLOOOOOOOOOOWWWWW MOOOOOOOOOTIIIIIIIIIIOOOOOOOOONNNNNNNNNNNN FOR YOOOOOOOOOOOUUUUUUUUU!

My chinese chicken salad was mediocre, but I heard the steak was pretty good.  Restaurant is clean and spacious.

Heard about the $3.99 steak and eggs after midnight so that's pretty awesome.  

Service is very important at a restaurant.  Bad service makes me not enjoy my food as much so 2 stars and that 2 stars is me being generous. 

I can't even think of anything else to say because I was so distracted by the service. SLOoooooooW!

Went there for dinner because we just wanted a quiet night at the hotel.  Service was great.  Food was good and had big portions.  We are pretty picky about food so while the food wasn't as seasoned as fancy as we are used too, when you added salt and pepper it was pretty tasty. Had the prime rib, mashed potatoes and spinach.  The price was only $13.99!  Husband had the pork chops and they were cooked like he asked. Didn't have any desert but the tray looked pretty enticing.

I thought I already wrote a review of this place, but I guess not.

Great place.  I ate here twice while staying at my new favorite hotel/casino, Tuscany Resort.

This restaurant is open 24/7 and the food is great.  The presentation is wonderful too!  Even with just $2 steak and eggs, it is served up in a fashion fit for a king!

The pizza's were pretty good too.

I would definitely stop eat here again!

Looked up a place to have a good and inexpensive dinner, when we found this place on yelp we decided to try it out. 
Located in the quaint, friendly and clean Tuscany Suites Casino it is truly a great place to enjoy some very good food, quaint and homely atmosphere. We were sat at our table very quickly, our waiters were very friendly and provided the specials of the day. Our food came out rather quickly and we were very happy with our choices. We had dinner and came back for breakfast the next morning. We enjoyed our food very much and will definitely be going back again.

3 words. STEAK & EGGS!!

Have a night of clubbing at XS this was the joint to go to with my group of friends. At 3am the place was not as packed, which was good and the food was delicious. 5-6 dollar steak and eggs, who can let that go?

The steak was nicely seasoned and huge!! I couldn't even finish my meal. Maybe because I was exhausted from the night, but this is the go to spot for a night on the strip.

$3.99 Steak & Eggs! The perfect meal when you've had a bit too manys drink after a night of dancing in Vegas. I am definitely coming here again!

Also, WATER! Our waiter was super good at refilling our water, especially after being so dehydrated from all the alcohol.

We were looking for a place off the strip to eat breakfast when I came across reviews for this place. It is located inside the Tuscany Hotel and Casino. There was a wait as apparently this place is pretty popular but it was do-able. 

Services was ok, it did seem somewhat lacking but not horrible. There were times when I waited quite some time for a refill on my coffee. Also, I got my food before my mimosa arrived which was weird since it's a simple drink to make. 

Food was average but you really can't complain because the prices are very reasonable. We walked out spending $30 on two breakfasts, coffee, a soda and a mimosa. On the strip you'd pay more than this for the food alone. 

I would go back because it was ok food and service but the pricing can't be beat. You'll leave full without breaking the bank.

Good food for the money.  Located inside the Tuscany Casino.

We ate here over the course of our three day stay while attending a convention.  Average price ranged from $7-10.   You can't go wrong.

Pros - plenty of seating.  Solid American food.  Cheap and plenty.

Cons - food served fairly lukewarm like my pancakes and corn beef hash.

Opened 24 hours daily.  Lots of to go orders.

A small little diner with a late night special for steak, eggs, hash browns and toast for $5.99. For a very cheap meal, it was pretty tasty.

We all ordered medium rare and each of our steaks came out...MEDIUM RARE! 
We all ordered a variety of eggs and it come out just right, my over easy wasn't over cooked and was served with a runny yolk right when I dug my fork into the guy. Wheat toast was toasted to a nice toast & buttered just right. The last piece though...it was drowning in butter where it wasn't melted completely and it was amazing! 

Service was super nice. We came in pretty late right when we got to Vegas and they seated us right away and the waitress was a doll.

Not a gourmet dining experience, but the service is great, and the food is delicious!  I had their fruit pancakes, and they are soooo good.  I'm a healthy eater, so I didn't use the butter or syrup I was given.  They were perfect as they were, with tons of fruit baked into them.  I've also come here and gotten dinner, as well.  Yummy veggie burger!  I'll definitely be back again.

Me and my wife had the prime rib and turkey the prime rib was very Bland tough the turkey was what I over-salted dry the food I'm pretty sure food served at a homeless shelter would have tasted better than this it was overpriced and then I had to wait 15 minutes at the register while three attendance sat there and ignored me didn't say a single word to me with no one in front of me in the line I highly recommend that no one ever eats at this restaurant

Came back here this pass weekend and they were $3.99. 

I think because it was holiday weekend they up their price. But my steak and eggs were definitely on point! We went to the Victorian Room at Bills I think it was, right across from Ceasars and it made me regret not coming here instead.

So if you want some yummy decent Steak and Eggs for the price. Definitely come here!

Also don't complain about the steak, it's $3.99 people so don't expect a steak from Donavon's. Lower your standards.

Decided to give this place a try on Friday for the crab legs and we arrived a little after 5pm. I noticed the dining area seemed full but not overly crowed and I was pleasantly surprised there was no line like we usually find on crab leg night at other places we've gone to.  We were seated right away and greeted by our waiter. We both order the crab legs with 2 sides I had the loaded baked potato and corn, my boyfriend chose the baked cinnamon apples and broccoli. He loved the baked cinnamon apples says they were cooked perfectly. The baked potato was a decent medium size and came with cheddar cheese, a strip of bacon, butter and sour cream and the corn came in a small sized bowl but filled. I thought the baked potato could have been hotter. They brought us each our own plate of crab legs and the plate of crab legs were a decent size but they didn't come out hot they were room temp and seemed a little soggy my boyfriend didn't agree he said his were fine, they were still good tho.

 I liked the touch of the tea light candle to keep your butter warm. They brought us each a second plate of crab legs before I could finish the first plate. I thought the second plate of crab legs was perfect they were warm and not at all soggy. The portion of the crab legs they bring to you is just right at least for us we were to full to get a third plate. 

I like the convenience of them bringing the crab legs to you and not having to get up to get more crab legs. Overall pretty good and I think from now on this is the go to spot for crab legs.

Just a few blocks away from the strip and a whole lot cheaper! We came here to have breakfast with my mom. It had great reviews and close to her place. I wouldn't say that this place was out of the world but it hit the spot and was on budget. Our table was full of plates of food. The hot cocoa and pancakes tasted great. Waiter was efficient but didn't come around all too often. 

Lots of locals which is always nice to get away from tourist. Parking lot is fairly empty late morning and just a short walk to Marilyn's when in the casino.

MMMM...that $5 steak. What a deal! We left EDC early for this deal, totally worth it! You have to ask for their steak special though since it isn't listed on their menu. I ordered medium rare steak and over easy eggs which comes with hash browns and toasts. YUUM!! So cheap and you get what you pay for! 
This place makes me happy because come on! nowadays, food is just overpriced and finding places that offer deals like this just makes me happy. The food is good and fulfilling; they give you more than what you pay for. Not to mention, the service is awesome too! KUDOS to the lady that served us that night! She was so nice! She made sure that we got what we ordered, went back a few times to check up on us and asked if we needed anything else. AWESOME deal and AMAZING staff? This place deserves 5 stars! Way to go, Marilyn's Cafe!! (:

Marilyn's is one of my favorite go-to breakfast/brunch spots in Vegas because it's the perfect amount of food for extremely fair prices! Friends I've brought here after a late night of adventures all agree that Marilyn's hits the spot! See you in October :)

Perfect for what we needed! Came for high school swim finals. The meet ran late and we needed a lot of solid good food at a low price. The school only gives the students a $15 allowance for each student. PERFECT! There's only a few items that are over! Large portions, hearty food and tasty. Plates came out full! Broccoli was abundant and well cooked but not seasoned. We had 14 people and they got us right in on a Saturday night at 9pm. This is going on the school list of great places to go in Vegas!
The service bad... and they take lot time for make the food... thats suck!! 45min??? I never come back
This place is chill. Their steak, eggs, hash brown, and toast break combo is $5.99. Pretty cheap and good. It's located in the Tuscany casino.
The food compliments the service. Kudos to Arnold, great customer service with a sense of humor. Food is reasonably priced. Overall good experience!

Horrible!! Run! The manager is (I'm sorry to say) a fucking idiot! When I complained about my food he said to our waiter "please take the coffee off their bill please" ha what a joke! Never again! Yuck! Everything is frozen and microwaved!!!

Doesn't matter if you make the best food in the world, because if the service is lousy the restaurant is lousy. I chose to come here on my birthday yesterday I have all the restaurants and hotels in the world at Tuscany Suites. I'm sorry I ever came-due to the unprofessional inattentive servers,
 I got no service no one took my order after 15 minutes, and I had to attend a show which was a total farce. (Because the performers at the rat pack is back we're different than the ones that I thought I was getting you could sing on key.)

I asked what do you do for birthdays and they said oh we do nothing. Marilyn's doesn't have one dessert listed on their menu and I asked pacifically bring me something cake or something with a candle they couldn't even do that!
Finally, after having the most un-festive birthday I ever paid for in history, I went back to Marilyn's  at one of the morning and the manager on duty found a massive dessert platter and put a candle on it and she sang happy birthday to me.
 Why the hell couldnt they have done that when they were supposed to?
 Why was I told they don't do anything for birthdays, no cake,  no ice cream etc?
Tasty, but random.  Do not order a chocolate shake it is kinda cold watery chocolate milk...  the pizza is good though.

The food here is pretty good, & we've eaten here a few times during our stay. The first 2 times we did have good service, the 3rd time our waitress was outstanding. I would've given a higher rating overall , although the last time, I phoned the restaurant to order for pickup. The first time calling a female answering the phone, placed me on hold for a good 7-8 mins without picking up again. I proceeded to call back only to have the same person place me on hold again, which seemed even longer this time! I stayed with the call as I thought maybe they're too busy...now I'm thinking they don't like phone orders.They don"t re-answer,. Not great customer service on calls, that's for sure.

This was my last meal before leaving the great city of Las Vegas. Some of the people in our group swore by it and I am so glad they made the recommendation. Like some of the other reviews, my only issue was the speed of service. But our waitress Patty was super cool and came back to check in on us pretty often.

Would love to experience this place after a long night out on the Strip, maybe next trip...

$4 steak and eggs..  Oh whaaaat?!

Yawp.  This spot has cheap ass steak and eggs for pennies on what you would probably spend in Vegas.  It's inside Tuscany Casino which isn't such a great spot but it's well worth the trek for after club/drinking grub.  

Now onto the flavor of the meal.  It is $4 steak and eggs.  It's not some prime cut ish you would find in a bitchin steak house.  But for the price you pay, you definitely get something well worth it.  Now, I will say that my opinion on the flavor may be a little biased and skewed cuz of the drunked taste buds that think almost everything tastes good.  But whenever I go to Vegas, this is a spot we end up going to at least once during the trip.

I have always liked Marilyn's Cafe.  The atmosphere is quiet and secluded from the rest of the Casino (The Tuscany).  I have never had any major problems here and I don't foresee any in the future.  Breakfast anytime you want it... cheap eats... and good service, what else do you want?  Here is my review from my last visit:

 - We walk up to the counter and we were seated right away.

 - Our drink order was taken and brought out promptly.

 - The waitress came over and took our order.  

  * Side note: I am not one that is really picky but, I eat Ultra Low Carb throughout the week.  So, I ordered a burger with no bun and instead of fries, I asked for a side of bacon.  Of course my friends gave me a little grief - as good friends do from time to time.  Or, in my case, all of the time.  

Anyhow, she, said it she'll look into it.  It turned out to be no problem and I was charged the regular price.

 - We had ample time between our courses.  So, there was no rushing through the salad / soup because our main meal was on it's way out.

 - Our drinks were always full.

 - We were checked up on periodically.  

 - She gave us the desert pitch before handing us our bill.  

This is the type of service I want and expect when I choose to eat out.  So, with all of that said, it was a pretty good experience to just hang out with a couple of friends and have a pretty decent meal.

I was leaving Las Vegas for an early morning flight to Chicago.  I had selected Marilyn's Café before the start of my trip and was glad I did. They are located within the Tuscany Hotel and Casino on Flamingo Ave off the Strip.  When I arrived at 4 30 am, it was very empty.  Table seating was instant and so was the table service.  I had ordered the "Big Winner" and it called that because it is a big breakfast!  2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, ham steak, toast or grits AND 2 pancakes!  Just what I needed because we all know the airlines don't serve food anymore.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food and it was NOT a late night special.  It is on their regular menu.

I been going to this place for the last 4 years. I like it because its not crowded, food is good, its cheap, and fast. Beats the heck out of Denny's and IHOP for sure.

I digg their breakfast menu, and especially their $3.99 steak and eggs deals in the graveyard hours 1am- 5am i think?

I wish these kinds of places existed in Irvine instead of franchises.

I was craving a big breakfast and I was not disappointed!!!  The prices are very reasonable and the portions are ample...  I was staying at the Palazzo and had to take a $10 taxi each way for this breakfast and it was better and cheaper than any breakfast I had all week at the Palazzo!

$3.99 steak and eggs! AMAZING! This is definitely where you'll find us after clubbin in Vegas. Like many said, the service is poor and slow... but hey, you can have steak, eggs, hash browns and toast for $5 (that's including tip and tax) Nothing hits the spot in Vegas quite like steak and eggs at Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany!

Marilyn's Café is located inside the Tuscany Suites Hotel.  It is their go-to restaurant for the hotel.  Basic food and should be easy to get in and out.  It was not.  The service was sub-par.  The wait staff seemed overworked and overloaded by the large groups we had.  The management knew there was a huge event in the hotel but didn't seem to book more staff to cover the overload.  

The staff were nice but just couldn't keep up. Plus, the management decided mid-stream that he would not allow split checks.  So, when we had had a split check one day, the next we couldn't.  

The food was basic diner food.  Nothing special.  But then, you don't need fancy for every meal in Vegas.  If the service had been better, we would have eaten there more.  After one particularly tedious two hour breakfast, we were over it and ate elsewhere for the rest of our stay.

$5.99 steak and eggs. Comes with toast and hash browns. Super delish after drinking and dancing at the club!

Service was fast and efficient. A+! I love hidden gems off the Vegas strip.

Really good food, and for the price you are paying, its a great deal! They give you a lot of portion of food for an affordable price. Its busy on weekends specially friday. Servers and busers are usually friendly and nice.

I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because our waitress was nice, but the management was horrible. 

I went for the all-you-can-eat crab on Friday with my coworkers and I'd have to say DON'T EVER GO WITH A GROUP FOR ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT CRABS. They don't split checks. There were 10 of us and the bill came to about $300. Once we went to the counter to pay, there was a sign that said they don't split checks. This sign was so hard to see considering how packed it was and people were almost always standing in front of it. 

We asked for the manager since we all had debit/credit cards to pay with. The manager first said that "the system" won't let them split checks on Fridays but any other day it will. We explained to him that were unable to pay unless it was separate. He, then, said he could split the check in two for us and told us to use the atm. This still was not going to work as none of us with credit cards were going to get a cash advance for this. He sighed and mumbled something under his breath with attitude and said he'll split the check in three for us. Since we still couldn't do this the waitress stepped in and said she would void the check and then separate it. The manager told her that the voided check would still come out of her taxes and she said it was ok. So this manager said fine and stormed off. 

We were there for about an hour just to pay for our check. I can't believe this place is getting business with such horrible management but I know I'm not going back again.

The wife and I both had the $6.99 steak, eggs, pancake special that offer from 6am - 11am M-F.  Tasty all around.  We were glad we walked down from the Westin.  Christina, our server, was very nice and attentive--5 stars for her.  Everything was great, but the hash browns really stood out.  Would go back again without hesitation for a hearty breakfast!

Two breakfast specials: All You Can Eat Pancakes for $3.99, or for $8.99, a 6 oz. NY Strip with 2 eggs, hash browns, pancakes or toast. I didn't think I had time today for the steak, so I opted for the pancakes. They were ready in short order and refills consisted of 2 additional pancakes at a time. The service was prompt and attentive. I think the music playing in the morning was post-disco, or the ratings would have been better; 5 stars instead of just 4 stars!

I didn't make it in this trip for the breakfast, but sampled a steak for a mid afternoon meal.

12oz NY Strip & 6 shrimp.l ($16.99).

Ordered medium rare, the steak came out cooked to order, seasoned right and tasty.  The shrimp were good as well. Available fried or grilled (I chose grilled), they were plump, not over cooked and alao seasoned deliciously. 

It was served with two sides of which there are about 20 choices ranging from veggies, fried stuff, loaded Baked Potato and so on.

Service is always good.

If you're here for the first time, try visiting for breakfast.

I think my expectations for this restaurant were a little to high.... for someone who was completely sober and hungry at 6:00a. I ordered 1 multi- grain pancake with fruit. I literally waited 25 minutes for 1 pancake. It was 100% tasteless. I even douzed it in syrup and butter to taste a little flavor... still nothing. Service friendly but definetly not efficient.

If I could put negative stars I would.

I came here based on the good reviews, I was severely disappointed. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my fiancé ordered the steak and eggs. While my fiancé said the steak was good, that is where the compliments end. I also ordered the corned-beef hash which arrived with a big long blonde hair in it. Needless to say I was disgusted. My server looked at me and asked if I wanted a new one. No apology, no visit from the manager. Nothing. I said no thank you and tried to eat the rest of my food. My fiancé had ordered a bagel, which after asking two times never showed up. After pointing this out to our server she appeared to realize her tip was in jeopardy and wrote us off. With an eye-roll she walked away and did not come back to refill drinks or ask how our food was. My food was cold and a bit salty. Another friend of ours got the fires with gravy. He stated they were just "ok". 

I am really not getting all the positive reviews for this place. Service was awful, managers were MIA, no attempt to remedy the problems or care that we were happy in the slightest. Avoid at all costs. There are way too many choices in Vegas to settle for this mediocrity.
