Food was amazing!  Try the apple spread thing, whatever it was called.  Hashbrowns are usually bad at restaurants but this place knows what they're doing.  I would've never known about this place without Yelp.

Stopped by there for breakfast.  Basic breakfast food nothing special.

The service was pretty good.  

This would be a 3 star review because it was just good nothing really special at all.... the typical casino cafe.  The reason for a one star bump is because it was somewhat cheaper than other places for breakfast.

So - decent breakfast very reasonably priced with good service.

The best prime rib deal in Las Vegas.  Prime Rib 10oz with two sides for $14.  If your Filipino like me, they have white rice as a side.  Yes, a medium rare prime rib with white rice, au jus and horseradishes is a Filipinos dream.

This place is an awesome breakfast spot. Mostly because the prices are unbeatable anywhere else near the strip and the quality of food is pretty good. Great low key spot to go to for a hearty breakfast after a night of partying or a great spot for medium size groups. family friendly environment.  All you can eat pancakes for like $4, perfect right? There's not much trills as far as décor or atmosphere. It is what it is. A good food spot for somebody that's hungry. Note: I only went here for breakfast so can't speak on lunch or dinner.

You go here for one reason and one reason only.

$3.99 Steak & Eggs after midnight. They don't advertise it, you just gotta hear about it. It's like a secret club @ the Tuscany that all the Asians hit up after a night of hardcore partying. & boy, does it hit the spot. $3.99, what a freakin' steal! No wonder the asians flock here.

Usually this place is great for the price of $19.99 for Ayce crab legs. But  today no so. Legs were cold, butter dish had a chip and crack and should not have put on table. 

Server gave the impression that he wish he was not there. I usually have good service here.

The big deal was the price has increased by $5.00.

Only worth it because I can walk there.
 But then again maybe not.
Good stuff. The prime rib special was great. The 10 oz portion has to have been at least 14 oz. I left stuffed and happy.

4am, alcohol induced munchies, $3.99 steak and eggs. 
Enough said. 



No but really-- prompt & friendly service, deliciously cheap grub, and the price! This is where I go for steak and eggs when I'm too lazy for a trip to downtown. 


Quick tip: don't be sober.

Stopped by for a late dinner before retiring to our room next door. Was really amazed by the portion sizes and cost. Was a good price with plenty of food. We ate and had left offers to bring home. 
The service was really nice and quick. 
Definitely coming back before we head home.

I ate here 3 times on a recent trip to Vegas. Had I not been staying at the Tuscany, I would have never gone back after the first trip.

Twice I went for breakfast. I will say the hash browns were good, but that is the only thing that was good. They use a disgusting version of cheddar cheese that tasted like powder and was almost not edible. The pancakes were obviously sitting in the heat lamp too long and the top of the top pancake was hard as a rock (and the plate was extremely hot which is usually a sign of heat lamp exposure).

The third time we went for dinner. I was between the chicken fried steak, the chicken cordon blue and the ribs. The waiter told me not to get the chicken fried steak (never a good sign when the waiter tells you not to eat something), and another guest told me not to have the chicken cordon blue. So by process of elimination I was stuck with the ribs which were also bad.

The ribs came with two sides. I chose the mashed potatoes which were okay but the mac and cheese was absolutely horrible. Probably because they use the same cheese as I had on my eggs at breakfast. Guess I should have anticipated that. Another person at my table also had the mac and cheese and also hated it.

The service was okay for a coffee shop, but overall, this place is crap. I will never go back.

Breakfast was great.  I got 3 scrambled eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage links, hash browns and 2 pancakes.  I asked for my scrambled eggs to be cooked "soft" and the waiter understood what I wanted. Just about every restaurant I go in and ask this, the waiter questions me as to what I want.  And when I got my food, my eggs were just like I wanted and tasted very good.  Hash browns we're much better than other breakfast restaurants.  Brown and yet tender--very good.   Bacon and sausage we're just ok.  Pancakes were light and fluffy with very good flavor.  I recommend this restaurant for breakfast.

I AM IN LOVE!!!!

this is the place to eat! they have STEAK, 2 EGGS, TOAST, AND HASH BROWN FOR ONLY $4.99 are you kidding me??? not only was the price so cheap but the steak was soo juicy and tender. i am drooling as i type. the $4.99 special is only from midnight thru 5 am but we like to come here after our night outs! the regular price is $12.99 for this meal but we actually went back the morning after and ordered the same plate again... it was that good! i would recommend this place to EVERYONE! i wish this place was around my area! the lines are never too long and all the servers here are spectacular !!!

This is a review for take-out only.  I stopped by at 8:00pm on a Friday night and the cafe was BUSY!  They do have a take-out counter where you can order separately.

I ordered a MYO omelet with onions, turkey sausage and provolone.  Hashbrowns and wheat toast on the side.  The waitress said it would be 15-20 minutes, so I went back to my room, dropped off my stuff and came back.  When I returned, my food was ready to go.

The omelette was terrific.  With tax it worked out to just under ten bucks.  Easily the best non-mexican food deal that I found on this trip.  Hash browns were average, as was the toast. 

Next time I'm staying at the Tuscany, I'll definitely stop in.

Great alternative to waiting in a long line at Ellis Island for almost the same exact $5.99 steak and eggs deal! 

I found the steak to be much better here because it has a less burnt taste compared to Ellis Island. The only thing I didn't really like were the hashbrowns.

Love this place! Marilyns cafe has a little bit of everything on the menu. I myself prefer going Friday evenings for all you can eat crab legs for 16.95. Service is always fast and friendly. Aldo the assistant manager is such a sweet heart. He always makes sure that everyone is taken care of and is happy with the service and quality of food. 
I recommend this cafe
Five stars for their $5.99 Steak and Eggs! Especially after midnight! Definitely cures your drunchies.
Really good, inexpensive breakfast. I had the 8.99 steak and eggs breakfast. The service was also very good. I would definitely recommend this place

$6 for two eggs any style, hash brown, 2 slices of toast, and steak prepared any way you like it? I'm in! This place is the place to go when you're in Vegas. I definitely recommend this place after a night of clubbing or drinking because this place is open 24/7 and it's super cheap! 

This restaurant has great service and is customer friendly! The restaurant is located in the Tuscany hotel and casino a little off the strip but I highly recommend it for those who like to eat late!

Came here for the steak and eggs like everyone else. I was kind of disappointed. From the pictures that I had seen of the meal, it looked WAY better in pictures than in real life. The steak was really fatty and not very tasty, but hey it's a damn cheap meal and I'm fine with that after being out all night.

Been eating here for years but hadn't stopped by since 2011. Had the prom rib at 9:30 pm and yuk. Tastes microwaved as did the potato.  What happens to this place. Provably should have stuck to my old fav, the steak.

Wow, I'm speechless at the fact that they serve Steak and Eggs for so cheap! I paid about less than $5. I definitely would suggest to anyone to come here if you're in Vegas drunk and craving steak and eggs. 

The service here was good. Nothing to complain about really, but the fact that the table smelled pretty bad when we got seated. I don't know what they use to wipe down the tables and or if it's their table cloth they use. It smelled really bad. It didn't take long at all to get seated for my group party of 11. Also it didn't take long for the food to come. The server didn't give us a hard time at all. There was more food that sounded delicious on the menu, but steak and egg did me good and was very satisfying.

But like I said, if you're ever in the mood for steak and egg definitely come by and check this restaurant out.

Came here for the late night/early morning special. I ordered the steak and eggs with a side of bacon & white rice. This was my first time here. I usually go to south point for steggs (steak & eggs) but a friend of mines recommend that I go here. Let me start off by saying that it looks nice and decent. 

Food 8/10- The steak and eggs came with hash browns and toast. The steak was a good portion for me. I have a small appetite. The white rice was really hard. Being Asian rice is everything and with that being said I was disappointed that the rice wasn't really "edible". Also, I noticed that my other two friends who also ordered rice had a different portion of it. One friend had a nice scoop of it nicely on a plate, while I had mines scattered and half the size of his portion. My other friend had only more than half of my size of rice and it looked like the rice was old and leftover. They tried to trick us is into thinking all the rice was the same by not arranging it into a scoop like my one friend. 

Service 6/10- We came here after an event. I felt like everyone kept giving us weird looks because we were "kids". The only guy that was nice and friendly was the one who served us our drinks. Our lady server was ok. I felt like she was annoyed and tried to rush everything. When we got our food, I asked if we could have soy sauce and she quickly left, which didn't get me the chance to ask for lemons.When she got back I asked if we could have lemons also & she asked in a very irritated voice "do you need anything else?!". I felt like she was only acting nice just to get good tip & wasn't genuinely nice or didn't really care about us at all. 
Overall, I'm not really sure if I would come back... Maybe....

Stayed at Tuscany hotel and casino while we were in Vegas and this cafe was in the casino.

The best part about it is that it is open 24 hours! So no matter what time of day it is, you can get some decent food that isn't way over priced.

The first visit was for brunch and I have to say their breakfast food is better than their lunch or dinner. I believe breakfast is served all day is the option is always there. For lunch I ordered their prime rib dip with a side of fries. And like I said, it's alright. Their margarita pizza had no basil on it so I have to say I was quite disappointed with that one.

Our servers were nice and honestly I didn't mind coming here everyday since it was so convenient. Would stay here again.

4 star food. 2 star service. Average score of 3 stars.

Food came out very slowly. Room wasnt packed and we still waited 1 hour.

Server forgot water and napkins on 2 separate occasions and rarely checked in on us.

If the food was faster, its be a 4 average but for some reason a 5 top that got seated after us was served 20 minutes before we were.

Steggs.

That's pretty much all I need to say about this place (joking), but honestly though. Whenever I'm trying to sober up from a night of drinking, this place comes on top of the list next to two others. Besides the actually steak and eggs themselves, I love that this place is located near the Strip. It comes in handy when you've spend a long night drinking whether it be in a club or at a hotel party. 

The ONLY thing that keeps it from becoming a full 5 stars is the fact they have a certain time limit and day when parties aren't able to do split checks which kind of makes it inconvenient when you're sobering up and forgot to carry cash on you and your card limit has been completely maxed out due to heavy drinking.

All in all, definitely a good sober up place.

I guess when you're drunk at 4 am and need a lil' somethin' for your tummy to soak up excess alcohol that you chugged several hours ago, Marilyn's is your place. STEGGS all day err'day~

I don't remember much from this experience because alcohol and lack of sleep don't mix well and I fell asleep waiting for my food. BUT, when it came, the steak was delicious. And the eggs. And the hashbrowns. I'm surprised I was able to finish everything!!

Service is SLOW SLOW SLOW. We played at the tables while waiting to be seated. I mean, it was early in the morning and there wasn't a huge party but of course, they want you to spend some time gambling. LOL i c ur strategy. Waiting for our food took FOREVER but since I took a mini nap, it was ok.

This place we thoroughly enjoyed, we could not believe how low the prices were, and the service was amazing! 
The T-Bone special was ridiculously huge and cheap! The basket of Zucchini that we ordered for an appetizer was enough for five people and it was only $4.99, it was delicious!!! The side salad that came with my meal I enjoyed so much it was like $1.99 seriously crazy prices from the 70's I'm not complaining, the next night I ordered the same salad with a small pizza. The pizzas we ordered and took back to the room, damn amazing!!!! Love this restaurant and hotel, we stayed three nights with no complaints!

This was a fantastic find! The walk was totally worth it. It just goes to show that you sometimes pay a premium for places on the strip that isn't even worth it. Vegas city blocks are long, but this one is a few away from the strip. We came here for breakfast, and it was delicious and I believe correctly priced for food and the overall value. The staff was on point. While one hostess was helping a customer paying the bill at the register, another one saw us to get us seated at a table. They seem to work well together noticing when refills were needed for beverages. I like that my chicken and waffles were tenders. It's been slightly annoying for me as of late to have to pick apart the chicken from bones. I am pretty sure that if I come back to Vegas again I would definitely stop in here for another meal. My boyfriend actually went back again the next day for breakfast.

Very affordable, great breakfast. Take an Uber to save steps for somewhere else.
I was looking for affordable food on a sunday morning. 
Worth the the extra mile.

We have been here many times over the years.

 Before moving to Vegas we use to come stay at Tuscany and we would eat here all the time. When we moved to Vegas we would come for the  AUCE  crab legs. 

We started going when they were much cheaper and they have been raising it up since. Still not bad of a price. We use to wonder how they were doing it for so much less.

We have had breakfast, lunch and dinner here and never had any complaints.  The prices are reasonable and its a good place if your staying at Tuscany.
Good food. Good value. Good service. Enough said :) The only downfall is that it's not close to home...

Seriously go somewhere else. The service sucks incredibly bad. For one we waited forever at the hostess stand without even a greeting or asking how many are in our party & telling us the wait time like most places do. Instead many employees went to the stand and ignored us and others waiting. Like we weren't even there. 
Then after finally seated,  I kid you not... 20 minuttes of awkwardly sitting there before a server came and got our drink order. Prob took another 10 min to get drinks to us. The Orange juice was nasty & server forgot my water I asked for. Tried drinking the OJ anyway but really it wasn't good so I asked for the water again. Water... even worse! But that might be a Vegas tap water issue...  Tasted like dirty water. Anyway, We had already read the menu so ordered when we put our drink order in. The food was decent but not amazing or anything.  Resturant was cute and reasonably priced. Those are the only good things I noticed about this place and I try to be a very positive yelper. They were busy-ish but still had many open tables so I don't know what the deal was here...

8:20am on a Tuesday. Two greeters can't figure out where to seat a party of 4. While they have 50+ menu it wasn't offered. Long wait for table service, but good when it showed up. Square coffee cups; strange. Pricing is very reasonable.

Came here during bsides/defcon week, so this place was definitely more packed than usual. However, a restaurant this size should always be prepared regardless of crowd size, and waiting 40+ minutes after ordering for our food is not acceptable.  For a casino, food wasn't terribly expensive, but it wasn't anything great either. The prime rib melt was eh, nothing extraordinary but still okay. Tequitos and fried zucchini were a little disappointing,  but their burrito special seemed filling. If the service was better, I'd probably bump my review up 1 to 1.5 stars..

I am staying here at the Tuscany Suites for the first time and was glad that they had a 24 hour restaurant on site. Unfortunately, the wait staff is completely rude and forgetful. They will gladly seat you without ever sending a waiter over. They do not smile during service and only come around to take your order, drop the food off, and pick up the plates. No refills and no inquiries as to how the experience is going.

Took a walk to this nice little restaurant. I was surprised at how nice and clean this place was. It was very nice. I got the omlete George with turkey and was surprised how delicious it was. My wife had Belgian waffle, aside from the pretty slow service breakfast was delicious.

STEAK AND EGGS.  The one thing you have to do in Vegas is get steak and eggs at like 3am.  

We came on Friday night after XS.  Driving it isn't too far from the strip, about 5 minutes or so and plenty of parking.  It's located in the Tuscany hotel and casino.

PARKING: Free, huge parking lot.

ATMOSPHERE: Has that denny's/ihop feel to it but we got a big booth for 8 of us and were seated right away.

FOOD: Coming at 2:30am they had the steak and eggs special.  I didn't see it on the menu but just ask for it and the waiter will get it for you.  I think it was $4.99 or $5.99 but either way very cheap.  Ask for it more rare than you normally order it because it is pretty thin and they tend to overcook the meat.  I got medium rare and it was only pink.  

The platter comes with steak, 2 eggs, hash browns and 4 pieces of toast (you can choose).  I got the eggs over easy and they were runny but not gross.  I got sourdough toast, where they put the butter on it for you and it was SO GOOD.  The hash browns were tasty, not bland and hard but still hot and crispy.

The steak was OK, as you can imagine for such a cheap price, but the flavoring wasn't bad.  It was just slightly tough.

Overall, definitely a must for your trip to Vegas.

Good menu selections and open 24 hours. Always has a nice breakfast. The servers are very friendly and attentive. We were even staying at a differentnt hotel (only because of availability) and came back here to eat each day. We like the players club discount for over 50 of 20%. We will be back!

This place is by far one of my favorite places for daily late night happy hour specials on their food. They have a deal for endless pancakes for about $3 , a monster cheeseburger with fries for about $5 and my one and only regular order that I always get is the steak and eggs special for around $5. Other casinos that offer special cheap deals like this that I tried I was very disappointed overall with quality of the food and service and atmosphere but here at Marilyn's cafe you get great food made the way you ordered correctly. Very friendly and attentive servers and clean atmosphere.
Their food is good and affordable plus have variety service is kinda slow and not highly motivated but it's good

Crab legs were on everyone's minds tonight. We only had snacks on the way to Las Vegas today so we were ready to eat. 

At 9:45pm, the line took 5 minutes and they still seemed busy. John, our first server, was close to ending his shift and rushed us through the ordering process. When we got our food it was barely warm and drinks had to be requested twice. We were not impressed. I didn't know what to say to the family as I remember the cafe as being quite good for the price. We ordered a second round of crab plates when John disappeared without a word. No waiter, no crab, no drink refills. 

I was about to approach the manager. And another waiter saw my distress. James saved the day. He has a smile, customer skills, and took responsibility for making the rest of our dining an event and fun. He was there with drinks, hot sides of potato chips, and steaming hot tasty plates of crab. Thanks Marilyn's Cafe. We had a great time. John almost lost the place a few customers. But thanks to James and Sonia for making it pleasant. 

On Fridays, arrive early (at 4pm) or late (just before 10pm ). The staff said the wait can be up to 2 hours otherwise. Ask for James and tip him well, hard worker.

Wife and I were looking for a good breakfast, but something more affordable than the $40 per person buffets at the Wynn and the like. 

Marilyn's had good reviews, and was a $8 cab ride from where we were staying, so we made the trip.

It's inside the casino at the Tuscan hotel, and the restaurant itself is a perfect match for the food - simple, comfortable, and good. 

My wife had the meet lovers bowl, and I had the NY steak and eggs. The food came quick, the temperature was good, and almost everything tastes great. 

The only food item I didn't like was the steak, as it lacked flavor - very bland. But the grits and eggs and toast were all so good, I kind of ignored it. 

The service was fast and friendly, and we recommend Marilyn's to anyone looking for a decent breakfast at a decent price.

3 steak and eggs and a fruit cup for $15? YES PLEASE. Late night cheap eats for after-clubbing food orgasms. Eggs (scrambled) were a bit tasteless and overcooked to me, and the steak could have been rarer/less dry, but hey...decent portion for a great price. Nothing more to say! Oh and plenty of sauces/dressings to douse the dryness out of the steak if need be!

Another friend in town and stayng on the strip...need to find someplace nearby and not overly priced or overly crowded. Who do I turn to...YELP! TADA...Marilyn's Cafe is chosen as the nearest and bestest in reviews.  So we meet here on a Sunday morning and the place is packed.  

Pros: Hostesses were very polite and professional. 
Food was good and very cheap. I got the Big WInner and I ate half of it. It came with pancakes, sausages, bacon, hash brown, eggs n toast. Oh and ham...
Server was polite and server's assistant punctual as he got us drinks asap.
Busy-which is always a good sign.

Cons: Server never checked back with us, until it was time to drop the bill.
No refills on water, juice?
They gave us a highchair that had a broken strap which someone tried to fix by stapling them together? Really? Little kids sit in them..use your brain!

Would I give this place another try. Sure, why not. Cheap food and it was quick. I just won't ask for a high chair, and if I need anything I'll just get it when I order my food...
Food is delicious , ended up going back the next day for breakfast. The staff is awesome and very kind. Would definitely recommend it .

All the cool people know where to get good $5 steak & eggs... And that's at Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany hotel and casino off the strip!

A perfect place to grab some food after partying all night at the nightclub.

Hardly any wait to get seated. 
Service is quick and friendly. 
Good for big groups. 
They open late night.

$5 steak and eggs and it comes with hash browns and toast. Good deal! 

***FYI you cannot get the $5 deal if you order the meal for take-out!!! Or else you pay regular price 

***And another tip: It's difficult to get a taxi to pick you up at Tuscany, so I suggest using Uber or Lyft!
Not worth it. We ordered the pork chops and they were so dry we couldn't finish them. The place is understaffed so service is extremely slow. Don't recommend this business.

If you are looking for the ultimate nums after the club or for a late night meal, this is THEEEE place to go! Steak and eggs for 3.99, kind staff, and minimal wait? What more need i say? I go here just for steak and eggs at least 3 times a month. I definitely recommend this place!
WHOA. Steak and eggs. So cheap. It's ONLY whopping $5.99!!! Great drunchies for sure!! The best part, I didn't go when i was drunk. But it was that goodddd for the price! Check it out :)

Love the senior menu (50+) with variety of items for each meal (breakfast, dinner, all day 24/7 !!! Great breakfast and other meal selections, found something for everyone on the regular menu at good prices. Loved loved loved the senior menu which includes steak and eggs, turkey dinner. Hidden gem off the strip (mini hike to the Strip on Flamingo) in a cute Tuscan-style hotel. Will have to look into staying here next time ! Graveyard special on steak and eggs at $5.99, but that's too late for us to eat a big meal. We liked the rest of the menu to come back a few times this trip !! Had a late dinner here last night, already thinking of going back TODAY !! Maybe we'll take some pix before wolfing it down (today?) good size portions too !
